loans.name: Fatima Group

texts.es: El grupo “Fatima” Esta representado por la señora Rosmery  y conformado por 12 miembros  D. personas muy trabajadoras y con ganas D. salir adelante, cada una D. ellas trabaja en diferentes áreas como la comercial vendiendo comida, carne, ropa, joyas hechas a mano, masitas y al servicio D. serigrafía, peluquería, y al transporte libre. En cuanto a la competencia existe demanda ya que las socias cuentan con puntos D. venta establecidos y  en calles D. una zona muy comercial. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. mercadería, nuevas herramientas y para la ampliación D. sus puestos D. venta. En cuanto a informes crediticios  las socias  presentaron las referencias correspondientes  para acceder al crédito otorgado por nuestra institución además que algunas ya participaron en anteriores grupos y decidieron formar un grupo D. nuevo con gente con ganas D. trabajar.
texts.en:
The “Fatima” group is represented by Rosmery and is maD. up of 12 members who are very hardworking and have a desire to get ahead. Each member works in a different area. Some of these are: sales of food, meat, clothing, handmaD. jewelry, and cakes. Others offer services, such as silkscreen printing, hair styling, and transport.

The retail businesses are quite competitive, as they have established sales posts in a commercial district. This loan is for the purchase of merchandise and tools, and to improve their sales stalls.

The group members have presented the references necessary to access the credit offered by the lending institution. Some of the members have also participated in prior lending groups, but decided to form this new group where everyone wants to work.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise, tools, and improvement of sales stalls

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 25-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon. Walid owns a barbershop. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Walid has requested a loan.
Walid is special in his work because he is known for his good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He is dependent on himself and does his best to improve his work. Walid decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Zaher

texts.en: Zaher is a 28 year old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon. Zaher has been working as a furniture maker since 1996. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work, in the hopes of improving his work. This is the first time that Zaher has requested a loan. Zaher is known for his good work and his clients are his friends and neighbors, among others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Zaher decided to become a furniture maker because he wanted to be able to work independently.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Ehen Bi Apuei Group

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. All of her children are in school thanks to the proceeds from her business. Mary is a seamstress and has been sewing for twenty years now. She is a specialist in female wears, and her skills and designs are of class. She sews a variety of styles which give her customers a new look, including kids school uniforms, church attire, kaba and slit, wedding dresses and funeral clothes. She would like to use the requested loan money to buy sewing supplies such as linen, thread and thimbles in order to increase her output and efficiency. Through her dedication and hard work she now has six apprentices; the quality training she provides will benefit them in their future endeavours. Mary hopes to increase her savings to provide her children with quality education. She needs the loan for the Christmas season so she will be able to increase her profits thanks to the increase in customer demand for dresses during this festive time. 

Mary is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Ehen Bi Apuei’. She is the one standing in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers. In this group, members act as guarantors for one another, providing social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay it. The group would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies to increase her output and efficiency.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Mr. Samuel K.  works as a tailor in his shop in Ibanda town along Jubilee Street. He is 36 years old and is requesting a loan to purchase more material to make different clothing designs in order to attract more customers. He wishes to expand his services so that he can sell as many designs (clothes) as he can for profit. He has been in the tailoring business for almost 11 years. Samuel is a married man with two children aged seven and three. His seven year old is currently in school.

loans.use: To purchase more material to make different clothing designs.

loans.name: Bellas Flores Group

texts.es: El grupo “Bellas F.” esta representado por las señora Georgina  y conformado por 12 miembros D. socios muy trabajadores como lo han demostrado en sus cinco últimos ciclos demostrando unidad, apoyo y responsabilidad en cada uno D. ellos. Cada uno D. los socios se encuentra creciendo mas cada día en sus negocios D. venta como la presidenta que ya tiene su local D. expendio D. comida, venta D. verdura, cotillones, centros D. llamadas, y comidas al paso como api con pasteles, anticuchos y hamburguesas. La existencia D. la competencia en el mercado es granD. pero las socias saben como salir adelante. El destino del financiamiento es para agrandar sus negocios con la compra D. mesas para su atención en sus locales o expendios D. comidas, adquisición D. insumo y herramientas para mejorar mas aun sus ingresos ya que su crecimiento implica un mayor esfuerzo para seguir creciendo para mejor las vidas D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The Bellas F. Group, represented by Ms. Georgina, is comprised of 12 members who have demonstrated that they are hard-working, unified, supportive, and responsible during their last five loan cycles. The members’ businesses are growing every day. For example, the president of the group now has her own food store. Other businesses incluD. vegetable markets, party supply stores, call shops, and selling street food, such as api (a drink maD. from purple corn) and pastries, anticuchos (grilled meat on skewers), and hamburgers. Competition in the market is stiff, but these group members know how to get ahead. The loan will be used to expand their businesses by purchasing tables for their shops, and obtaining supplies and work tools to boost profits even more because their business growth implies a greater effort to continue growing in order to improve the lives of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eki

texts.en:
Eki is a hairstylist and she also sells hair extensions and rechargeable phone cards. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She has been in this business for five years.

Eki is 30 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a businessman. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more hair extensions and rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 33 year-old man who lives in Tripoli, north Lebanon. Since 2002, Mahmoud has had a cleaning service. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and cleaning products for his work. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his work. Mahmoud is special in his work because he does it well and his clients are satisfied. His clients are his friends, neighbors and traders. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties since he had a good network. Mahmoud decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding.

loans.use: To purchase tools and cleaning products.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is forty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Georgina is a trader. She trades in firewood. Georgina buys the firewood from nearby communities and supplies food vendors in her community. Georgina has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy firewood in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana is thirty-three years old. She is married and has two children, both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. Juana is a seamstress by profession. She designs and sews in a shop by the roadside in her community. She has five apprentices under training. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy fabrics and other sewing accessories so she can grow her business.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Mrs. A. Jane is a cattle keeper in Kooki Cell; she has cows and goats. She is age thirty-two, and she is requesting a loan to purchase more livestock for her farm. She is a really ambitious woman blessed with two children, both going to school. She is trying to invest for the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock for her farm

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Flores” esta representado por la señora Carmen Rosa  y conformado por 13 miembros de gente trabajadora y capaz, todas cuentan con negocio propio la mayoría se dedica a vender productos cosméticos, otras venden comida, otras como la presidenta se dedica a el servicio de estilismo a domicilio y algunas a la venta de flores. La competencia en estos días esta mas difícil por la misma situación del país por lo que las socias deben esforzarse mas para llevar el pan de cada día a sus hogares. El  crédito esta destinado a adquirir más ebriedad de productos y para aumentar sus herramientas para un trabajo más eficiente. Su expectativa para el futuro es mejorar en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus familias. Algunas ya tienen experiencia con este tipo de créditos otras están conociendo por primera vez la modalidad de grupos solidarios pero se encuentran entusiasmadas por trabajar juntas para salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Las Flores Group, represented by Ms. Carmen Rosa, is comprised of 13 hard-working and capable members. They all run their own businesses. The majority sells cosmetics, but others sell fast food. Other members, like the president, provide in-home hair styling services, while others sell flowers. Competition is stiffer these days because of the situation that the country is in, which is why the group members have to work harder to bring home the daily bread. The loan will be used to obtain a greater variety of products and to increase their work tools so that the group members can do their job more efficiently. Their hope for the future is to improve their businesses and provide a better quality of life for themselves and their families. Some of the members have experience with these types of loans, while others are learning to work in solidarity groups for the first time. However, they are all very enthusiastic about working together to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Manoweil

texts.en:
Manoweil is a 43 year-old man who lives in Tripoli, north Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Since 2001, Manoweil has been working as a carpenter. He also works as a furniture painter. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work and to pay for his children’s school. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and traders. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Manoweil decided on doing his business because his likes it. In the future, he plans on expanding.

loans.use: To purchase tools.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is a forty-eight-year-old divorced mother of three children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town. However, the majority of the inhabitants farm as a hobby or as a major occupation alongside other trading activities. Christiana is a trader. She trades in foodstuff—yam, cassava, etc. She buys the goods from nearby communities and treks to sell them. She also sells at the local market to food vendors in her community. Christiana has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff

loans.name: Pama

texts.en: Pama is 35 years-old and happily married with two children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the home. She sells tubers of yams at retail prices to her customers. She is a hard working woman and she is determined to excel in her business. She has been in this business for seven years. She hopes to be a distributor of yams in her community in Benin City, Edo state. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more yams to sell. She said that the profits will help out her family. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 30 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Ibrahim has been working as a carpenter and a furniture repairer since 1999. He repairs old furniture and even produces new furniture; he furnishes rooms such as bedrooms and living rooms. Ibrahim requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new wood machine for his work. This is the first time that Ibrahim has requested a loan. 

Ibrahim is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and does a good job. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he had difficulty networking to build a client base and had some financial issues. Ibrahim decided to continue his business because he wanted to have an independent source of income. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new wood machine for his work.

loans.name: Ye Bi Ma Group

texts.en:
Alice is married and the mother of six children. She is 43 years-old and a trader in clothing materials. She trades in lace materials, textiles and clothing. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. She also sells cooking utensils. For lack of adequate working capital, she buys little stock and sells in the community market. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she plans to purchase bulk cooking utensils, lace materials and textiles. She hopes to use part of her profit to expand her store.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called "Ye bi ma" which means to give support. She is the one standing in the middle in the group photograph. The members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan. The group is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase bulk supplies.

loans.name: Candelaria Group

texts.es: El grupo “Candelaria” esta representado por la señora Reyna Marlen y conformada por 14  miembros los cuales van cursando su primer ciclo demostrando ganas para crecer y salir adelante. Las socias tienen diferentes actividades como la venta D. productos como venta D. ropa deportiva, comida rápida, venta D. pelotas para todos los deportes, salchichas y abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio.  El comercio en este grupo es muy variado, su nivel D. ventas es muy bueno, teniendo buena rentabilidad y capacidad D. pago a pesar D. existir bastante competencia.  El crédito esta destinado al incremento D. su capital, esperan mejorar sus ventas  y el crédito será invertido en la compra D. más mercadería que será utilizado para generar mayores ganancia para poder otorgarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida y un futuro mas prometedor a sus hijos que son su razón para seguir adelante. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia los socios ya trabajaron atentes en instituciones financieras similares a la Fundación Agrocapital a la que están muy agradecidos por la confianza y el apoyo económico brindado.
texts.en:
The Candelaria Group, represented by Ms. Reyna Marlen, is comprised of 14 members who are in their first loan cycle, demonstrating the desire to grow and get ahead. The members own different types of businesses, such as selling sports apparel, fast food, balls for all kinds of sports, sausages, and provisions in neighborhood general stores. Sales are high and the businesses are very lucrative, which means that the members can repay their loan despite all the competition. The loan will be used to increase their capital. They hope to boost sales. They will purchase more merchandise in order to increase their profits to be able to offer their families a better quality of life and a brighter future, which is why they keep pushing forward. Regarding their loan experience, the group members have previously worked with other financial institutes similar to Fundación Agrocapital, to which they are very grateful for the trust and support they have given them.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa is 48 years-old. She is married and has given birth to four children. All her children are in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming and commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Adwoa is a trader in second hand clothes. She hawks to sell in her community. Adwoa has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure bales of textiles in bulk to increase her stock. She desires to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy textiles.

loans.name: Asinath

texts.en:
N. Asinath is a promising lady, twenty-eight years old, who owns a grocery shop located in Kabwohe trading centre and has lived and worked there for over five years. She is requesting the loan to invest more in her business, that is to say soap, Jik (disinfectant), toilet paper, and so forth for sale.

Asinath is married with three children and expects to provide the best for them. She is a happy and active businesswoman whose hope is to have a self-sufficient business.

loans.use: To purchase soap, Jik, toilet paper, and so forth to sell

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is a twenty-nine-year-old widowed mother of one child who is in school. She lives with her daughter in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town but the majority of the inhabitants practice farming as a hobby or as a major occupation alongside other trading activities.

Lillian is a trader. She trades in food items such as vegetables, yams, cassava, etc. She buys the goods from nearby communities and treks to supply. She also sells at the local market to food vendors in her community.

Lillian has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 34-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children.

Hassan has been working as a blacksmith for nine years. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a machine for his work. This machine will help him improve his quality of work. This is his third loan and he has always repaid on time.

Hassan’s previous loan helped his improve his work by being more efficient and he is special in his work because of his efficiency. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition but decided on doing his work because of his experience and he wanted to improve his financial situation.

In the future, Hassan plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for his work

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 49 years-old and married with three children. Her husband is a teacher. She is very happy because her eldest child is already a graduate. She sells drinks, food and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She is a focused and hard worker. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 60,000 to purchase more groceries, food and drinks to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, food and drinks.

loans.name: James

texts.en: Mr. M. James is a promising man of thirty years-old.  He has a retail shop selling mattresses. The business is located at the Kabwohe trading centre and he has worked in the area for two years. He is planning to use the loan to purchase more mattresses in order to have a larger stock to better meet the demands of his customers. He also has a plantation which sometimes helps him generate income to care for his family. His future hope is to increase his inventory.

loans.use: To purchase mattresses.

loans.name: Hamdalatu

texts.en: Hamdalatu is 33 years-old and married with four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town. However, the majority of the inhabitants farm as a hobby or as a major occupation alongside other trading activities. Hamdalatu is a utensil trader.  She sells at the local market and also travels to other communities to sell on their market days. Hamdalatu buys the goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy all kinds of utensils to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy utensils.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 35 year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Mouhamad has been running a big generator for five years. This generator allows several apartments to have electricity when there is an electricity cut off. Since in his region there is a lot of cut offs, he wants to expand his business to provide electricity to more houses. Mouhamad is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase diesel and do some maintenance work on his generator. This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Mouhamad first started his business, he had to face competition. Mouhamad decided on doing his work because of his experience and he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase diesel and do some maintenance work on his generator.

loans.name: Jesus Never Fails Group

texts.en:
Esther is 52 years-old and is married with nine children. All her nine children are currently in school from tertiary to primary level respectively.. She works hard to support her husband in taking care of the home. She is a manufacturer and producer of palm oil. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits. The palm oil is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil which is used to prepare many local dishes such as fried fish, local soaps and pastries. She produces and supplies to food vendors. She also runs a grocery shop to supplement the palm oil business. However, her production is on the low side as a result of low working capital to buy stock in bulk. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm fruits, rice, vegetables, processing equipment etc. She believes the loan will enable her to save more towards her children's educations. She would be grateful for your assistance.

Esther is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Jesus Never Fails’. She is the one standing in the front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers respectively. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan. The group would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy bulk supplies.

loans.name: Las Solidarias Group

texts.es: El grupo "Las Solidarias " esta representada por el señor Milton y conformado por 13 miembros D. socios muy trabajadores como lo han demostrado en sus dos anteriores tres ciclos respondiendo a sus propias expectativas D. crecimiento y cumpliendo con sus obligaciones responsablemente. Cada una D. las integrantes del grupo tienen sus propios negocios D. venta D. productos como la venta D. pan, tienda D. abarrotes, venta D. comida, electrodomésticos, cosméticos y servicios D. limpieza. En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores si bien están presentes en el barrio no tienen la misma calidad D. producto que las socias ofrecen por lo que ya tiene una ventaja sobre sus competidores. El crédito esta destinado para surtir sus tiendas,  y compra D. insumos en mayor cantidad. Sus expectativas es  tener más ingresos y ser más independientes económicamente para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida y un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
The Las Solidarias Group, represented by Mr. Milton, is comprised of 13 hard-working members who have demonstrated their abilities in their 3 previous loan cycles. They have met their own expectations of growth and fulfilled their obligations responsibly. All the members run their own businesses, such as selling bread, provisions, fast food, home appliances, cosmetics, and providing cleaning services. They have plenty of competition in their neighborhood, but the competition does not offer the same quality as the group members do, which means that they have the advantage. This loan will be used to restock their shops and purchase supplies in bulk. They expect to obtain greater profits and to be more financially independent so that they can offer their families a better quality of life and a brighter future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 28 years-old and married with two children, both in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. He works hard to be able to provide for the family. George is a trader. He deals in electrical goods such as cables, adaptors, switches, etc. He sells in a shop by the road side in his community. George says he buys the goods from the big cities at affordable prices. He has been in business for eleven years and wants a loan to procure all kinds of electrical goods in large quantities to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To change the décor of his shop.

loans.name: Nassulu

texts.en:
Mr. M. Nassulu is a promissory man who is twenty-eight years old. He owns a grocery shop located in the Kabwohe trading centre, and he has been in the business for over eight years. He will use this loan to purchase grocery items (sweets, drinks, soap, smearing jelly, glucose, etc.) to sell. He wants to invest in purchasing more stock so that he can get more profit from his business.

He is married to one wife who normally helps him in case he is not around. They are blessed with one child too. His business dream is to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items (sweets, drinks, soap, smearing jelly, glucose, etc.) to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 46 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a business man. She sells crates of drinks at retail prices. She is a hard working woman that is determined to excel in her business. She has been in this business for a long time. She lives in Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more crates of drinks. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati is a 37 year-old married mother of six children who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town. However, the majority of the inhabitants farm as a hobby or as a major occupation alongside other trading activities. Fati is a food vendor. She prepares and sells a local dish called tuo – zaafi, TZ for short. It is served hot with soup. She sells in the morning in her community. Fati buys the goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for eleven years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize.

loans.name: Akwei Allah Group

texts.en:
Stephen is 48 years old. He is single and lives in his family house in the community where he lives. He works hard to support himself and business.

Stephen is a supplier of local palm fruits and palm oil. Palm oil is produced from palm nuts fruits. The palm oil is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes like fried fish and pastries, as well as local soaps. He supplies to food vendors to prepare their meals. He also sells the palm fruits to those who need them for further processing. He wants to use this loan to buy more bags of palm fruits. He believes the loan will enable him make more profit as we enter the Christmas festivities.

Stephen is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Akwei Allah’, which literary means Except Allah. He is the one standing in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access and repay the loan. The group would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of palm oil and palm nuts fruits.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati is a 45 year old married mother of six; all of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade, a commerical town in the eastern region of Ghana. Although Kade is a commercial town, the majority of its inhabitants practice farming as a hobby or as a major occupation along side other trading activities. Fati is a food vendor who prepares and sells rice with stew. She sells her goods in the morning by the road side in her community. Fati buys the goods she requires for the business from nearby communities. She has been in business for seven years and is requesting this loan to procure bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Ms. Mary K. is a business woman who owns a bar pub along Kakoba road. She would like to use the requested loan money to boost her business by purchasing crates of beer, sodas, etc for her pub. She is a married woman and blessed with three children, two of whom are in school. She hopes to generate more monthly by building rental houses.

loans.use: To boost her business by purchasing crates of beer, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 40 years old. She is married and has six children. All her children are currently in school. She sells porridge in her neighborhood. Porridge is a local food enjoyed popularly as breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread. Regina also runs a grocery shop to augment profit. With a large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, beans, sugar, and milk to increase production. She hopes to raise good income to support her kids in school.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, milk etc.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia sells used sarongs at retail prices to her customers. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to meet the demand of her customers. Her greatest joy in her business is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She has been in this business for a long time. 

Felicia is 49 years old, married with 8 children. Her husband is a contractor. She hopes for a loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more used sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used sarongs to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Comfort is a petty trader. She runs a provisions store by the roadside in her community. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase her stock. Comfort desires to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy provisions to sell

loans.name: Ekelia

texts.en:
Ekelia, 40, is divorced with six children. Four are in school and the others are currently working. She is supportive, determined and above all very hard-working as a single mother. She is a petty trader who sells bags of maize, beans, vegetables, spices, smoked fish, etc. and has a grocery shop attached to the petty trading. She takes delivery of stock from the Kade central market. Her kids are very proud of her because of the enormous contribution she makes in the home.

Selling of foodstuffs has enabled her to rent a store in the marketplace where she distributes to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more foods such as maize, beans and vegetables, spices and smoked fish, etc. to increase her inventory. She believes this loan will help her save for her children’s education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: to buy a bulk supply of maize, groundnuts, and beans, etc.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Ms. N. Harriet is a resident of Nyakizi cell in Mbarara district; she is a businesswoman dealing in cosmetics and hair extensions. Her shop is located in Mbarara old taxi park. She is using the loan to increase her cosmetics stock and for purchasing different hair chemicals, body lotions, body gels, shampoo, soap, hair extensions, and so forth for big profit. She is a married woman with one child schooling. Her future hope is to construct rental houses for income generation.

loans.use: To increase her cosmetics stock

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 44 years old, divorced and has given birth to two children. Both of her children are in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in Kade, a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Rose is a trader. She runs a provision store by the road side in her community. She has been in business for over 20 years and would like a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase her stock. Rose desires to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy goods for her store in bulk.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose sells goats in an open section in the market in Benin City. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. Her greatest joy in this business is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is 38 years old and married with five children. Her husband is a farmer. Rose is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more goats to sell. She is very grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more goats to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 60 year married woman with three children between the ages of 37 and 40. None of her children go to school, but Christine pays the school fees for her grandchildren whose father passed away. She owns a four room house where she lives with six people. The family also owns rental houses from which Christine provides schooling for orphans. Christine also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. She doesn’t incur any transport costs because she buys from delivery vehicles which bring charcoal from Mubende, one of the villages in central Uganada, past her home in Busega. She owns a wooden store which sells charcoal in a semi urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. Christine works seven days a week and sells both on the retail and wholesale markets. She receives an average of 20 customers a day. 

Christine's major business challenges include defaulters, the ever increasing price of charcoal and the rainy season which hinders her customers’ ability to reach out to her. Her monthly expenses include feeding her family, medication and water and electricity bills. She has been in this business for over two years and with MCDT for nine years. Christine is servicing her fifteenth loan and has been working with the same group of people. Christine joined MCDT because it was near her home and also because it was easy to work with them. She would like to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and to sell only on the wholesale market one day.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Fahad

texts.en: Mr. Fahad T. is a 32 year old business man. He owns a grocery store and is in his third year of business. He is requesting this loan to purchase grocery items, mostly essentials such as paraffin, soap, sugar, cooking oil and bread, to increase his inventories. Fahad is married and blessed with two children who are both in school. He hopes to open another grocery shop in the future to generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to increase his inventories.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy sells foodstuffs like melon seeds, tomatoes, etc. She is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She hopes to be a foodstuff distributor in the future. She is 56 years old and married with 6 children. Her husband is a retired government worker. She sells long hours to ensure that there is food on her table to feed her immediate family members. She has been in this business for a long time. Joy hopes for a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase foodstuffs to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet sells crates of drinks at retail prices to her customers. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more sales during and after the season. She hopes to become a major drink distributor in her community in Benin City, Edo State. She is 48 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband is a retired government worker. She has to sell for long hours to meet the basic needs and necessities of the family.  She hopes for the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 37, married with five children aged between 3 and 11. She lives in the southern province of Rwanda where her shop has been located since 2003. So, for the past 6 years, Marie has been in retail business selling a variety of goods including; rice, sugar, soap, etc. In her shop, Marie employs one person as a helper so that her business runs well.

Marie is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to purchase more inventory that will help her to serve more customers from her community. She is hopeful that this will result in greater profits which will help to provide a more secure future for her family.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory

loans.name: Blanca Guadalupe

texts.es: Blanca Guadalupe L. de 34 años de edad, reside en Soyapango del departamento de San Salvador. Blanca es madre soltera vive con sus Josué de 14 años de edad y Gabriela de 6 años de edad. Con muchos esfuerzos Blanca ha adquirido su propia casa, ella maneja un negocio el cual le deja  excelentes ganancias, es una venta de comida que Blanca realiza por su experiencia y capacidades en la cocina, los clientes de Blanca manifiestan que disfrutan mucho de cada platillo que ella realiza. Ahora Blanca está solicitando de este crédito, ya que su clientela va aumentado y se ve la urgencia de producir mayor cantidad de platillos.
texts.en:
Blanca Guadalupe L. is 34 years old and lives in Soyapango in the department of San Salvador. Blanca is a single mother and lives with her two children Josué who is 14 and Gabriela who is 6. Through her efforts, Blanca has bought a house and she runs a business that generates good income. Her business is selling food and she is able to do so because of her experience and talents in the kitchen. Blanca's customers show that they really enjoy every dish that she makes. At this point, Blanca is requesting a loan as her customer base is growing and she feels the need to produce a larger quantity of dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to prepare food

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 52 years old. She is divorced with six children. At the moment, one is in school. She is a local manufacturer of palm oil. Palm oil is produced from palm nuts. The palm nuts are processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil. Palm oil is used to prepare many local dishes like frying fish, local soaps, and in pastries etc. Mary produces and supplies to food vendors to prepare their meals. Her production is on a small scale due to having inadequate capital to buy a machine for the processing.

Mary requests a loan to buy more bags of palm nuts and gallon containers to store the palm oil. She has been in business for 25 years while taking care of all her children and takes delivery of stock from the surrounding villages. She is the one with the scarf on her head in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy more palm nuts other foodstuffs

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 34 years old, married with 3 children aged 6, 8, and 13. He lives in the southern province of Rwanda in a village called Musebey, which is the poorest in the region. Before doing this business, Jean Claude was a farmer but he could not earn a decent living. This is why he became an entrepreneur! He has 3 years' experience in the small shop that he owns which sells different kinds of products from foodstuffs to cleaning supplies. In his store, he employs two people as helpers. His shop is open from 6 AM to 2 PM every day.

Jean Claude is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to increase his monthly profit which will help him to pay the school fees of his children, to reinvest into his business, and to save money for his future. If his strategy is successful, Jean Claude hopes to buy a cow so that he will get some milk for his children as well. An entrepreneurial and ambitious man, Jean Claude!

loans.use: Purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia ISABEL, pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene una hija que esta en el jardín. Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio de venta de ropa para niños y adultos. Ella lleva la mercadería al mercado muy temprano y reparte entre todas las vendedoras. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción de venta de ropa.        .
  
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Amauta Communal Bank. She is from the city of Cusco. She is 27, in a common law marriage, and has a daughter in kindergarten. She alternates her activities between the home and her business of selling clothes for children and adults. She takes the merchandise to the market very early and distributes it to all of the sellers. The member needs a loan to increase the production of her clothing sales. She is grateful for the opportunity offered through this medium, and she promises to make her payments according to the established time line.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her clothing sales

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 47 years old, married with 8 children between the ages of 9 and 23, and she takes care of one dependent who is called Liliane. Marie lives in the southern province of Rwanda where her sewing business is located. She has been in business here for 22 years!

Marie believes that a small amount of additional capital would allow her to change her business meaningfully. This is why she is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders to purchase an additional sewing machine plus some other materials which will make her more successful, allow her to attract more customers, and produce more to sell. She is excited about building a more stable business and a more secure future for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase more cloth and supplies for sewing

loans.name: Liberee

texts.en:
Liberee is 34 years old and is a recent widow with 3 children ages 7, 9 and 11; she also takes care of one dependent who is 15 years old. Liberee lives in the southern province of Rwanda near the National Park of Nyungwe which is in the tourism region. She has many years experience in the agriculture sector.

Liberee is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to grow her business by purchasing more farm supplies for use and sell in her business. If successful, this will allow her to earn more profit, support her family of 3 children and 1 dependent, and save money so that she will be able to buy her own house someday.

loans.use: Purchase more farm supplies

loans.name: Rina Olivia

texts.es: Rina Olivia C. D. O. resiD. en El Congo departamento D. Santa Ana ubicado en occidente del país. A sus 50 años D. edad Rina vive solo con su hijo quien ya es mayor D. edad e impediente. Rina es una mujer muy luchadora que ha sobresalido en su negocio por su gran empeño y motivaciones que tiene por seguir adelante en sus ventas, ella maneja un inventario en productos D. ropa, carteras, zapatos y otros, los que sale a vender día a día D. manera ambulante, con gran entusiasmo y fe D. que obtendrá buenas ventas, ella ahora esta decidida a aumentar su inventario y es el motivo por el cual solicita D. tu ayuda a través D. un crédito, que será un gran pilar D. apoyo para Rina.
texts.en:
Rina Olivia C. D. Orozco lives in the El Congo department of Santa Ana, which is located in the western part of the country. At her 50 years of age, Rina lives alone with her son who is an independent adult. Rina is a fighter, and she has succeeded in her business because of her great effort and the motivation that she has to get ahead in her sales. She manages an inventory of products like clothes, purses, shoes, and others. She sells them day to day as a street vendor. She has great enthusiasm and faith that she will get good sales. She has now decided to increase her inventory. That is why she is asking for your help with a loan. It will be a great pillar of support for Rina.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her inventory

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en:
Claudette is 23 years old, married without children or dependents. She lives in the southern province of Rwanda near the Forest of Nyungwe Park which is approximately 3 hours' drive from the capital of Rwanda.

Claudette, before doing this business, was a farmer but she could not earn enough to take care of her family and this is the reason why she decided to start a business beginning 5 years ago.

By now, Claudette is a successful businesswoman who has her own shop with different kinds of products such as: undergarments, shoes, cosmetics,and household items. Claudette is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders to help her to purchase more inventory for her store and hopefully attract more customers which will mean more profits for her business.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Tereza Mwanje 's Group

texts.en:
Tereza is 56 years old and widowed with six children aged between 15 and 22 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a seven-roomed house where she is staying with three people. Tereza takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. Tereza incurs additional transport expenses to and from shopping, buying poultry feed from Mengo Kisenyi east of Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda.

Tereza works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a poultry farm at her home in Kyebando Nsooba. She sells both retail and wholesale.

Tereza works seven days a week. She receives an average of 20 customers a day. Her major business challenges include defaulters and ever increasing prices of chicken feed and chicks, and the rainy season which hinders her customers from reaching her. Tereza ’s monthly expenses include water and electricity bills and feeding the family. She has been in this business for over ten years and with MCDT for twelve years servicing her twenty-third loan, working with the same group-mates.

Tereza joined MCDT because it was near her home and also, it was easy to work with them. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of chicken feed and chicks. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning 1500 chickens.

loans.use: To buy more poultry feed and chicks

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia ELIZABETH, pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos dos varones y una mujer. Ella por las mañanas trabaja como profesora del nivel secundaria en el colegio “Comercio 41” del Cusco y por las tardes ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio de venta de castaña que le traen de la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado (Madre de Dios, Perú). La hija estudia la carrera profesional de Medicina Humana en la Universidad Nacional del país de Bolivia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción de venta de castaña y la educación de su hija.        .
  
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the Amauta communal bank. She is from the city of Cusco. She is 52, married, and she has three children. She has two boys and a girl. In the mornings she works as a teacher at the Comercio 41 High School in Cusco. In the afternoons she alternates her activities between the home and her business of selling chestnuts, which she gets from the city of Puerto Maldonado (Mardre de Dios, Perú). Her daughter is studying for a professional career in medicine at the National University in Bolivia. Elizabeth needs a loan to increase her chestnut sales and for her daughter’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chestnuts and pay for her daughter's education

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a hair stylist and she also sells hair extensions and rechargeable phone cards. She is a hard-working woman and she sells long hours to make more profits to meet the needs of her family. She has been in this business for a long time.

Patience is 44 years old and married with 6 children. Her husband is a carpenter and he also supports the home. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more hair extensions and rechargeable phone cards to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more  hair extensions and rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells drinks and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She is a focused, hard worker. She is 56 years old, married with 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks and groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana. de ocupación comerciante de ropa, edredones y sabanas, comercializa dichos productos en la Ciudad de Potosí, a donde viaja cada mes. Vive en la casa de sus suegros ubicada en la zona Villa Exaltación de El Alto.
Su esposo trabaja como empleado en una Empresa Minera en la Ciudad de Potosí, tiene dos hijos de 8 y 15 años los que están en edad escolar.
 
El crédito lo destinará para aumentar su capital de inversión y comprar más mercadería; así podrá incrementar sus ingresos y así solventar las necesidades del hogar.
 
Es el cuarto crédito con IMPRO, sus créditos anteriores fueron cancelados puntualmente, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Juana.
texts.en:
Juana sells clothes, quilts, and sheets. Every month she travels to the city of Potosí to sell these products. She lives in her in-laws’ house, which is located in the Villa Exaltación region of El Alto. Her husband is an employee of a mining company in the city of Potosí. They have two school aged children; they are 8 and 15. The loan is to buy more merchandise to be able to increase her income and pay for the household necessities. This is her fourth loan with IMPRO. She repaid her previous loans punctually. The completed evaluation qualifies Juana for the loan that she has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more clothes, quilts, and sheets to sell

loans.name: Elver

texts.es:
El Sr. Elver V. M. tiene 33 años de edad vive con su esposa la Sra. Nataly del Rosario Ramos Ramos de 25 años de edad. Tienen dos hijas Jacqueline de 4 años quien asiste a un colegio de la zona y Natalia de 2 años.
Viven en la casa del padre de Elver que queda en Pariña Chico - Los Aquijes - Ica, esa vivienda fue afectada por el terremoto y aún no mejora su situacion.
Con sus ahorros lograron comprarse su terreno en Caserio el Rosario-Los Aquijes – Ica y han levantado un modulo de material noble por lo que requieren de un financiamiento para poder colocar su techo de caña, palos y barro y así darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas.
Ambos son bien trabajadores, la sra. Trabaja de 6:00 am a 12 pm y su esposo de 6:00 am a 6 pm, son personas muy responsables, han logrado acumular algunos bienes, tienen muchas ganas de superación, son emprendedores, gozan de buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos y de los jefes donde trabajan.
texts.en:
Elver V. M. is 33, and he lives with his 25 year old wife, Nataly del Roasario Ramos Ramos. They have two daughters. Jacqueline is 4 and attends school in the area. Natalia is two. They live in Elver’s father’s house, which is in Pariña Chico - Los Aquijes – Ica. The house was affected by the earthquake, and the situation has still not improved. With his savings he was able to buy land in Caserio el Rosario-Los Aquijes – Ica. They have raised a building made from good material. However, they need a loan to be able to put on a roof made from cane, sticks, and mud. That way they can give their daughters a better quality of live. Both of them are hard-workers. She works from 6:00 a.m. until 12 p.m. Her husband works from 6:00 a.m. until 6 p.m. They are very responsible people who have been able to accumulate some assets. They have a great desire to succeed, and they are enterprising. They have good references from their neighbors and the bosses where they work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements on the house

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, trabaja como transportista publico con su Taxi, casado con 4 hijos su esposa trabaja como comerciante de comida, viven en casa propia ubicada en la Zona 1ro de Mayo en la Ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinará para el mantenimiento de su movilidad la misma que es su herramienta de trabajo así tener asegurado por un buen tiempo sus ingresos para poder solventar las necesidades de su hogar.
 
Es el cuarto  crédito en IMPRO, sus créditos anteriores fueron cancelados satisfactoriamente, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Pedro.
texts.en:
Pedro works in public transportation with his taxi. He is married with 4 children. His wife sells food. They live in their own house located in the First of May zone of El Alto City.

The loan is destined for maintenance of his taxi, which is the basic tool he works with. This will assure his income for some time and help him provide the necessities of his home.

This is his 4th loan through IMPRO. His previous credits were paid off satisfactorily. The evaluation qualifies Pedro for approval of the solicited loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: FOR MAINTAINING HIS TAXI

loans.name: Jorge Gerardo

texts.es:
El socio JORGE GERARDO, pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 52 años de edad, es divorciado, tiene una hija de 12 años que estudia en el colegio. El tiene una pequeña empresa de venta y compra de productos industriales de repuestos para maquinaria pesada como fajas, empaquetaduras, etc.
 
El socio requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción de venta y compra de productos industriales.       .
  
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
This is Jorge Gerardo. He is a native of the city of Cusco and a member of the Amauta Communal Bank.

Jorge is 52 years old, divorced, and the father of a 12 year old daughter who is in high school. He operates a small business that buys and sells heavy industrial machinery spare parts such as belts, gaskets, etc. He needs a loan so that he can acquire more of these products.

Jorge is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase industrial parts

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is divorced and has three children. She has received a senior high school education.  Since 2004, Elizabeth has been selling shoes, bags and cosmetics at the Elmina market.  Elizabeth uses her income to pay for school fees and utility bills.  Elizabeth will use this loan to purchase more wigs and cosmetics to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more wigs and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Ronald Isaías

texts.es: Ronald Isaías G. H. reside en la colonia Fátima del departamento Chalatenango junto a su madre doña Juana. Ronald tiene tan solo 20 años de edad con un sentido de la responsabilidad bien marcado, ya que lleva a cargo su negocio y los gastos que asume del hogar. Ronald se dedica a la crianza de pollos, la cual lleva muchos procesos de cuido de los mismos como, vacunarlos, que su concentrado sea de buena calidad y la cantidad necesaria, encerrarlos a ciertas horas para que no sean devorados por animales, entre otra cosas. Ronald ya ha ganado experiencia en la crianza de los mismos y es por ello que solicita un crédito, ya que ahora está dispuesto a comprar una mayor cantidad de pollos y para generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ronald Isaías G. H. lives with mother Doña Juana in the Fátima subdivision of the department of Chalatenango. For being only 20 years old, Ronald is known for having a sense of responsibility. He manages his own business and takes charge of the household expenses.

Ronald raises chickens and handles the numerous duties that are required to take care of them such as vaccinating them, inspecting the feed to ensure it is of good quality, acquiring a sufficient amount of feed, housing the birds at certain hours to prevent them from being devoured by other animals, as well as other tasks. He is already experienced in this business, so he is requesting a loan so that he can buy more chickens in order to generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more chickens for his poultry farm

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie O. has a salon where she makes lovely hair styles for her customers. She also sells hair extension materials and drinks at retail prices to her customers. With these combined businesses, Julie is able to support her family. This is the high season for her sales and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to own a fashion house in the future. Julie is 36 years old and married with a child. Her husband is a carpenter. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more hair extensions and drinks to sell. She thanks you for the support.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extension materials and drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry for his farm

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary O. is 35 years old and married with a child. She has a salon where she makes lovely hair styles for her customers. She also sells hair extensions and drinks at retail prices to her customers. With these businesses, Rosemary is able to support her family.  She hopes to own a fashion house in the future. Rosemary hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more hair extensions and drinks to sell. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience E.  is 68 years old and a widow with  3 children. She takes care of her children alone. Patience sells clothes and underwear at retail prices to her customers in Edo State, Nigeria.  She has been in this business for a long time and is a hard working woman.This is the high season for sales and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers.  Patience hopes for a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more clothes and underwear to sell. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and underwear to sell

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia ANA MARIA, pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”, es natural de la ciudad de Tacna y radica en la ciudsd del Cusco.

La socia tiene 45 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijas, la mayor estudia en la universidad y la menor estudia en el colegio.    

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio de venta de ropa y de productos de belleza como cosméticos pulseras, perfumes, aretes, etc. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción de venta de ropa e incrementar la venta de productos de belleza.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
This is Ana Maria. She is a native of the city of Cusco and a member of the Amauta Communal Bank.

Ana Maria is 45 years old, married, and has two daughters. The older daughter is a university student while the younger one is in high school.

She divides her time between her household chores and her business selling clothing and beauty products such as cosmetics, bracelets, perfumes, earrings, etc. She is requesting a loan so that she can acquire more of these products.

Ana Maria is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & beauty products

loans.name: Chinyere

texts.en: Chinyere O. is 34 years old, married with 3 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Chinyere sells drinks and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She is a focused, hard worker and has been in this business for a long time. Chinyere hopes for a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more drinks and groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary K. sells secondhand clothing, such as bedspreads and so on, at Elmina market.  Rosemary has received senior high education.  She is divorced and has four children. Rosemary has been selling secondhand clothing since 2007. She is responsible for paying school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy secondhand clothing and woven goods to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and reinvest.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy secondhand clothing and woven goods to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells colorful sarongs and shoes at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is a hard-working woman and she works long hours to ensure that she meets the needs of her family. She is 46 years old and married. She and her husband have 3 children. Her husband sells building materials to support the home. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all her kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna Q. is married. She has received junior high education. Anna sells baked bread and ice cream at Elmina market, which she has been doing since 2001. Her husband is a carpenter.  Anna uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Anna will use the loan to purchase flour and other ingredients for baking bread and also add to her funds to buy a freezer to store the ice cream that she sells. With the new profits from her expanded business, Anna plans to save and to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: To purchase flour for bread and to purchase a freezer to store ice cream.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr:
Madame Amy Dembélé est une femme de trente neuf  ans avec cinq  enfants qui est mariée dans une famille nucléaire  à Sélingué (une sous préfecture située à 140  kilomètres de Bamako) relevant de la troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.  
Elle est enseigne à l’école primaire de la Cité. En plus de sa profession d’enseignante, elle mène des activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente de céréales.
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui cesse d’augmenter, elle intégra le programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursés ses quatre prêts solidaire et ses deux prêts individuel, Amy est à son  troisième individuel, qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, une tonne de maïs et 600  kilogrammes  de haricot. Elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois auprès des producteurs et vend en détail, au comptant et souvent à crédit, les week-ends à la foire hebdomadaire de Sélingué  et à domicile les jours ouvrables, à une cliente diverse et variée.
Elle compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 65. 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer l’échéance du prêt et investir le reste dans son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amy Dembélé is a 39 year old woman with five children and is married in a nuclear family, they live in Sélingué (a subprefecture located 140 kilometers from Bamako), close to the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. She is a teacher in the city's primary school. In addition to teaching, she has an income generating business, mostly purchasing and selling grains. In order to satisfy her clientele, which had stopped growing, she joined the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. Having fully repaid her fourth group loan and two individual loans, Amy is on her third individual loan, which she will use to purchase one ton of corn and 600 kilos of beans. She purchases her supplies once a month from farmers and resells the grains at retail prices for cash, and often for credit. She sells her products each weekend in Sélingué's weekly, local market and from her home during the week, to a diverse and varied clientele. She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 65,000 FCFA, which she will use to pay for her loan and re-invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grains

loans.name: Diakaridia

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Diakaridia S.a 26 ans et vit  avec son enfant et son épouse dans une famille nucléaire à Sélingué (une sous préfecture située à 140  kilomètres de Bamako) et relevant de la troisième région administrative du Mali. 
Afin  de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie, il décide d’intégrer le programme crédit  de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Il est à son premier prêt individuel et compte l’utiliser pour acheter,  150  paires de chaussures qu’il vend dans les  marchés de Sélingué et de Dalabala sur son étale ou en ambulant dans les différents quartiers, en détail, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Monsieur Diakaridia s’approvisionne une fois par mois à Bamako (capitale du Mali) auprès des grossistes.
Il espère  réaliser avec ce prêt, un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40. 000  FCFA qui servira à payer l’échéance du prêt et investir  le reste dans son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Diakaridia S.is 26 years old and lives with his son and wife in a nuclear family in Sélingué (a subprefecture located 140 kilometers from Bamako) and within the third administrative region of Mali. In order to sastify his growing clientele and improve the conditions of his life, he decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This will be his first individual loan and he will use it to purchase 150 pairs of shoes, which he will sell at his stall in markets of Sélingué and Dalabala, or as he walks around the different neighborhoods. He will sell the shoes at retail prices for cash and, occasionally, for credit to a diverse and varied clientele. Mr. Diakaridia supplies himself once a month from wholesalers in Bamako (the capital of Mali). With the help of this loan, he hopes to earn an average monthly income of 40,000 FCFA, which he will use to pay the maturity of this loan and will reinvest the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary S. is married and has four children. She has received junior high education.  Mary sells dried peppers and powdered spices at Elmina market, which she has been doing since 2001. Her husband is a trader.  Mary uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Mary will use the loan to purchase bags of dried pepper and other spices. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Mary will use the loan to purchase bags of dried pepper and other spices.

loans.name: Djibril

texts.fr:
Monsieur D. Traoré est un homme marié de quarante ans ayant  cinq enfants et vivant dans une famille monogame traditionnel à Dangassa, un des villages (située à 70  kilomètres de Bamako) relevant de la deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali.  
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il intégra le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt individuel et le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce prêt il compte acheter, une tonne d’arachide et 600  kilogrammes  de maïs qu’il vend au marché de Dangassa où il s’approvisionne également deux fois par mois auprès des producteurs et des grossistes.
Il espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen trimestriel de 170. 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer l’échéance du prêt et investir le reste dans son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. D. Traoré is a married man with 5 children and they live in a traditional, monogamous family in Dangassa, one of the towns (located 70 kilometers from Bamako) of the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali. With the goal of satisfying his growing clientele, he joined the Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. This is his second individual loan and he fully repaid his first loan. With this loan he will purchase one ton of peacnuts and 600 kilograms of corn, which he will sell in the market of Dangassa. In Dangassa, he also supplies himself equally twice a month, purchasing goods directly from the farmers and the wholesalers. With this loan he hopes to earn an average quarterly income of 170,000 FCFA, which he will use to repay his loan and reinvest the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grains

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia M. C. es una señora de 47 años de edad, quien vive con sus dos hijos y su hija,  en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada La Esperanza localizada en San José de Upala, Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y le che) y agricultura. 

Doña Lidia se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente desde hace un año a la siembra de platano. Dice que aunque ha sembrado en pequeñas cantidades el mercado para este producto es muy bueno. Comenta que gracias a este proyecto sus condiciones de vida han mejorado considerablemente y dice además que ha crecido como persona y ha adquirido mucho conocimiento, dice que se siente muy capaz y muy feliz de poder mantenerse activa.

En estos momentos doña Lidia desea agrandar su siembra por lo tanto quiere obtener un microcrédito  por ¢250,000 (doscientos cincuenta mil colones), para darle mantenimiento a su nueva cosecha además comprar fertilizantes, abonos entre otros insumos. Con esta inversión  espera lograr una buena cosecha, con un producto de características apropiadas para conseguir un precio de venta alto y así poder incrementar la producción y obtener mayores ingresos para su familia. 

Doña Lidia es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Mujeres la Esperanza; la cual está integrada solo por mujeres, ya que se especializa en apoyar a mujeres no profesionales y  jefas de hogar, es una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Lidia M. C. is 47 years old and the mother of two sons and a daughter. She lives in the small rural Costa Rican community of La Esperanza, which is located in San José de Upala, Alajuela Province. The main business development activities in the area are cattle breeding (for both beef and milk) and agriculture.

Doña Lidia is a farmer, specifically growing bananas within the past year. Even though she produces small quantities, she says the market for her product is very good. As a result of her work, Lidia’s living conditions have improved considerably. She also says she has grown as a person and has acquired much knowledge. Lidia feels very capable and is happy to remain active.

At the moment, Doña Lidia hopes to expand her farm so she is requesting a microloan of 250,000 colones. In order to maintain her latest crop of bananas, she will purchase fertilizers and other supplies. Lidia expects a good harvest from this investment. This crop usually commands a high selling price, so she wants to increase her production so that she can generate more income for her family.

Doña Lidia is a member of the Women’s Community Credit Enterprise of La Esperanza, which is composed solely of women. This microfinance institute specializes in supporting women who are heads of households but not professionals. It is one of 100 partner organizations that comprise EDESA in Costa Rica. This is Lidia’s second loan and she hopes to continue growing personally and financially. She is also an active participant of her local credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & supplies to maintain her banana crop

loans.name: Hamidou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Hamidou Bagayogo est un homme marié de cinquante neuf ans, vivant dans un foyer monogame avec  ses neuf  enfants et son épouse à Sélingué situé à 140 kilomètres de Bamako (la capitale du Mali) relevant de la troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Hamidou est un militaire à la retraite qui a rejoint sa terre natale, après l’armée. Il œuvre dans les activités stockage commercialisation depuis bientôt quatre ans. 
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, il décide de collaborer avec le programme crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso. Monsieur B. est  à son premier prêt individuel  avec l’institution et compte l’utiliser pour acheter, 600  kilogrammes de maïs, 500  kilogrammes d’arachide et 350  kilogrammes de haricot. Il s’approvisionne une fois par quinzaine  auprès des producteurs  pour stocker et revendre pendant une période où le prix des céréales est un peu élevé. Il vend aux marchés de Sélingué et de Dalabala, aux consommateurs et aux détaillants.
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen trimestriel de 130. 000 FCFA qui servira à payer l’échéance du prêt et subvenir aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Mr Hamidou Bagayogo is a married man with 9 children, he lives in a monogamous family with his nine children and his wife in Sélingué, which is located 140 kilometers from Bamako (the capital of Mali), part of the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Hamidou is a retired military office, who returned to his birthplace after the army. He has been working in the business of commercial storage for the past four years. Having researched financial resources to assist his business, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. Mr. B. is taking his first individual loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He will use it to purchase 600 kilograms of corn, 500 kilograms of peanuts and 350 kilograms of beans. He supplies himself once every two weeks with the produce to stock and resell during the period of time when the price of the grains is slightly elevated. He sells in the markets of Sélingué and Dalabala, to consumers and retailers. He hopes to earn an average quarterly profit of 130,000 FCFA, which he will use to repay his loan and to provide for his family expenditures.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grains

loans.name: Zinatu

texts.en: Zinatu is twenty-nine years old. She is married and has two children. Her children both go to school. Lydia is a trader.
