texts.en: Mrs. Nhoeb N. is 53 years old. She lives in Pour Ta Mouk Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Nhoeb N. is a farmer who grows rice on a 3-hectare (7.4-acre) field that she owns. The soil in her field is infertile, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crops more productive. Her husband, Mr. Nak Tum, is a construction worker. This couple has two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey O. is a farmer in Pour Ta Mouk Village in Takeo Province. She grows rice on a piece of land that she owns. Her husband, Mr. Yei Reth, raises ducks for the eggs. Since his poultry business is going well, he wants to expand it, so Mrs. Srey O. has decided to ask for a loan to buy 170 ducks for breeding. 

Mrs. Srey O. is 42 years old and the mother of six children. One of her children works in a garment factory, four are enrolled in the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy 170 ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. sells fresh yams and maize in Elmina. Elizabeth has completed senior high school. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a tailor. Elizabeth has been selling fresh yams and maize since 2009. She helps her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize and yams for resale. She hopes to save and reinvest the new profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and yams for resale

loans.name: Mrs.many Pech Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Many P. is the leader of a five-member loan group. All of the members live in Samraong Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Many P. owns a grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more groceries to sell, so she can earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Chae Phat, grows rice on a piece of land that he owns. Mrs. Many P. is 37 years old and the mother of five children. Three of her children work a garment factory; the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
Vivian W. is a senior student at the University of Liberia but business is her life. She is 32 years old and married with three children between the ages of 1 and 13 years old (kindergarten to 7th grade). She also cares for a sister-in-law, a niece and a nephew. She and her family live in the Fiamah community, a crowded community that lacks both water and electricity and also has the largest refuse deposit south of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia. Vivian sells general goods like biscuits, candy, soap, sugar, etc. She buys wholesale and sells retail on a table to the residents of Fiamah.

Vivian has been running her business for 13 years, starting with 125 Liberian dollars and the sale of charcoal. She is hoping to expand into a shop. Vivian sells goods that customers want and speaks well to them in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. She needs this loan to purchase more general goods like biscuits, soap, etc. to improve the business. Vivian dreams of her family excelling and being well established in the future. She is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "God is Able".

loans.use: To purchase more general goods like biscuits, soap, etc.

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Sok Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey S. is the group leader of her four-member loan group. The members all live in Ta Press Village in TaK. Province. 

Mrs. Srey S. grows rice on a piece of land that she owns. However, the soil in her field is infertile, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crops more productive. Her husband, Mr. Din Sam Art, breeds ducks. Mrs. Srey S. is 35 years old and the mother of three children who attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch K. was born 1964. She lives in Pour Ta Mouk Village in TaK. Province. Mrs. Touch K. is a farmer who grows rice on a plot of land that she owns. Her husband, Mr. Oem Huon, is breeds ducks and sells the eggs. Since his poultry business is going well, he wants to expand it, so Mrs. Touch K. has decided to ask for a loan to buy 160 more ducks to breed. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. She is 45 years old and the mother of seven children. Two of her children work in a garment factory, one is a cowboy, and the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy 160 ducks to breed

loans.name: Keng

texts.en:
Mrs. Keng N. lives in Doem Pour village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline to pump water to support the rice field. 

Her husband, Mr. Meas Pha, owns a plowing machine, which is hired by the villagers to plow their fields. Mrs. Keng N. is 39 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline to pump water to support the rice field

loans.name: Mrs. Phoen Sreing Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank group loan consists of eight people located in Preak Reussei village in the Kandal province. All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Phoen S. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Heng Srey, is a fisherman. Mrs. Phoen S. is requesting a loan to buy a watering machine to support her family. She is 47 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are laborers, while two are farmers and another is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a watering machine to support her family

loans.name: Mrs. Chandoeurn Chen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten people who are all living in Preak Reussei village in the Kandal province make up this village bank loan group. They all will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Chandoeurn C. is the village bank president who has been selected the members. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice. For this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and gasoline to pump water to support the field. Her husband, Mr. Chea Thoeurn, is a construction worker. Mrs. Chandoeurn C. is 28 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers and gasoline to pump water to support the field

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.en: Kunduz is married, has three children, and devotes her time to selling salads. Her husband works as an independent welder but does not earn enough to pay for household expenses or for their children's education. That's why she decided to help him by opening her business, which she started twelve years ago. At first, Kunduz sold to her neighbors and, little by little, her business has been growing and now she sells in the markets. Her oldest daughter helps her in the business and wishes to continue to make it grow. Kunduz is requesting a loan for 12,300 Somoni to purchase fresh vegetables for making salads. She and her family are very grateful for the support that you give to allow them to continue their business and improve their quality of life. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more fresh vegetables for making salads

loans.name: Faithful Women Group

texts.en:
Sarah T. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called “Faithful Women”. She is 42 years old and is married with three children aged 7-25 years old, with educational levels of 1st grade through cosmetologist. Sarah also cares for a stepdaughter.

Sarah is an 8th grade drop-out due to the death of her father – business was the only way of life for her. She and her family live in Rotto town, Airfield community, a crowded community that is filled with people that migrated from rural Liberia during the civil crisis. It is close to James Springs Payne Airfield, south of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

Sarah’s business is foodstuffs like pepper, onions, seasonings, etc. She buys them wholesale and sells retail on a table in the Rotto town market. She has been running this business for twenty-nine years having started by selling for her mother but later deciding to establish her own business. 

Sarah talks to her customers in a good manner and helps them when they face shortages while paying her. She does this in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.

Sarah needs this loan to purchase more foodstuffs to improve her business. She is hoping to improve to be an importer of used clothing in the future. She dreams of building a house for her mother and her family.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
K. Saodat is 51 years old. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Saodat owns a successful clothing sales business located at the “Korvon” market in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She has been doing this business for about 11 years. Her business has benefited from a good sales location and constant demand for her products. Saodat tries to offer good prices to her customers while still making a profit. Saodat has requested a loan of 4300 somoni to increase her inventory. This is a busy time for many market vendors as the cold season is coming and everyone is preparing for the winter season. By purchasing additional inventory, Saodat will be better prepared to meet the increased demand and earn a good income. We believe her perseverance and natural liveliness will help her continue to succeed in her trade and repay this loan on time.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To increase working capital for development of a clothing business

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
A. Firuza is 23 years old. She is living with her parents and two sisters. She is a well-known seamstress in her community, seeing as she has been working there for more than three years. Firuza decided to take advantage of her reputation and bought a tailoring machine. Since than, she has been providing the services of a tailor. This entrepreneur says that she has a well-established clientele, the majority of whom are young girls who often order national dresses. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. Now she is requesting a loan of $700 US to purchase a new modern sewing machine. You can help improve the quality of life of her family. Firuza and her family are grateful for your generosity and support.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
A. Mariya is 50 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is a widow and has two children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was young, the significant value of work and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. Now Mariya dedicates herself to raising and selling cows. The income she generates provides a better quality of life for her family. She is asking for a loan of $1200 US in order to buy calves to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment, Mariya will be able to substantially increase her earnings and improve her quality of life.

Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Gulaya

texts.en: Gulaya M. is a 59-year-old woman who is engaged in the poultry breeding business. She has more than 20 years of experience in this field and poultry is the only financial source for her family. She raises and sells turkey, which is very popular among local people. Gulaya has had a very difficult life.  She is an internally displaced person who suffered during the Azerbaijan-Armenian war in 1992. During the war, she lost everything, her house, her business and most important, her child. Gulaya and her husband do believe that a new loan will help them to improve their living conditions and bring more income.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry

loans.name: Djamolidin

texts.en:
A. Djamolidin is 45 years old. He is married with five children. Djamolidin runs his own café cooking shish kebabs. His café is located in the local central market. He has been in this business for 11 years. Djamolidin is trying to use only the best quality meat in his café. Thus, for example, he is breeding the cattle. He sells some of the meat and he uses some in his café. His elder son helps him in the café and will probably, in the time, inherit the business. The café and cattle breeding are the main sources of income for the family. Today Djamolidin requests 4450 somoni. He is planning to purchase two cows and coal for his café for cooking the shish kebabs. Having a positive credit history, Djamolidin is sure that he will also repay this loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase two cows and coal for his café

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz O. is 31 years old and a father of two children aged 10 and 1. He runs an electrical shop in the main bus terminal of Kisumu City with assistance from his wife.

He has been in this business for the last eight years and also offers electrical fitting services to his clients after he sells them electrical items. His interest in this type of business started after he completed a Diploma in Electrical Engineering from Kisumu Polytechnic.

Boaz was introduced to KADET Ltd by a friend who left one of the main local banks due to high charges. This is his second loan from KADET Ltd, and with it, he intends to purchase sockets, consumer units, security light fittings and other electrical appliances for his shop.

Boaz aspires to open a wholesale business in electrical appliances.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase sockets, consumer units, security light fittings and other electrical appliances for his shop.

loans.name: Lilian Atieno

texts.en:
Lilian O. is 32 years old and married to Ayub. She has been selling clothes for the last five years on the side of the street (not in a physical shop) in the heart of Kisumu City.

This business has enabled her to pay her living expenses. She began the business using capital she had been offered by her husband, who is a marketer.

This is Lilian’s fourth loan from KADET. Lilian learned about KADET through a friend who is an existing client of KADET. She intends to use these funds to purchase more clothes, specifically expanding into men's clothing as she currently only deals in ladies' clothing.

She also intends to purchase mobile phone airtime to sell to customers, in order to take advantage of the current market opportunity as the industry is experiencing massive growth in Kenya.

Lilian aspires to move her business to a permanent stall where she can also accommodate a salon business.

About KADET

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their families across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell (men's clothes and ladies' dresses)

loans.name: Makhsuda

texts.en:
Makhsuda M. is an enterprising woman with a big desire to improve the quality of life of her family. She is married and the mother of 4 children.

Makhsuda has been a seamstress since she was very young, learning in her mother's office. With a lot of effort she was able to open her own shop at her home. She has been successful because her customers recognize the high quality of her products. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow.

Today Makhsuda is applying for her second loan. She is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase new modern fabrics for sewing the national dresses.

You can help improve the quality of life of her family. Makhsuda and her children are grateful for your generosity and support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: To purchase fabric to sew the national dresses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy smoked fish.

loans.name: Tolik

texts.en:
Tolik H. is 30 years old. He is married with three children. He has been in the business of raising and selling cattle since he was young, which is why he has a lot of experience. It is necessary to point out that Tolik has been able to succeed thanks to the support provided by his wife. 

Today Tolik has come to AqroInvest Credit Union, a Kiva partner, for a loan, which will allow him to purchase young cattle to raise and sell. It is his biggest dream to improve the conditions of his business in order to then improve the conditions of his family.

loans.use: Purchase three calves

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad is 39 years old. He is married with five children.

Ziad is an entrepreneur who sells different kinds of food stuffs such as sweets, produce, preserved foods, soft drinks, juices and other items in his grocery store.

Ziad is requesting a loan of 3000 USD to increase his stock.

He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To increase his stock.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina A. is married and has one child. She has received junior high education. Her husband is an engineer.

Paulina sells panties, weaves, body lotion and so on at Elmina. She has been doing so since 2005. Paulina uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Paulina will use the loan to purchase panties, body lotions and other cosmetics for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Paulina plans to save to build a house.

Paulina was out of stock at the time the picture was taken. She hopes to get the loan early so that she can add it to her capital to increase stock. .

loans.use: To purchase panties, body lotions and other cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: "megyefo Tease" Group

texts.en: Vida is thirty-four years old. She is married and has one daughter who is in school. She lives with her husband and daughter in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town. She is a trader. Vida runs a provision store in her community. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘me gyefo tease’, meaning my redeemer lives. Most of the group members participate in trading and/or farming activities. The group requests for a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. It is their desire to give their children the best of education they can afford. Vida, the group leader, is the one standing in this photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk.

loans.name: Moufideh

texts.en:
Moufideh is a 40 year old widow who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with her three children. Moufideh has owned a clothing shot since 2003. She sells women’s clothes like dresses, skirts, t-shirts, tops, as well as women’s accessories. She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for the winter season and coming holidays. This is the first time that Moufideh has requested a loan. 
Moufideh is speciA. in her work because of her experience and the way she treats her clients. Her clients are her family members, friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have self-confidence since she never worked before, and faced some financiA. issues. She decided on doing this business after her husband’s death in order to improve her family’s financiA. situation. In the future, she plans on improving her shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 37 year old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Joseph has been working as a carpenter since 1990. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Joseph has requested a loan.
Jospeh is known for his good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash to have the required tools for his work. Joseph decided on doing this business because he likes his work and hopes to improve his work.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry tools.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a forty year old widowed mother of three children, all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. She works to be able to provide for the family. She is a trader. Lucy is in the palm oil production business. She buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil and supplies it to retailers in her community. She also sells at the local market and treks as well. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia Totado is currently in the business of selling fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell.  Cicilia is 39 years old and is married with a husband who is a teacher. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a resturant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to six children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. Felicia works to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a trader. She trades in palm nuts. She buys the palm nuts from nearby communities and supplies to retailers and palm oil producers in her community. Felicia also sells at the local market and treks as well. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a forty-one year old married woman with four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. Rose works to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a trader. Rose is in the palm oil business. She buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities and villages, prepares the oil and supplies to retailers in her community and buyers from cities. She also sells at the local market and treks as well. Rose has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk.

loans.name: Akumu

texts.en:
Akumu J. is currently in the business of baking and selling bread and is requesting a loan to purchase more baking materials such as baking flour and cooking oil.  Akumu is 27 years old and is married with a husband that is a peasant. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a resturant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.use: purchase more baking materials such as baking flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en: Ellen is forty-seven year old divorced woman with three children. She is a twin. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. She works to be able to provide for the family. Ellen is a trader. She is in the palm oil production business. She buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities and villages, prepares the oil and supplies to retailers in her community. Ellen also sells at the local market and treks as well. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is forty-one years old married woman with three children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. Abena works to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a trader. Abena is in the palm oil production business. She buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil and supplies to retailers in her community. She also sells at the local market and treks as well. Abena has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase palm nuts in bulk.

loans.name: Emba

texts.en:
Emba M. sells groundnut paste and bread for a living, and she is requesting a loan in order to stock tomatoes and cooking oil for sale. Emba is 42 years old. Her husband is a clerk. They have five children, all attending school. With the extra profits she expects from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to offer for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.use: To stock tomatoes and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en: Ellen I. is 37 years-old and married with four children. She is a twin. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. A lot of the women in this town produce palm oil as a means of survival for their families. She works to support her husband to provide for the family. Ellen is a trader in the palm oil production business. Ellen buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil and supplies to retailers in her community. She also sells at the local market. Ellen has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bulk palm nuts.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 56-year-old married mother of eight children, some of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. Kade is a commercial town. However, the majority of the inhabitants practice farming as a major occupation alongside other trading activities. 

Janet is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice with stew. She sells by the roadside in the mornings. Janet buys her food ingredients from nearby big towns. She has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Margretena

texts.en:
Margretena P. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, onions and cooking oil and is requesting a loan to stock rice and maize flour to sell.  Margretena is 40 years old and married to a nurse. She has two children who both go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store for maize flour and rice.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock rice and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is a 37-year-old married woman with four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. She works to support her husband in providing for the family. 

Adwoa is a trader. She is in the palm-oil production business. She buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil and supplies to retailers in her community. She also sells at the local market. Adwoa has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase palm fruits in bulk

loans.name: Galina

texts.en: Galina is married and has adult children. She has a small kiosk where she sells women's clothing. Galina has been in this business for seven years. She has got an entrepreneurial mindset and a habit of hard work. Moreover, Galina is very open to talk to her clients and offer them what they need. Galina would like to borrow 9,750 UAH to purchase more inventory. She wishes she could offer a product to every woman that comes to her kiosk!

loans.use: To purchase more women's clothing.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mable is a 25 year-old married woman with one child who is in school. She lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. She works to support her husband to provide for the family. Mabel is a trader in the palm oil production business. She buys fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil and supplies to retailers in her community. Mabel also sells at the local market. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bulk palm nuts.

loans.name: Alsied

texts.en: Alsied is a very hard-working man. It's amazing the strength that he has to do hard tasks and simultaneously work in his business. He sells a drink called "Kharub" in the streets of Gaza city, Palestine where he is from. Alsied is requesting a loan of $3000. With the money he will be able to buy more materials for his business such as cups and special equipment to make the "kharub" drink.  Alsied is 37 years-old and married with four children. With your help, he will be able to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase cups and other necessary materials for his business.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a 52 year-old divorced woman with five children. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. She works hard to be able to provide for her family. Hannah is a trader in the palm oil production business. She buys fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil and supplies to retailers in her community. She also sells at the local market. Hannah has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bulk palm nuts.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is currently in the business of selling cassava and potatoes and is requesting a loan to purchase bags of beans and pulses to sell. Mary is 30 years-old and is married with a husband that is a farmer . She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase bags of beans and pulses to sell.

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es: Morena Guadalupe R. D. L. resiD. en San Martin municipio del departamento D. San Salvador. Morena D. 32 años D. edad es madre soltera y vive sola con sus dos hijos Wendy D. 13 años y Marvin D. 7 años D. edad. Esta joven madre trabajadora maneja su propio negocio en productos D. primera necesidad, en su puesto que se encuentra ubicado en la zona D. San Martin, son ocho años D. experiencia los que Morena lleva a cargo D. su negocio lo que le permite mantener una estabilidad en clientes que prefieren D. sus productos, el destino del crédito que ella solicita es para incrementar productos para su tienda y así seguir fortaleciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Morena Guadalupe R. D. L. lives in the town of San Martin in the department of San Salvador. She is 32 years old and a single mother of two children, Wendy (age 13) and Marvin (age 7).

This young working mother manages her own business selling basic necessities from her vending post in the San Martin area. Morena has 8 years of experience looking after her business. She has been able to maintain an established clientele who prefer her products. The loan she requested will be used to increase the inventory of her store so that she can continue strengthening her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a forty-five-year-old married woman with three children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. She works to help her husband provide for the family.

Agnes is a trader. She has a palm oil production business. She buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil and supplies to retailers in her community. Agnes also sells at the local market.

She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase palm fruit in bulk.

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es: María Julia A. E. de 55 años de edad vive en Santa Tecla municipio del departamento de La Libertad, junto a sus dos nietos Eduardo de 10 años y Fabiola de 13 años de edad, también la acompaña en el hogar su esposo don Mario quien se dedica a trabajar como sastre. Los ingresos mensuales de don Mario apenas alcanzan los $200 US, es por ello que María hace seis años tomo la decisión de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, montando ella su propio negocio donde vende ropa y zapatos, el crédito que ahora solicita es para surtir el mismo ya que desea aprovechar la época navideña, donde muchos clientes recurren a su negocio.
texts.en:
María Julia A. E. is 55 years old and lives in the town of Santa Tecla in the department of La Libertad. Her two grandchildren Eduardo (age 10) and Fabiola (age 13) live with her. Her husband, Don Mario, is a tailor who earns a monthly income of $200 USD. For this reason, María made the decision six years ago to help her husband with the household expenses by starting her own business selling clothes and shoes.

She is now requesting a loan to buy inventory for her store so that she can take advantage of the Christmas season. During this time, many customers return to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory for the holiday season

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a thirty-year-old married man with one child in school. He lives with his wife and son in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. He works hard to be able to provide for the family.

Daniel is a trader. He has a palm oil production business. Daniel buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil and supplies to retailers in his community. He also sells at the local market.

Daniel has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase palm fruit in bulk.

loans.name: Achiro

texts.en:
Achiro V. is currently in the business of selling groundnuts and millet and is requesting a loan to stock maize and sorghum to sell.  Achiro is 33 years old and is married to a businessman. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up her store of cereals.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock maize and sorghum to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a twenty-nine-year-old divorced woman with two children, both in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. She works hard to be able to provide for the family.

Rebecca is a trader. She has a palm oil production business. She buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil and supplies to retailers in her community. Rebecca also sells at the local market. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase palm fruits in bulk.

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es: Leandro A. S. reside en San Marcos municipio del departamento de San Salvador. A sus 65 años de edad Leandro sigue manteniendo la postura firme y responsabilidad en su negocio, con el cual sostiene a sus familia, que la compone sus tres hijos María de 21 años, Leandro de 14 y Javier de 12 años, también vive con ellos su esposa doña Berta. Leandro tiene montado su negocio en su domicilio ofreciendo diversos productos para el hogar, pero ahora el esta solicitando de este crédito ya que desea surtir su negocio con más variedad y cantidad de mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Leandro A. S. lives in the town of San Marcos in the department of San Salvador. He is 65 years old and continues to maintain a strong position of responsibility at his business. His income enables him to sustain his family, which consists of his three children: Maria (age 21), Leandro (age 14), and Javier (age 12). He is married to Doña Berta.

Leandro established his business from home and sells different household products. He is requesting a loan because he wants to restock his store with more variety and a greater quantity of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a forty-three-year-old divorced mother of two children. Both of her children are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. Most inhabitants are into farming and other trading activities.

Janet has a fish-selling business. She buys the smoked fish from nearby fishing communities. She hawks to sell in her community and also sells at the local market. Janet has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fish in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es: Mario Antonio A. C. de 41 años de edad, reside en Ilopango municipio del departamento de San Salvador junto a su numerosa  familia que la compone sus seis hijos todos menores de edad 13, 11, 9,7,5 y 2 años de edad la mas pequeñita de la familia, también vive con ellos su esposa doña Irma quien es ama de casa y se mantiene pendiente de los cuidos y necesidades que demandan sus hijos. Mario trabaja muy duro en su negocio, ya que se encuentra bajo su entera responsabilidad los gastos del hogar siendo el  único proveedor económico, en el negocio de Mario se repara o vende todo tipo de baterías para automóviles, pero en ahora el solicita de este crédito para compara mayor cantidad de baterías para comercializar y así logar aumentar sus ganancias y poder seguir fortaleciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Mario Antonio A. C. is 41 years old and lives in the town of Ilopango in the department of San Salvador. His large family consists of six children who range in age from 2 to 13. His wife Doña Irma is a housewife and in charge of looking after the needs of the children. Mario works very hard since he is responsible for the household expenses and the sole financial provider. At his business, he repairs and sells all types of automobile batteries. He is currently requesting a loan so that he can buy a large quantity of batteries to sell. This will enable him to increase his earnings and continue strengthening his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase automobile batteries

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia R. is currently in the business of selling sandals and shoes and is requesting a loan to stock more shoes to sell. Sadia is 39 years old and is married to a businessman. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her settlement.

About BRAC: BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more shoes to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a trader. She is into the palm oil production business. She buys fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil and supplies retailers in her community. Alice also sells at the local market. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

Alice is a 50-year-old married woman with six children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. She works so as to support her husband in providing for the family.

loans.use: To purchase palm fruit in bulk

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
This young man, Mahmoud, was born in 1979. He is single and lives with his parents. Mahmud owns a barber shop serving the neighboring areas. Today, he is hoping to borrow $3,000 to redecorate his shop so he can attract a larger clientele.

Mahmoud is grateful for your kindness.

loans.use: To redecorate his shop

loans.name: En'am

texts.en: En'am is 41 years old and married with 8 children. She is a tailor. En'am loves her work and has several loyal customers.Today she needs the loan amount of US$ 3000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sustain and develop her tailoring business. She is grateful to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: Purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Gisma

texts.en: Gisma J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Gisma is 30 years old and is married to a builder. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married and lives in Znamenka village. She owns a small store in a neighboring village where she sells seeds, fertilizers, etc.

Valentina has been in this business for ten years. She moved from a larger town to the village and needed a job. Having an entrepreneurial mind, she decided to start her own business. There was a large agricultural production in a neighboring village, so she decided to sell what was in high demand.

Valentina is a very open person; she is willing to give advice about raising crops to anybody who comes to her store. Her business goal is to start a similar store in her own village.

Valentina would like to borrow 9,128 UAH to increase her assortment. At this time of year, farmers buy seeds and Valentina wants to offer them exactly what they need.

loans.use: To increase her assortment

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 29-year-old woman who lives in southern Lebanon with her husband and one child.

Mary has been selling accessories for nine years. She sells perfumes, beauty products, make up, hair accessories and lots more. She is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and to buy a display shelf for her shop. This is her second loan and she has always repaid on time.

Mary is special in her work because of her location. Her clients are her friends and neighbors and people from her region. She decided on doing her business because of her previous work experience in sales but she had difficulty finding the proper place to open her shop. In the future, she plans on improving her shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and to buy a display shelf for her shop

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 23-year-old woman who lives in southern Lebanon with her husband and one child.

Sanaa has been selling accessories for three years. She sells perfumes, beauty products, makeup, hair accessories and lots more. She is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and to buy a display shelf for her shop.
This is her second loan and she has always repaid on time.

Sanaa is special in her work because of the diversity of her merchandise. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and people from her region.  Sanaa decided on doing her business because she likes working in sales but she had difficulty finding the proper place to open her shop. In the future, she plans on improving her shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and to buy a display shelf for her shop

loans.name: Mujeres Para El Progreso 1&2 Group

texts.en:
C., 40, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro D. Macorís, Dominican Republic. C. is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres Para el Progreso (Women for Progress), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

C. and the other borrowers of Mujeres Para el Progreso live in L. Joya (The Jewell), just west of San Pedro. C. has four children, and lives at home with three of them and her husband. Life in L. Joya can be difficult. Running water is scarce and never potable, electricity is unreliable at best, and houses are typically maD. of flimsy wood panels and tin roofs. 

Despite these difficulties, C. runs a successful eatery which sells sandwiches, rice, beans, and meats, as well as natural local juices. She will use this loan, her first with Esperanza, to purchase supplies to make her customers’ food. C. had found loans elsewhere, but she came to Esperanza International because the others’ rates were far too high. Without traditional collateral, the interest was too much to be of any help to her business. She hopes that by switching to Esperanza, her business can grow with the hard work she puts into it rather than continually paying back everything she gains. Thank you for lending to C. and the Mujeres Para el Progreso group!

loans.use: Drinks, bread, meats, and cheeses

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia es el ejemplo latente de mujer peruana que desea salir adelante, ella tiene 39 años y vive en compañía de su esposo Luis, de 40 años, que trabaja como obrero en la construcción de carreteras; y con sus dos hijos: Judith de 13 y Luis de 8 años.

Ella tiene en una pequeña peluquería que adaptó en la sala de su casa, empieza su labor desde muy temprano, pasa el día entero cortando el cabello de las personas, creando los más modernos peinados para los exigentes clientes que parecen quedar muy satisfechos, luego de pasar por sus manos.
Alicia empezó este negocio hace 14 años, cuando puso en práctica sus conocimientos de cosmetología que aprendió de joven, y así ha logrado apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, además como el espacio de la peluquería es amplio decidió empezar a vender también diversos productos de belleza, los cuales ofrece a sus entusiastas clientes que buscan siempre mejorar su aspecto. 
Alicia vive en su mundo de estilo y belleza, siempre con la mente positiva de querer salir adelante porque en el futuro quiere tener un gran salón de belleza, y quizás en unos años más llegar tener un salón en otro lugar de la zona donde vive, porque ella piensa en expandirse y crecer económicamente. 

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y asegura que será responsable con cada pago, además está muy contenta con el trabajo de su grupo porque está compuesto por mujeres emprendedoras como ella.Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará diversos tipos de adornos y juguetes para venderlos en un espacio de su peluquería, porque en el futuro también quisiera tener un bazar, ya que ella piensa en progresar para poder darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alicia is the indicative example of a Peruvian woman who wants move forward. She is 39 years old and lives with her husband Luis (40 years old) who works as a highway construction worker; and with her two children: Judith (13 years old) and Luis (8 years old).

She has a small hair salon set up in her home’s living room. She starts her work very early, spending the whole day cutting people’s hair, creating the most modern hairstyles for the discerning clients who seem to be very satisfied with her work.

Alicia started this business 14 years ago, when she put into practice the knowledge of cosmetology that she learned as a young woman. With this business, she has been able to support her husband with the household expenses. In addition, since the salon is spacious, she decided to start selling various beauty products which she offers to her enthusiastic clients who are always trying to improve their appearance. Alicia lives in her world of style and beauty, always with a positive mind that wants to push forward because in the future, she wants to have a large beauty salon. Maybe, in a few mO. years, she will have a salon in another part of the area where she lives because she is thinking about expanding and growing economically.

This is the second loan she has had with MFP and she guarantees that she will be responsible for each payment; in addition, she is very pleased with the group’s work because it is made up of enterprising women like her. With the funds she is now requesting, she will buy various types of decorations and toys to sell in her salon, because in the future, she would also like to have a bazaar. Now she thinks about making progress so she can give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Lidio Mariano

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Viejo del departamento de Chinandega, el señor Lidio Mariano G. se dedica arduamente a su actividad agrícola por medio de la siembra de hortalizas con el propósito de levantar una excelente cosecha y así llevar el sustento a su familia compuesta por su esposa y dos hijos.

El señor Lidio actualmente está sembrando chiltomas y tomates pero para esto requiere los insumos agrícolas como son insecticidas y fertilizantes y es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de estos insumos y a lo inmediato iniciar a aplicarlos para obtener una cosecha exitosa y continuar dedicándose a su actividad agrícola con mucho mas desempeño.
texts.en:
In the municipality of El Viejo, in the Chinandega region, Señor Lidio Mariano G. works hard in the agricultural trade, planting vegetables with the objective of raising a bumper crop so that he can feed his family, which consists of his wife and two children. Señor Lidio is currently planting chiltomas (small peppers) and tomatoes, but this requires agricultural supplies such as insecticides and fertilizers. For this reason he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of these supplies, which he will immediately begin to apply to obtain a successful harvest so that he can continue to perform his agricultural activities well.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es: Concepción G. B. originaria del departamento La Libertad municipio de Colon, vive con su esposo Erick de 53 años de edad. Concepción es una mujer muy trabajadora,  hace unos años  pensó en poner su propio negocio y analizando sus alrededores le pareció una buena idea instalar en su hogar un negocio donde ofrece diversos productos como ropa, cremas corporales, perfumes, accesorios para el cabello, entre otros. Es así como Concepción ahora ha fortalecido su negocio a través de la demanda que sus clientes  le dan al negocio, ahora ella esta solicitando este crédito para poder seguir expandiendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Concepción G. B. is from the La Libertad department in the Colon municipality. She lives with her 53 year old husband, Erick. Concepción is a very hard-working woman. Years ago she thought about setting up her own business. She analyzed her surroundings, and it appeared to be a good idea to set up a business in her home. She sells diverse products like clothes, body creams, perfume, and hair accessories among other things. Concepción has now strengthened her business through her customer demand. She is now asking for this loan to be able to continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Liza

texts.es:
Liza es una mujer muy trabajadora de 37 años, vive muy contenta con su esposo Carlos que tiene 40 años y tiene 4 hermosos hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos; Andrea de 15 y Fernando de 10, porque los otros 2 mayores se encuentran estudiando en la ciudad.

Desde hace 13 años se dedica a la preparación de toda clase de panes y bizcochos; al principio se animó a incursionar en este negocio porque le era cómodo comprar los panes al por mayor, ya hechos y los vendía en su pequeña tienda. Pero con el tiempo se le ocurrió la idea de prepararlos ella misma; es así como Liza empezó a tomar clases de panadería y algunos talleres que brindaban algunas empresas del rubro; hasta que un día produjo sus propios panecillos, se animó a degustarlos y sintió que estaban tan exquisitos  que se atrevió  a venderlos; desde entonces han pasado ya varios años, y esto la hace muy feliz porque la experiencia ha hecho conocido por sus clientes cada manjar que prepara.
Por ello, sus panecillos son muy demandados en la zona donde vive, además cuando ya están por salir del horno desde su casa se desprende un exquisito aroma capaz de atraer al más reacio de los consumidores. Liza considera su negocio muy rentable porque en su pequeña panadería también vende otros productos comestibles que le permiten obtener otras ganancias adicionales; y como es una mujer emprendedora, sin miedo a nada, ya ha pensado en ampliar su tienda y empezar a arriesgarse a preparar otras clases de panecillos.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura de ser cumplida porque quiere seguir trabajando para mejorar y progresar en el futuro. Con el dinero que solicita tiene pensado comprar varios sacos de harina y empezar preparar mayor cantidad de panes para venderlos, y así salir adelante.
texts.en:
Liza, 37, is a very hard-working woman. She lives very happily with her 40 year old husband, Carlos. She has four lovely children, but she only lives with two of them. Andrea is 15, and Fernando is 10. The older two children are attending school in the city. For 13 years she has been making all kinds of breads and cakes. In the beginning she was excited to start in this business because it was easy for her to buy the bread wholesale. The bread was already made, and she sold it in her small store. As time passed, she got the idea to make the bread herself. That is how Liza started to take baking classes and some workshops offered by some companies in this field. She did this until one day she produced her own breads. She was excited to taste them. She felt that they were so exquisite that she dared to sell them. Since then many years have passed. That makes her very happy because that experience made her customers know about each delicacy that she prepares. Her breads are in much demand in the area where she lives. Also, when the bread is just about to come out of the oven it gives off an exquisite aroma, which is capable of attracting even the most reluctant consumers. Liza considers her business to be very profitable because she also sells other food products in her small bakery. That allows her to get additional earnings. As she is an enterprising woman, who is not afraid of anything, she has thought about expanding her store. She will start to take the risk of preparing other kinds of breads. This is her second loan with MFP. She is sure to repay it because she wants to keep working to improve and progress in the future. She will use the money she is asking for to buy various sacks of flour and to start to prepare a larger quantity of bread to sell. That way she will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour

loans.name: María Elvira

texts.es: María Elvira A. D. P. originaria del departamento D. La Libertad, tiene 51 años D. edad vive con su esposo y dos nietos D. 11 y 5 años D. edad. María ha manejado por años su negocio donD. muchos clientes prefieren hacer sus compras allí, por la amabilidad y alegraría que María transmite con sus tratos, son quince años D. experiencia y a cargo D. su tienda llamada “Tío Paco”, donD. ofrece productos D. consumo, ella ahora solicita D. este crédito, para poder surtir su negocio y seguir fortaleciendo sus ventas como lo ha hecho hasta ahora.
texts.en:
María Elvira A. D. P. is from the La Libertad department. She is 51, and she lives with her husband and two grandchildren. The grandchildren are 11 and 5. María has managed her business for years. Many customers prefer to make their purchases there because of the kind and cheerful treatment that María gives them. She has 15 years of experience having her store, which is called “Tío Paco”. She sells consumer products. She is now asking for this loan to be able to stock her store. She wants to continue strengthening her sales as she has been doing up until now.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Babulu

texts.en:
Babulu H. is currently in the business of selling charcoal from home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Babulu is 35 years old and is married to a soldier. She has ten children and they go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 43 años, vive con sus dos hijas: Verónica de 23 y Lizbeth de 17 años. Ellas viven juntas y felices con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por eso que se ayudan mutuamente.

Martha se dedica a la preparación de panes y diferentes bizcochos para una panadería que le paga por sus servicios. Aprendió este oficio viendo como preparaban los panaderos, y después de un tiempo quiso empezar a prepararlos sola y lo logró con mucho empeño, además de buena memoria; mezcló ingredientes, imaginó figuras e impuso un nuevo estilo de formas de panes que hoy se lucen en la panadería, donde los consumidores pueden elegir detrás de la vitrina los panes más provocativos que quieran comprar. 
A Martha le gusta su trabajo y obtiene buenas ganancias, además también tiene una pequeña chacra donde siembra papa, su hija mayor que ya trabaja la ayuda económicamente y la menor la apoya en las labores de su casa; pues la meta de las tres es salir adelante y tener una panadería propia en la que ofrezcan los exquisitos productos que prepara esta trabajadora mujer que ha sabido asumir el rol de padre y madre sin ningún temor.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser muy seria y puntual con cada pago, además está satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque le permite trabajar con mujeres emprendedoras como ella. El dinero que solicita, menciona con ilusión, lo invertirá en la compra de abono, fertilizantes y semillas de papa para lograr sembrar en mayor cantidad y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Martha is 43 years old and lives with her two daughters: Veronica, age 23 and Lizbeth, age 17. They live happily together and have a strong desire to get ahead, and in this respect they help each other. Martha produces bread and a variety of biscuits for a bakery which pays her for her services. She learned this trade by watching how the bakers work, and after a time she wanted to begin to produce on her own. She achieved this with great effort, and also a good memory; she mixed the ingredients and came up with shapes. She developed new styles of shapes of bread that today are displayed in the bakery where the customers are able to choose behind glass panels the most tempting breads that they wish to buy. Martha likes her job, and she obtains good earnings; in addition she has a small field where she grows potatoes. Her oldest daughter who works helps her economically, and the younger one helps with the household chores. The goal of the three is to succeed and to have their own bakery where they can offer the exquisite products that are created by their hardworking mother, who has managed to assume the role of father and mother without fear. This is the second loan that they have received from MFP, and they are committed to be responsible and punctual with every payment. In addition, they are content to work with their communal bank because they can work with enterprising women like themselves. The money that they are hoping to receive will be invested in the purchase of compost, fertilizer and potato seed to plant in large quantities to obtain increased earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her potato fields

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El socio JUAN, pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos un varón y una mujer. El trabaja en turismo como freelance hace caminatas al “Valle de Lares” de la ciudad del Cusco.    

El alterna sus actividades de guía de turismo con el estudio y con la venta textiles. El estudia en el Instituto superior “Antonio Lorena” la carrera profesional de Turismo el quiere ser un buen guía de turismo. En el instituto le enseñan danzas de las más variadas coreografías típicas de la región como (el Q’ara Chuncho, Siqlla, Q’apaq Chuncho, Saqra, Magenio, Qoyacha, Qanchi, Mistiqanchi, etc). El socio esta vestido con el disfraz que se le caracteriza a la danza el Magenio. El socio requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción de venta de textiles y para el estudio.
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juan is a native of the city of Cusco and a member of the Amauta Communal Bank. He is 42 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children (a boy and a girl). He works freelance in the tourism industry by providing walking tours of the “Valle de Lares” in the city of Cusco.

He divides his time among his activities as a tour guide, his studies, and selling fabric. Juan is studying at the Antonio Lorena Institute so that he can earn a professional degree in Tourism. He wants to become an excellent tour guide. At the Institute, they teach a variety of traditional dances performed in the region (such as Q’ara Chuncho, Siqlla, Q’apaq Chuncho, Saqra, Magenio, Qoyacha, Qanchi, Mistiqanchi, etc.). In the photograph, Juan is dressed in a traditional costume for the Magenio dance.

He will use part of the loan to purchase fabric to sell. The remainder will be used to pay for his educational expenses. Juan is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for his educational expenses & purchase fabric to sell

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer muy simpática y amable de 47 años, vive con sus dos hijos: Jenny de 26 y Jimmy de 29 años, además la acompañan su nuera y su pequeña nieta a quien cuida como su propia hija.

Ella se dedica a la venta de diversos productos en su pequeña tienda, al principio solo vendía comestibles y gaseosas, pero como percibió la necesidad de los pobladores de la zona donde vive, empezó a vender costales (grandes bolsas donde los agricultores guardan los vegetales, tubérculos), además de pabilos y diferentes plásticos. 
De esta manera obtiene más ganancias económicas porque le compran al por mayor, además al culminar la tarde empieza la venta de salchipollo-platillo compuesto de papas y pollo frito- que es muy buscado entre los habitantes de la zona por su exquisitez y sabor.
Así son los días de Olga, quien a pesar de no tener hijos pequeños trabaja porque quiere salir adelante, para poder descansar tranquila en un futuro sin que nada le falte, además labora  porque lo aprendió desde muy pequeña y así lo ha hecho durante toda su vida. 
Como ella es muy luchadora quiere en el futuro ampliar su negocio y vender otros implementos y herramientas que necesitan los agricultores, ya que no hay mucha competencia en la zona. 

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser cumplida, como en cada acción de su vida, pues así se lo enseñaron, es por eso que hoy tiene un próspero negocio. Olga tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en mayor cantidad de mercadería e implementos agrícolas, ya que con la venta de esto obtiene muy buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Olga is a kind and likeable woman who is 47 years old. She lives with her two children, Jenny (age 26) and Jimmy (age 29). Included in her family is a daughter-in-law and young granddaughter who she cares for like her own child.

She sells a variety of products from her small shop. At first she only sold snacks and sodas, but after assessing the needs of the area residents, she started selling gunny sacks (large burlap bags used by farmers for keeping vegetables and tubers), candlewicks, and different plastics. She was able to generate more revenue by acquiring products in bulk. Olga later began selling “salchipollo” (a dish consisting of potatoes and fried chicken), which is highly sought after by the locals for its exquisite taste.

Despite not having young children, she must still work in order to stay ahead. Olga hopes to retire peacefully in the future, but still not lack anything. She learned how to work at a very young age and has continued to do throughout her life. Olga continues to fight for what she wants, so she is looking to expand her business in the future and sell other equipment and tools requested by farmers. In addition, she wants to take advantage of the lack of competition in the area.

This is her second loan with MFP. As with every action she has taken in her life, Olga promises to complete her obligations. She has demonstrated her responsibility, which shows why her business is thriving. Olga plans to invest the money in a greater quantity of merchandise and farming implements, which should increase her sales and generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory & purchase farming implements to sell

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden L. is currently in the business of selling beer in a small bar, and is requesting a loan to purchase more items like sodas, drinking water and juice to sell.  Kiden is 39 years old and is married to an accountant. She has five children and they go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar and restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more items, like sodas, drinking water and juice to sell

loans.name: Raquel Ederita

texts.es:
La señora Raquel Ederita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción de la Banda”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 23 años y 02 hijos,  que estudian y aun depende de ella. 

Lleva 03 años dedicándose a la venta de Chupetes,  motivada por ella misma y   buscando alternativas para generar fuentes de ingresos, aportar al ingreso económico en su hogar y gracias a su cualidad de ser una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, le ayudaron a iniciarse en su negocio. Nos cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien y poco a poco ha ido ganando clientes. En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo por que ven que el producto que ella ofrece tiene muy buena acogida y sobretodo son atendidos con amabilidad que es lo que a ella le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará ingredientes para la preparación de su producto como azúcar en kilos,  cajas de leche y frutas que a diario necesita para la preparación de los chupetes, a diario cuenta con sus productos surtidos, para así poder captar una mayor clientela y dejarlos satisfechos, con la calidad y sabor delicioso que le pone a sus chupetes.

Raquel Ederita, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Raquel Ederita is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres en Acción de la Banda” located in the District of Banda de Shilcayo, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 23 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 dependent school-aged children.

Raquel has been selling lollipops for three years. Out of her own motivation, she looked for alternative sources of revenue. Thanks to her hard work and enterprising spirit, she was able to start her business and begin generating income from home. She says she is doing very well and steadily gaining more customers. Raquel continues to manage her business to this day. Her products are well received and she treats all of her customers with kindness.

With this loan of 800 soles, Raquel will buy ingredients used in making her product such as sugar by the kilo, cartons of milk, and fruit. She prepares a wide assortment of lollipops each day so that she can attract a larger clientele and keep them satisfied. Raquel Ederita feels strong enough to continue working and persevering day after day. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping women like her and providing them with opportunities to develop in the communities where they operate.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making lollipops

loans.name: Marbin Arnoldo

texts.es: Marbin Arnoldo H. P. de 31 años de edad reside en Ciudad Arce municipio del departamento de La libertad. Marbin vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas menores de edad estudiantes de básica. Marbin es una persona muy activa en su negocios, trata de diversificarlos para poder generar mayores ganancias. Marbin maneja una tienda en su hogar que ofrece productos de consumo, también maneja un pequeño molino que da servicios a varios negocios de tortillerías y pupuserias de la zona, y por si fuera poco mantiene una crianza de cerdos los cuales entran en  proceso de engorde, para luego ser comercializados. El desea de un crédito para surtir su negocio y por ello que necesita de tu ayuda.
texts.en:
Marbin Arnoldo H. P. is 31 years old and lives in the town of Ciudad Arce in the department of La Libertad. He lives with his wife and two school-aged daughters. Marbin is very active in his businesses and tries to diversify his activities in order to generate as much revenue as possible.

He manages a store out of his home where he offers consumer products. In addition, he operates a small grain mill and offers milling services to local businesses that sell tortillas and pupusas. On top of that, he also raises pigs that are in the process of fattening before being sold at market. Marbin is requesting a loan so that he can restock his store, so he needs your help.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory for his store

loans.name: Ynelsa

texts.es:
La señora Ynelsa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción de la Banda”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 34 años y 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Ynelsa, es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 50.00 y empezó comprando 03 paquetes de gaseosas,  vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas.

En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Ynelsa, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Sra. Ynelsa is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres en Acción de la Banda” located in the District of Banda de Shilcayo, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 34 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 dependent children.

Ynelsa enjoys working, so she decided to start her own business selling soft drinks from home, which is a suitable location for this activity. She manages her own business without a set schedule and she gets to be her own boss. She started with initial capital of 50 soles and bought 3 packs of sodas. When her inventory of sodas got low, she gradually invested in more products.
