Ynelsa continues to manage her same business and is recognized by her customers who are her neighbors, relatives, and friends. With this loan of 800 soles, she will buy more beverages such as various flavored sodas in different sizes and brands; and mineral water, both carbonated and noncarbonated.

Ynelsa has many goals ahead of her and she is motivated to fulfill what she set out to do. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for assisting her when she needed help. She has been responsible with her payments and plans to continue in the same manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & mineral water

loans.name: Benade

texts.en:
Benade S. is currently in the business of selling food in a restaurant, and is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks, such as sodas, water and juice to sell.  Benade is 28 years old and is married to a car driver. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy soft drinks such as sodas, water and juice to sell

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es:
El señor Clemente vive en Anticrético con su esposa y sus  hijos en la c/ Guaman Poma de Ayala de la  zona Villa Nueva Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja en el edificio San Antonio en el cual percibe un sueldo de 1722, ingresos con que  mantiene a su familia; la esposa no trabaja, es ama de casa.

El crédito que solicita es para pagar el costo de pensiones en los colegios donde  sus hijos estudian.
 
Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2006 y su historial de pagos refleja una conducta intachable.
texts.en:
Sr. Clemente lives with his wife and children on Guaman Poma de Ayala Street in the Villa Nueva District of the city of La Paz. He works at the San Antonio Building and earns a salary of 1772 BOB, which enables him to support his family. His wife is a homemaker.

He is requesting a loan to pay for the cost of room and board at the high school his children attend.

Clemente has been an IMPRO client since 2006 and has an excellent payment history.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for room & board at the school his children attend

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina A. is married and has four children. She has no educational background. Georgina sells soft drinks in a shop in Elmina, which she has been doing since 2007. Her husband is a driver. Georgina uses her income to help her husband pay school fees and utility bills.

Georgina will use the loan to purchase different brands of soft drinks for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Georgina plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase different brands of soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
El socio ROLANDO, pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 29 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos dos mujer y un varón. La hija mayor estudia en el colegio, la hija menor estudia en el jardín y el varón es un bebe.
 
El alterna sus actividades de con la administración de su pequeña empresa que es una procesadora (molino) de grano y distribuir los productos. El socio requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción de venta de granos molidos como la cebada, trigo, haba y otros insumos.
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rolando is a native of the city of Cusco and a member of the Amauta Communal Bank. He is 29 years old, married, and has three children (two girls and a boy). The older daughter is in school, while the younger one is in kindergarten. His son is still a baby.

Rolando manages a small business that processes grain for distribution. He needs a loan to increase his sale of milled grains such as barley, wheat, beans, and other products. He is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grain for processing (milling)

loans.name: Asociacion De Cristo #5-8 Group

texts.en:
Lucia, 40, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro D. Macorís, Dominican Republic. Lucia is the coordinator for her group, Asociacion D. Cristo (Association of Christ), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group. Lucia and the other women in Asociacion D. Cristo live in Boca Chica, a town between San Pedro and Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. Boca Chica is known for tourism and visits to the beach, and Lucia has taken advantage of that trend by running a business selling bathing suits. She will use this loan to buy the bathing suits at wholesale prices, and then sell them at a small markup. Lucia has seven children. She lives at home with her husband and four of her children, and it can be a crowded place. She hopes to make additions to her home so that there is more room, and she also hopes to one day own the building where she runs her business.

Lucia has successfully repaid four loans with Esperanza International, and she is excited to be taking out her fifth. Lucia said that she and her family “have overcome everything to get to where [they] are”. She is very thankful for Esperanza, not just for its loans but also for its “lower rates, savings, and the clinics” that are provided to all associates. Thank you for lending to Lucia and the Asociacion D. Cristo group!

loans.use: To purchase men's and women's bathing suits

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina K. is married and has one child. She has received a senior high school education.  Paulina sells secondhand clothes, body lotions, hair weaves, and so on at Elmina, which she has done since 2007. Her husband is a carpenter.  Paulina uses her income to help pay school fees and utility bills.  Paulina will use the loan to purchase a bale of secondhand clothes and some cosmetics for resale. Paulina plans to save the new profits from her expanded business and reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of secondhand clothes and some cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es:
La socia LUZ ESTELA, pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 72 años de edad, es divorciada, tiene cinco hijos tres varones y dos mujeres ellos alternan sus actividades con el estudio y trabajo, cada uno de los hijos tienen su propia familia. La socia es docente cesada.  

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de productos de belleza como perfumes, pinta boca, aretes, collares, y etc. Ella tiene un catalogo de los productos lo cual ofrece a sus amigas y clientes.

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción de venta de productos de belleza.
 
La socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Luz Estela is a native of the city of Cusco and a member of the Amauta Communal Bank. She is 72 years old, divorced, and has 5 children (3 sons and 2 daughters) who divide their time between work and their studies. They have their own families. Luz Estela is a retired school teacher who divides her time between her household chores and selling beauty products such as perfumes, lipsticks, earrings, necklaces, etc. She offers her products to friends and customers through a catalog. Therefore, she is requesting a loan so that she can increase her sales of these products. Luz Estela values and appreciates the loan that has been provided to her. She agrees to make her payments on the established due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es:
Celinda tiene 30 años, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, con los que vive en su casa propia. 
Cuando el padre de sus hijos la abandonó doblegó sus labores agrícolas, pues trabajaba como jornalera en las chacras de sus vecinos, pero pese a ello, no se abastecía. Como sus necesidades económicas iban creciendo, decidió implementar un espacio en su casa para poder vender algún producto, y con mucha perseverancia y trabajo logró instalar una bodega pequeñita, pero muy acogedora, donde se esmera en dar una buena atención a sus clientes.
Ahora, gracias a la preferencia de sus vecinos, puede brindarles a sus hijos una vida digna, la cual quiere conservar siempre. Pero Celinda no descuida sus cultivos de plátanos, ya que  también le son rentables cada cierta temporada.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, ella es una cliente muy dinámica, y sobre todo muy responsable en sus labores. Con el dinero que ahora solicita va incrementar la mercadería de su bodega, también va a comprar fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Celinda is 30 years old and a single mother of 4 children. She lives in her own home.

When the father of her children abandoned the family, she took over the farming duties since she used to work for her neighbors as a field laborer. However, this did not supply enough income to meet her needs. Her expenses were increasing, so she decided to set aside a space in her house for selling products. Through much perseverance and hard work, Celinda opened a small grocery store that is well-suited for providing good service to her customers.

Thanks to the patronage of her neighbors, she can now provide her children with a decent life. She hopes to always maintain this level. Celinda has not stopped growing bananas since she finds this endeavor to be profitable each season.

This is her second loan with MFP. Celinda is a dynamic client who is very responsible with her work. She will use the requested money to buy more merchandise for her grocery store. In addition, she will purchase chemical fertilizers for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purcase merchandise for her store & fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Lazaro Eddy

texts.en:
Lazaro is preparing for the Christmas demand for his product, and will use this loan to purchase more inventory. He sells leather belts, Lazaro does not have an established location for his business. He travels around to different villages around the city of Nagarote and also in the city of Leon and in the northern parts of the country, where he sells his merchandise to vendors who can offer a good price to their customers.

Lazaro is married and has a three-year-old son. He and his wife want to be able to provide all of the necessities for their son. They live outside the city of Nagarote, and his home is equipped with electricity and potable water.

loans.use: capital de trabajo (working capital)

loans.name: Isabela

texts.es:
Isabela tiene 46 años, está casada y es madre de tres hijos con los que viven en su casa propia. 
La mayor preocupación de Isabela y su esposo es mantener limpia de arbustos sus plantas de café y plátanos. Cada cierta temporada abonan cada mata con la finalidad que su producción no  merme, sobro todo los plátanos, ya que cada quince días van recolectados los frutos para venderlos en su misma chacra y con estas ganancias solventa los gastos de alimentación de su hogar.
En el caso del café esperan de mayo a julio que son los meses de cosecha, tiempos en que trabajan con mucha alegría de sol a sol; y finalmente llevan su producto a las acopiadoras de su zona, estos son tiempos de bonanza e inversión para su familia. 
Por tal motivo, Isabela jamás se cansa de su labor agrícola, pues gracias a ella ha podido educar a sus hijos, quienes son su mayor adoración.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y está muy contenta y entusiasmada, por lo se compromete de pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Isabella is 46 years old and lives in her own home. She is married and the mother of three children.

The biggest concern for Isabella and her husband is clearing their coffee and banana fields and keeping them free of bushes and shrubs. Every season they fertilize each plant in order to promote fruit production, especially the bananas. They gather fruit every two weeks and sell them directly from their farm. With the earnings they generate, they are able to feed themselves and cover their household expenses.

With regard to the coffee crop, Isabella must wait until May through July since those are the harvesting months. She happily works from sunrise to sunset during this time of year. When the last of the crop is gathered for sale, her family takes time to celebrate their success with one another. For this reason, Isabella never gets tired of farming. Thanks to her work, she has been able provide an education to the children she greatly adores.

This is her second loan with MFP. Isabella is happy and enthusiastic about being part of her Communal Bank and promises to make all of her payments on time. She will use the money to buy chemical fertilizers for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Las Cariñositas Group

texts.es:
La señora Judith L. tiene 34 años y  vive desde hace 5 años en la colonia Santa C., Valle de Chalco Solidaridad, Edo. De México; ella tiene 3 hijas en edad escolar de las cuales, una  padece la enfermedad del asma y tanto los estudios médicos como los medicamentos necesarios para ella son muy costosos; su esposo tiene un trabajo estable como obrero pero su sueldo no es suficiente para cubrir las necesidades de su casa junto con las de su hija, es por ello que Judith juntamente con su esposo se ven en la necesidad de iniciar un negocio propio el cual les permita tener mas ingresos para su hogar.  Su esposo anteriormente adquirió la experiencia en el giro de productos naturales y cereales, por tal motivo deciden iniciar su negocio propio dentro de ese ramo  hace año y medio aproximadamente, comprando sus productos por kilos y embolsando por cantidades pequeñas, desea compran por bultos los cereales  ya que sus entregas cada día son mas grandes y no cuenta con el recurso suficiente para hacer esta inversión,  también se dedican a la elaboración de galletas hechas a base de cereales, lo cual les permite generar mayor ganancia para los estudios de sus hijas. Judith solicita un crédito a través de Fundación Realidad, A.C. junto con otros integrantes que conforman una ude a la cual le ponen por nombre Las Cariñositas.
Los que conforman el grupo son:
Alicia García              Venta de ropa        
Verónica R.            Venta de zapatos y pantalones
Pedro A.             Venta de verduras
Concepción A.       Taller mecánico
Alicia M.            Venta de zapatos
Rocío Aparici              Venta de F.
Guillermina J. C.      Venta de ropa
Delfina A.             Venta de ropa interior
Aurora López               Venta de cosméticos
Judith L.                Venta de productos naturales
Micaela R.             Taller de costura
texts.en:
Judith L. is 34 years old, and has lived for 5 years in the Santa C. colony, Chalco Solidaridad valley, Mexico. She has 3 school-aged daughters, of which one has asthma, and the medical studies and medicine for her are very costly. Her husband has a stable job as a laborer, but his income is not enough to cover the costs of their home together with those of their daughter. This is why Judith and her husband saw the need to start a business of their own, to bring them a better income for their home. Her husband already has experience in the market of natural products and cereals. This motivated them to start something along those lines about a year and a half ago, purchasing products in kilos and packaging them in smaller quantities. They would like to buy cereals in bulk. Every day their earnings are more, but it’s not enough to make this investment. Also, they bake cookies made of cereal, which brings them more income for their daughters’ studies. Judith is requesting a loan through Fundación Realidad A.C. along with the other members that make-up their group, which is named Las Cariñositas.

The members of the group are: Alicia García - Clothing sales Verónica R. - Shoe and pants sales Pedro A. - Vegetable sales Concepción A. - Mechanic shop Alicia M. - Shoe sales Rocío Aparici - Flower sales Guillermina J. C. - Clothing sales Delfina A. - Underwear sales Aurora López - Cosmetic sales Judith L. - Sales of natural products Micaela R. – Sewing of garments

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase natural products: wheat, cereal, granola, oats

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Mayamin

texts.es:
Mayamin tiene 43 años, está casada y tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 viven en su casa.
Se inició sembrando café y plátanos, y de a pocos fueron incrementando sus chacras, sobre todo  de café. La cantidad era tanta que Mayamin y su esposo no pudieron cosechar solos, debido a la abundante producción del café, entonces buscaron operarios y cosecharon prontamente; finalmente vendieron a buen precio su producto.
En ese entonces, con las ganancias compraron un carro, que es manejado por su esposo. Ahora  brindan el servicio de transporte de carga, por el cual les pagan dependiendo la distancia que recorren, pero ellos no dejan de dedicarse a sus cultivos de café, que en determinadas épocas le son muy rentables, por ello, Mayamin está muy complacida con su chacra de café.

Desde su primer ciclo de crédito y éste, el segundo, se desempeña como secretaria de su banco comunal, al cual estima muchísimo, y por ello está muy comprometida con la puntualidad en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la elaboración de un vivero de café.
texts.en:
Mayamin is 43 years old, married and has 4 children, 3 of whom live in her house. She started planting coffee and bananas, and slowly increased her fields, particularly her coffee plantings. The quantity was such that Mayamin and her husband could not harvest them alone, as there was an abundant yield of coffee. So they looked for workers and they harvested quickly, finally selling their product at a good price. At that time they bought a car with the earnings, which is driven by her husband. Now they provide goods transport services; they are paid depending on the distance that is traveled. But they have not left their activity of cultivating coffee, which at times is very profitable for them. Mayamin is very pleased with her coffee farm. From their first credit cycle to this, their second, she served as secretary of their communal bank, where she is held in high esteem. For this reason she is very committed to making her payments on time. The money that she is now requesting will be used to make a coffee nursery.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to make a coffee nursery

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es: María Teresa C. D. L. resiD. en Colon ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. María tiene 36 años D. edad vive con sus tres hijos D. 17, 16 y 11 años D. edad y su esposo. Hace nueve años María inicio su negocio aprovechando sus habilidades y conocimiento en la cocina, ella monto un comedor y tortillería donD. posee una clientela estable ya que sus clientes manifiestan que el comedor D. María es el mejor D. la zona, esto hace que la clientela D. María siga incrementado, razón por la cual solicita este crédito ya que muchas veces en la semana se queD. sin la suficiente producción comparada con la demanda D. platillos que exigen sus clientes, con tu ayuda ella podrá seguir fortaleciendo sus ventas que se verán impactadas en el bienestar económico D. la familia.
texts.en:
María Teresa C. D. L. lives in Colon, which is located in the department of La Libertad. She is 36 years old and lives with her husband and three children (age 17, 16, and 11). Nine years ago, María opened her diner and tortilla business in order to take advantage of her cooking skills and knowledge. She now has a stable and growing clientele because her customers have discovered that her food is the best in the area.

María is requesting a loan because she runs out of supplies several times during the week and is not able to keep up with her existing customer demand. With your help, she hopes to strengthen her sales so that she can positively impact her family’s financial well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies for her business

loans.name: Nancy Madelaine

texts.es:
Nancy es una madre soltera que tiene 43 años de edad y que vive junto a sus padres y su hijo de 23 años de edad en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace mas de 23 años tiene una bodega que funciona en casa de sus padres. Ella nos cuenta que empezó su negocio vendiendo bebidas gaseosas y que poco a poco lo fue ampliando. Actualmente vende abarrotes, articulos de oficina y artículos de regalo los que ofrece a los vecinos de la zona en donde vive.

Eventualmente es contratada como digitalizadora de documentos en algunas instituciones de la zona que necesitan personal de apoyo. En la fotografía ella aparece en la Comisaría de Protección de Carreteras de la zona donde en ocasiones brinda sus servicios.

Sus padres son de edad avanzada, por lo que ella da todo de si para sustentarlos, su negocio es la unica fuente estable de ingreso con la que cuentan. Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la venta de panetones por lo que está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Nancy ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus pagos. Su sueño es poder ampliar su negocio para brindarle estudios superiores a su hijo y seguir brindándole a sus padres la calidad de vida que ellos se merecen.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 43 year old single mother. She lives with her parents and her 23 year old son in the District of Paiján, Ascope Province, La Libertad region, which is 3 hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than 23 years, Nancy has operated a grocery store out of her parents’ home. She tells us that she started selling soft drinks, but she expanded gradually over time. Now she sell groceries, office supplies, and gift items to her neighbors in the area where she lives.

Eventually she secured contract work as a document digitizer for various institutions in the area that need support staff. In the photograph, Nancy is standing in front of the local office of the Highway Safety Commission where she occasionally provides her services.

Her parents are advanced in age, so she does everything she can to support them. Her business is the only source of stable income on which they can rely. Nancy hopes to increase her business by selling panettones. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Nancy has worked with us previously. She has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with her payments. Nancy dreams of expanding her business so that she can pay for her son’s college studies and continue providing her parents with the quality of life they deserve.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase "panettones" for the Christmas season

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel E. R. de 37 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Libertad con su esposa y su pequeña hija Kimberly de 4 años de edad. Miguel manifiesta ser un hombre feliz y estar en la mejor etapa de su vida, donde recientemente es padre de familia, motivo que le mucho orgullo y fuerzas a Miguel para seguir adelante y darle lo mejor a su esposa e hija. El trabaja en su propio negocio un carwash y un molino donde ofrece servicios de triturado de alimentos, como granos de café, insumos de chocolate, masa para tortillas, entre otros. Ahora el esta solicitando de este crédito que es para invertir en sus negocios, en el  carwash comprar elementos para dar mejor servicios a sus clientes en el lavado y en su molino dar mantenimiento a las maquinas.
texts.en:
Miguel E. R. is 37 years old and lives in the department of La Libertad with his wife and their 4 year old daughter Kimberly. He claims to be a happy man in the prime of his life. When he became a father, Miguel was overcome with great pride and wanted to work hard to succeed so that he could provide the best for his wife and daughter.

He operates his own carwash business as well as a mill in which he provides grinding services for various food items such as coffee, chocolate, cornmeal for tortillas, etc. Miguel is now requesting a loan so that he can invest in his businesses. He will purchase supplies for his carwash so that he can provide better service to his customers. In addition, he will pay for maintenance of his milling machines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase car wash supplies & pay for machine maintenance

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, trabaja en la empresa Herbalife, como representante de ventas de productos de nutrición y adelgazamiento. Su esposo trabaja en el Comando General de la Fuerza Naval.
Vive en la zona de miraflores de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia..
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de Tónicos, Vitaminas y otros productos de nutrición). Para continuar y consolidar su negocio.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, las ganas de superarse le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Mercedes works as a sales representative for Herbalife, selling nutritional and weight loss products. Her husband works for the General Command of the Navy. She lives in her own home in the Miraflores district of the city of La Paz.

This loan will be used as operating capital to purchase tonics, vitamins, and other nutritional products. She hopes to continue and build her business. Mercedes is requesting her first loan from IMPRO. Her desire to succeed motivated her to pursue this credit opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase nutritional products

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger es un joven soltero de 27 años, vive independientemente en una casa alquilada.	Edad, estado civil, miembros de su familia.
De sus padres heredó la responsabilidad y la dedicación a sus cultivos, él siembra café y plátanos en las chacras de sus padres. El trabajo en estos dos productos absorbe todo su tiempo, pero le place dedicarse a ello, sobre todo al café, que le es rentable, por ello cada año  elabora viveros para las plantas, las cuales vende y otra parte siembra con la finalidad de tener cosechas de forma alternada. En sus chacras, Roger trabaja solo, pero en la recolección de café emplea a sus familiares. 
Sus sueños a futuro son de encontrar a una mujer trabajadora que le gusta la chacra, y en comunión triunfar mediante la agricultura.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que muestra mucha gratitud, ya que estos préstamos le dan la oportunidad de trabajar; por ello, recalca su compromiso de cumplir con sus pagos mensuales. El dinero que solicita ahora será utilizado en la compra de fertilizantes, así como en la elaboración de viveros de café.
texts.en:
Roger is a young man who is 27 years of age and single. He inherited the responsibility for the coffee and banana crops on his parents’ farm. Maintaining these two products dominates all of his time, but he enjoys the work, especially the coffee since it is quite profitable. Each year he stocks his nursery with new plants, which are then sold and planted elsewhere by growers looking for alternative crops. In his own fields, Roger works alone but he employs relatives during harvest time.

In the future, he dreams of meeting a hardworking woman who enjoys farming and, as a couple, becoming successful in agriculture.

This is Roger’s second loan with MFP. He is grateful for these loans because they provide him with the opportunity to work. Therefore, he renews his commitment to complete his monthly payments. The money he is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers and fund the development of his coffee nursery.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & develop his coffee nursery

loans.name: Rosa Emelinda

texts.es: Rosa Emelinda C. D. Z. resiD. en colon ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Con 40 años D. edad Rosa vive con su familia que la compone sus dos hijos Edwin D. 15 años y Jenifer D. 6 años D. edad, también vive con ellos su esposo Francisco. Con las necesidades que Rosa ha visto en su hogar, han hecho ahora manejar su negocio hace apenas 3 años, donD. con muchos sacrificios y ahorros  logaron comparar productos para montar su tienda, el deseo D. Rosa es seguir fortaleciendo su negocio y esto solo pueD. ser posible con tu ayuda a través D. este crédito que Rosa utilizara para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Emelinda C. D. Z. is a resident of Colon, which is located in the department of La Libertad. She is 40 years old and lives with her husband Francisco and their two children, Edwin (age 15) and Jenifer (age 6).

Three years ago, Rosa decided to start a business in order to meet her household needs. After making numerous sacrifices and saving enough capital, she was able to establish a store and has been in business now for 3 years. Rosa desires to strengthen her business, but this is only possible with the help you proviD. through a loan. She will use the funds to restock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her store

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario es recientemente madre, vive con su pareja en la casa de sus padres. Ella y su pareja han iniciado un proyecto que les será muy provechoso en mediano plazo, consiste en la realización de un vivero de café. Los anhelos de esta pareja joven están centrados en este vivero, ya que ello será el inicio de un futuro prometedor. Pero mientras tanto, trabajan  como jornaleros, a ella le pagan 15 soles por todo el día y a su esposo 18 soles. 
Para Rosario no son pesadas las labores agrícolas, puesto que desde niña trabajó en ellas. 
Su mayor deseo es de  triunfar mediante sus cultivos de café, y sabe que lo logrará a base de mucho trabajo y la colaboración de su esposo.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que hace compromisos de pagar puntualmente cada una de sus cuotas. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en la elaboración de su añorado vivero de café.
texts.en:
Rosario recently became a mother. She and her partner live in the house of her parents. Rosario and her partner have embarked on a project that will eventually be useful – they have started a coffee nursery. The aspirations of this young couple center on this project, so they hope it will be the start of a promising future. In the meantime, they work as farm laborers. Rosario is paid 15 soles each day while her husband receives 18 soles. Farm work is not difficult for Rosario since she has been doing it since she was a young girl. Her greatest desire is to become successful at growing coffee, but she knows that it will require a lot of hard work and cooperation from her husband. This is Rosario’s first loan with MFP. She is committed to making each of her payments on time. The money will be used for the development of her coffee nursery.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Development of a coffee nursery

loans.name: Carmen Carolina

texts.es: Carmen Carolina tiene 24 años, ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este trabajo, por lo que este negocio era anteriormente de su Mama, mas tarde ella decide hacerse cargo del negocio, por lo que es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora, Carmen ha tenido un sin número de problemas como fue el estudiar y mantener su negocio, ya que lagunas veces tenía que trabajar todo el día y por las noches tenía que estudiar porque algunas veces tenia examen y es una persona muy dedica a sus estudios. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para capital de trabajo que será para la compra de pañales para bebe, ropa interior, sandalias, camisetas entre otros productos. Su deseo es poder terminar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Carmen Carolina is 24 years old and has been selling general merchandise for more than 4 years. This business previously belonged to her mother, but Carmen later decided to take over because she is a strong-willed and enterprising woman.

She faced a myriad a problems such as balancing her time between studying and managing her business. Sometimes she had to work all day and then study at night because she had an exam. Carmen is very dedicated to her studies. The loan she is requesting will be use as operating capital to buy baby diapers, undergarments, sandals, t-shirts, and other items. She hopes to finish her university studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es: Rosa Estela C. H., de 27 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Rosa vive en casa de su suegra  junto a su esposo que trabaja y sus dos hijos Cristian de 9 años de edad y Nohemy de 2 años de edad. Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora y cuenta con el apoyo de la madre de su esposo, quien le ha dado un espacio en donde Rosa pueda montar su negocio, Rosa ha instalado una venta de diversidad de productos y artículos para regalo, la tienda de Rosa es muy conocida en la zona, lo que le permite a Rosa ver la posibilidad de efectuar un aumento en  el negocio y es para ello que solicitan de este crédito, con el cual logara comprar mayor cantidad y variedades de productos para su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa Estela C. H. is 27 years old and a resident of the department of La Libertad. She and her husband live in the house of her mother-in-law. The couple has two children, Cristian (age 9) and Nohemy (age 2). Her husband is employed.

Rosa is a very hardworking woman and has the support of her mother-in-law, who provided the space for her to start a business. She sells a variety of products and gift items. Her shop is well-known in the area. Rosa saw the possibility to increase her business, so she decided to request this loan. She will use the funds to buy a variety of products in bulk for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Hacia Adelante 4-6 Group

texts.en:
Luis, 53, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro D. Macorís, Dominican Republic. Luis is the coordinator for his group, Hacia Adelante (Onward), and his story is representative of the other borrowers in the group. Luis and the other borrowers in Hacia Adelante live in Boca Chica, a small town between San Pedro and Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. Boca Chica lacks potable drinking water, has unreliable electricity, and suffers from pollution because of its location between two large cities.

Despite these difficulties, Luis operates a colmado, which is a small corner store that sells anything from bread to batteries. Luis focuses on foods in his colmado, specifically those typical of the Dominican cuisine: rice, beans, meat, flour, oil, fruits and juices. He will use this loan to purchase more of these products to sell to his customers. Luis is a single father with two children living at home, where he both lives and runs his colmado. He has successfully repaid two loans with Esperanza International, and he is excited to be taking out his third. He looks forward to continuing the development and improvement of his colmado, and he was very steadfast in expressing his good experiences with Esperanza. Thank you for lending to Luis and the Hacia Adelante group!

loans.use: Rice, beans, meat, and drinks

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La señora Eusebia es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” ubicado en  la comunidad D. Ancara, del distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 57 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 06 hijos, D. los cuales solo 1 esta a su cargo, vive en la comunidad D. Ancara, no pudo terminar sus estudios, solo hizo la primaria. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. ovinos (ganado).

Este es su primer crédito, ella requiere S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, este dinero le permitirá incrementar su capital para su negocio, comprará ovinos para engorD., que luego D. 3 meses son comercializados.

Su mayor deseo es hacer  crecer su negocio.

A ella le  gustan  las facilidades D. pago en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Sra. Eusebia is a member of the San Pedro Communal Bank which is located in the community of Ancara, Ilave Disrict, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 57 years old, married, and has 6 children of whom 1 is still a dependent. Eusebia lives in Ancara and was only able to complete elementary school.

She buys and sells sheep. This is Eusebia’s first loan, which is in the amount of 300 soles. The money will be used to increase her business capital to buy sheep for fattening. In three months, she will sell the sheep at market. Eusebia hopes to grow her business. She enjoys the simplicity of the loan repayment process.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Djélélé

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un jeune homme très dynamique, pour subvenir à ses besoins il a entamé en 2006 le commerce de chaussures, sa manière d’aborder les clients a fait qu’ils ont confiance en lui. Parfois il vend à ses plus fidèles clients et prend l’argent dans les 8 jours suivants. Il souhaite agrandir son stock de marchandises, pour y arriver il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter une trentaine de chaussures sandales et 20 chaussures fermées. Il compte réaliser un bon chiffre d’affaire en ces périodes de fêtes de fin d’année.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a very energetic young man.  To support himself, he started doing commerce in shoes in 2006.  His way of approaching his customers has won their trust.  Sometimes he sells to his most loyal customers and collects the money a week later.  He wishes to expand his stock of merchandise.  To do so, he's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy about 30 sandals and 20 closed-toed shoes.  He plans on realizing a good turnover during these periods of year-end holidays.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy footwear

loans.name: El Cedro Group

texts.es:
Este unidad de desarrollo (UDE) se llama El Cedro porque todos son de la misma colonia, que tiene este nombre.  La colonia de El Cedro está en el estado de Veracruz.   Las UDEs son grupos de más de 10 personas que tiene una cuenta de banco y tienen que reunir semanalmente o quincenalmente para realizar sus pagos.  Tiene un representante y un comité que lo gobierna.    El grupo está conformado por diez integrantes.  

El representante del grupo se llama Adolfo G. Gómez.  Adolfo es casado, tiene 48 años, y tiene en total dos hijos.  Él va a instalar una papelería en su casa y necesita el préstamo para comprar papel blanco, cartulina, y otros materiales de primaria.  Sus clientes son los niños que asistan a la escuela ubicada a media cuadra de su casa.  Él es profesor es esa misma escuela hace veintiséis años.  Nos cuenta que estos tiempos difíciles, decidió encontrar otro tipo de trabajo para ganar un poco más. Adolfo desea este préstamo para sacarse una ganancia para comprar alimentación básica para sus hijos.  Espera que algún día sus hijos terminen con sus estudios y pueden comprar sus propias casas.  Él está feliz de ser presidente de este grupo porque sin el apoyo de los demás integrantes, no recibirían este préstamo y él quiere apoyarles a los demás.

Agustina Miñón M. es parte del comité de este grupo, El Cedro, como tesorera.  Ella tiene treinta y tres años, estudió hasta el bachillerato terminado, y tiene en total dos hijos (una niña y un varón).  Ella se dedica a la venta de oro y costura y bordado pintura y necesita el préstamo para comprar joyería de oro y cristal cortado.  Sus clientes son sus vecinas, incluyendo otra integrante del grupo El Cedro, quien compró joyería y juegos de baño.  Ella se dedica a coser hace veinticuatro años y aprendió cuando asistió a una escuela, pero solo hace poco tiempo pintando.  Agustina desea este préstamo para aumentar su negocio, para sacarse una ganancia para estudios y alimentación para sus hijos.

Los otros nueve integrantes son:

Hilda L. R. – venta de ropa y perfume
José Ignacio Hernández Hernández – Mecánico
Gloria G. S. – Venta de ropa
Guadalupe Bustos C. – Venta de Calzado Por Catalogo
Teresa de Jesús Díaz V. –  cocina y venta de Churros
Juan Ángel R. R. – Venta de Abarrotes
Julio Gómez Miñón – Fabricación de Bolsas y Pulseras
Juan Fernando E. Pérez – Albañil
Daniel Lara Maza – Venta de Abarrotes.
texts.en:
This development cooperative is called El Cedro, since that is the name of the district where all of the members live. El Cedro is in the state of Veracruz. Development cooperatives are groups of 10 or more individuals who have a bank account and who have to meet weekly or every two weeks in order to make their payments. This group has a representative and a governing committee, and is comprised of ten members. The group’s representative is named Adolfo G. Gómez. Adolfo is 48 years old, married, and has two children. He is going to set up a stationery store in his home and needs a loan so that he can purchase blank paper, cards, and other supplies. His customers are the children who attend the school that is situated a half block from his house. Adolfo has been a teacher at that school for twenty-seven years. He tells us that times are difficult, and so he decided to find other work in order to earn a little more. Adolfo wants this loan so that he can increase his earnings and thus be able to purchase basic foodstuffs for his children. He hopes that his children will finish their studies someday and be able to purchase their own homes. He is happy to be the group’s president, since he wants to help the rest of the group, and without help from the other members they would not receive this loan. Agustina Miñón M. serves as treasurer on El Cedro group’s governing committee. She is thirty-three years old, completed high school, and has two children (a girl and a boy). She makes a living selling gold, hand-sewn goods, embroideries, and paintings, and needs a loan so that she can purchase gold jewelry and cut glass. Her customers are her neighbors and include other members of El Cedro group, who purchased jewelry and bathroom sets from her. She has made a living from sewing for twenty-four years and learned this craft when she was in school, but she has only been painting for a little while. Agustina wants this loan so that she can increase her business and thus increase her profits in order to pay for her children’s studies and food. The other members are: Hilda L. Romera – who sells clothing and perfume José Ignacio Hernández Hernández – a mechanic Gloria G. S. – who sells clothing Guadalupe Bustos C. – who sells shoes from a catalog Teresa de Jesús Díaz V. – who prepares and sells churros Juan Ángel R. R. – who sells groceries Julio Gómez Miñón – who makes bags and bracelets Juan Fernando E. Pérez – a bricklayer Daniel Lara Maza – who sells groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing stationery supplies, embroidery materials, etc.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr: Cette dame réside dans le quartier de Ablogamé, qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. Elle est mariée avec un enfant à sa charge. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de pagnes et de bazins. Son stock de marchandises a baissé, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner pour mieux vendre surtout en ces périodes de fêtes de fin d’année raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter  30 pagnes et 20 bazins.
texts.en:
This lady resides in Ablogamé, which is an outlying district of the city of Lomé.  She is married and has one child in her care.  Her revenue-generating business involves selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and damask fabrics.  Her stock of merchandise is low.  She would like to stock up again to sell more, especially during the year-end holiday periods.  This is why she's requesting an initial loan from WAGES in order to buy 30 lengths of pagnes and 20 of damask. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagne cloth

loans.name: Morayma Durvelyz

texts.es:
Morayma tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive desde pequeña con su abuela en el distrito de Paiján, Provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace nueve años trabaja junto a su abuela vendiendo desayunos; hace siete años trasladaron su negocio a un puesto del mercado El Tambo (el principal mercado del distrito) y desde ese entonces se han sostenido mutuamente con la ayuda de esta actividad.

Ellas empiezan su trabajo desde muy temprano, se levantan entre cinco y seis de la mañana a preparar los desayunos del día, empiezan a atender a sus clientes entre ocho y diez y media y luego compran los insumos que utilizarán al día siguiente en el mismo mercado.

Morayma está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para utilizarlos en la compra de más insumos que le permitan ofrecer nuevos platos a sus clientes y así ampliar su negocio de venta de desayunos. 

Ella es una joven responsable, trabajadora y estimada por los vecinos del lugar. Su más grande anhelo es seguir trabajando para empezar a pagarse la carrera de derecho en la universidad de la región.
texts.en:
Morayma is 22 years old, single, and has been living with her grandmother since childhood. They reside in the District of Paiján, Ascope Province in the region of La Libertad, which is 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo.

For nine years, Morayma has worked with her grandmother selling breakfasts. She moved her business seven years ago to a vending stall at El Tambo Market (the main market in the district). Since then, they have helped each other manage the business.

They start their work very early, getting up between 5-6am to prepare breakfasts each day. They begin serving customers at 8am and continue through 10:30am. Later they go shopping to buy supplies for the next day’s business at the market.

Morayma is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles. She will use the money to buy more ingredients so that she can offer new dishes to her clients and increase her sales. She is a responsible and hardworking young woman who is respected by her neighbors. Her greatest dream is to continue working so that she can begin pursuit of a law degree at the regional university.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing breakfasts

loans.name: Martha Petrona

texts.es: Martha Petrona tiene 42 años de edad, tiene 1 hija a su cargo, ella cursa el preescolar. Como toda madre responsable tiene que buscar el medio para salir adelante con su hija que le enseñado a estudiar y trabajar duro a la misma vez. Su actividad económica es  la venta de cosméticos y venta de ropa, Martha ha sido muy responsable con sus créditos ya que no es el primer préstamo otorgado por fundación. Con este financiamiento podrá comprar lo necesario para no perder a sus clientes. Ella sueña poco a poco seguir creciendo como lo ha hecho hasta los momentos gracias a esta ayuda que proviene de kiva.
texts.en:
Martha Petrona is 42 years old and has a daughter who just started preschool. Like any responsible mother, she looks for ways to support her daughter and teach her how to study and work hard at the same time.

Martha sells cosmetics and clothing. She has been very responsible with her loans since she started working with the Foundation. Martha will use the funds from this request to buy the necessary products to avoid losing customers. Her dream is to continuing growing over time like she has done now. She is thankful for the support from Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to fulfill customer orders

loans.name: Macoui

texts.fr:
Revendeuse de pagnes au grand marché de Lomé, cette dame fait face en ce moment à une réduction de son stock de marchandises ce qui a entraîné une baisse de ses recettes. Pour se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 35 pagnes de diverses qualités.
Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce elle contribue aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
A retailer of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) at the grand marketplace of Lomé, this lady is coping at the moment with an inventory shortage, which has lead to a drop in income.  To stock up again, she's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 35 pagnes of diverse qualities.  She is married and the mother of three children.  With what she earns from her commerce, she helps to meet family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagne cloth

loans.name: Adela Ignacia

texts.es:
La socia ADELA IGNACIA pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 63 años de edad, es divorciada, tiene tres hijos (dos varones y una mujer), ellos son casados y alternan sus actividades con el hogar y el trabajo, cada uno de los hijos tienen su propia familia. La socia es enfermera cesada.  

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de manualidades, bisutería artesana, artesanía, cerámica al frió y por esta navidad ella hace arreglos navideños y los envía a la ciudad de Lima.  La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción de venta de manualidades.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Adela Ignacia is a native of the city of Cusco and a member of the Amauta Communal Bank. She is 63 years old, divorced, and has three children (two sons and a daughter). All of her children are married and have their own families. They divide their time between home and work.

Adela is a retired nurse who divides her time between her household activities and selling handicrafts, handmade jewelry, and ceramics. For this Christmas season, she is making holiday arrangements to sell in Lima. Adela is requesting a loan so that she can sell more of these products.

She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase handicraft materials

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es:
La señora Valeria es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el  distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil Conviviente, tiene 03 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Ccotos, estudio educación Primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace años, es una de las socia fundadoras, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de pescado.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2700.00 Nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá para comprar mallas y también  reparar su lancha  para poder realizar la pesca y luego comercializar su producto en Capachica y Ccotos.

Su mayor deseo es poder comprar una buena lancha para poder pescar y educar a sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y la facilidad de pago de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Sra. Valeria is a member of the Communal Bank “Juchuy Niño” located in the District of Capachica, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 30 years old and in a common law marriage. Valeria and her partner have 3 children. She lives in the community of Ccotos and was able to complete her elementary school education.

Valeria has been working with Manuela Ramos for a number of years, since she is one of her group’s founding members. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to increase her business capital for selling fish.

Valeria is currently requesting a new loan of 2700 soles to buy fishing nets. She will also repair her motorboat so that she can continue fishing and sell her catch in Capachica and Ccotos.

Her greatest dream is to purchase a better motorboat so that she can earn enough money fishing to pay for her children’s education. Valeria enjoys her savings and the simplicity of the loan repayment process.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fishing nets & pay for repairs to her motorboat

loans.name: Lusia M.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Lusia M. from Mbeya. She is widow with three children, who are between the ages of 9 and 14. She is also responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents are unable to care of them. Lusia has been running a crops-selling business since 1995. She purchases crops at wholesale prices and sells at retail to get more profit. She works at the business for twelve hours a day, six days a week. Lusia currently earns monthly profit of about $104 from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more crops in bulk. In the future, she plans to open the same business at another location. Lusia thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more crops in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ten bags of maize in bulk

loans.name: Nancy Esther

texts.es: La señora Nancy Esther es una mujer trabajadora, vive en la cuidad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 45 años, es madre soltera y tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales solo el menor vive con ella. Nancy se dedica a la venta de menú (alimento), este negocio lo realiza en su casa, ella da pensión a unos trabajadores de una  empresa astillera. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Carmen Cabrejos” desde hace nueve años, el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de 300 soles, este préstamo lo utilizó para comprar pollos y venderlos en su casa. En la actualidad ella requiere un préstamo de 1000 soles que será utilizado en la compra de insumos para dar pension a los obreros de una astillería.  Otra parte del dinero lo invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir para ofrecer a sus clientes.La meta de la señora Nancy es tener un restaurante bien implementado en su casa.
texts.en:
Nancy Esther is a hard-working woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 45, single, and has four children. Only the youngest lives with her. Nancy sells fixed menu food. She does this in her house. She provides pre-ordered meals to people who work for a shipyard company. She has been part of the Carmen Cabrejos communal Bank for nine years. The first loan she received was for 300 PEN. She used the loan to buy chickens and sell them from her house. She currently needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy supplies for the meals she makes for the shipyard workers. She will use part of the money to buy clothing to sell to her customers. Nancy’s goal is to have a well equipped restaurant in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to make pre-ordered meals and buy cothes to sell

loans.name: Enea R.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30 years old Enea M. from Mbeya. She is married with 4 children, between the ages of 4 and 14. Enea has been running a clothing business since 2002. Her business is to buy clothes at wholesale and resell them at retail. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Enea currently earns about $380 US from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more clothes in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity of her business. Enea thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Rosita Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosita del Carmen tiene 39 años, ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, por lo que cada financiamiento que se le ha otorgado ha logrado cambiar un poco la situación económica de su hogar. Rosita tiene 2 hijos sus edades son de 20 y 8 años. Su actividad económica es la elaboración y venta de comida, cuando ella dio inicio a este negocio su esposo no tenía trabajo y ambos buscaron una fuente de ingresos, y todo surgió con una idea y Rosita le gustaba mucho la cocina por lo que aprovecharon esta especialidad, y así los fines de semana algunos vecinos le encargaron sus platillos. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, plátanos, maduro, azúcar y verduras. Sus sueños son de establecer un restaurante en donde el ambiente sea familiar.
texts.en:
Rosita del Carmen is 39 years old and has worked with the Foundation for a long time. With each loan that she has received, Rosita has been able to make small improvements to her financial situation. She has two children, ages 20 and 8.

Rosita prepares and sells food. When she started this business, her husband was unemployed and both of them were looking for a source of income. Rosita came up with this idea because she enjoys cooking and had to take advantage of her specialty. On the weekends, a few of her neighbors request that she prepare her dishes for them.

She is requesting a loan to purchase basic grains (such as rice), beans, ripened bananas, sugar, and vegetables. Rosita dreams of establishing a restaurant with a family atmosphere.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy ingredients

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La señora Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” ubicado en  la comunidad de Ancara, del distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 02 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Ancara Sector Cahuaya, estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años y su préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado  ovino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado mayor para engorde, los cuales comercializará en la feria zonal.

Su mayor deseo es educar a sus hijos y continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan   los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sra. Maruja is a member of the San Pedro Communal Bank which is located in the community of Ancara, Ilave Disrict, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children. Maruja completed high school and lives in the Cahuya division of Ancara.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 3 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to increase her business capital for buying and selling sheep.

Maruja is currently requesting a new loan of 1500 soles in order to buy livestock for fattening. She will sell them later at the regional fair. Her greatest hope is to continue working so that she can provide her children with an education. She enjoys her savings and the Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: María Marlene

texts.es:
María tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos niños de 9 años y 9 meses. Vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años se dedica a la venta de salchipollos y hamburguesas en un carrito sanguchero. Ella nos comenta que adquirió el carrito con la ayuda de su esposo y que con este negocio apoya al sostenimiento de su familia. También vende bebidas gaseosas.

Todas las mañanas compra los ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de su producto y sale a venderlo frente a su casa a partir de las cinco de la tarde hasta las nueve o diez de la noche. Ella es muy conocida debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus comidas.

María está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de más ingredientes con los que pueda ampliar su negocio de venta de hamburguesas así como en la  compra de un andamio para mostrar sus bebidas.

Ella ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos. Su más grande anhelo es tener una pollería para adegurarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
María is 32, married, and has two children. One is nine years old and the other is 9 months old. She lives with her husband in the Paiján district, Ascope province, in the La Libertad region. It is located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For three years she has been selling “salchipollos” (food made from fried chicken and fried potatoes) and hamburgers from a vending cart. She tells us that she got the cart with help from her husband. The business helps support her family. She also sells soft drinks. Every morning she buys the ingredients she needs to make her product. She leaves to sell her product in front of her house from five in the afternoon until nine or ten at night. She is very well known for the good seasoning she uses to prepare her food. María is asking Edpyme Alternative for a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy more ingredients, which she will use to increase her hamburger business. She will buy a stand to display her drinks. She has worked with us previously, and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments. Her biggest desire is to have a poultry shop in order to assure her children of a quality education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and a fixture to increase her hamburger business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cloth in bulk

loans.name: Baceliana

texts.es:
La señora Baceliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 5 hijos, vive en el centro poblado de San Cristóbal, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos de hace 1 año, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de pescado.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 400.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar redes y combustible para su bote así poder realizar la pesca artesanal  de 2 a 3 veces por semana, la señora también realiza trabajo de artesanía en tejido con la cual se apoya.

Su mayor deseo es poder comprarse una casa en Juliaca.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las facilidades de pago.
texts.en:
Sra. Baceliana is a member of the Communal Bank “Juchuy Niño” located in the District of Capachica, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 44 years old, married, has 5 children, and lives in the central village of San Cristóbal. Baceliana did not have the opportunity to attend school.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for one year. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to increase her business capital for selling fish.

Baceliana needs a new loan in the amount of 400 soles to buy nets and fuel for her fishing boat. She goes out to fish 2-3 times each week. In addition, she makes hand woven crafts for extra income. Her greatest dream is to buy a house in Juliaca. Baceliana enjoys her savings and the simplicity of her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase nets & fuel for her fishing boat

loans.name: Diarra

texts.fr: Diarra D. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle vend des fruits de saison : mandarine, orange, pomme. En même temps elle fait un petit commerce de beignets qu’elle fait elle même. Son objectif est d’augmenter les revenus familiaux.
texts.en:
Diarra D., age 39, is married and the mother of 6 children. She sells seasonal fruits : mandarines, oranges, apples. At the same time, she runs a small business selling homemade doughnuts. Her goal is to increase the income of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell seasonal fruits (mandarines, oranges, apples)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To diversify her milk business.

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: Bineta D. est une femme mariée, mère de 2 enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt afin d’acheter des tissus et de s’équiper en machine à coudre. Elle voudrait coudre des tissus afin de les revendre sur le marché. Avec ses revenus, elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Bineta D. is married and the mother of 2 children. She's seeking a loan in order to buy fabrics and a sewing machine. She would like to sew fabrics and sell them at the market. With her income, she intends to improve the living standard, health and education of her children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics and a sewing machine

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” ubicado en  la comunidad D. Ancara, del distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 46 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 05 hijos, vive en la comunidad D. Ancara Sector Cahuaya, estudió educación Primaria incompleta.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela R. desD. hace 3 años y su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. ganado  auquénido.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino y algunas alpacas mas, los mismo que los venderá en las feria D. la zona, esta labor la realiza una vez por semana.  Paralelamente realiza labores en el campo.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Sra. Francisca is a member of the San Pedro Communal Bank which is located in the community of Ancara, District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 46 years old, married, and has 5 children. Francisca lives in the Cahuaya division of the community of Ancara. She was unable to complete her elementary school education.

Francisca has been working with Manuela R. for 3 years. Her initial loan was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to increase her business capital for buying and selling livestock. She currently needs a new loan of 800 soles to buy sheep and some alpacas. Francisa will then sell these animals at the local fair, which she visits once a week. At the same time, she works her farmland.

Her greatest wish is to continue working. Francisca enjoys her savings and the simplicity of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep & alpacas

loans.name: Bousso

texts.fr: Bousso K. est une dame de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de fruits de saison comme les mangues, les oranges et les clémentines. Ce prêt lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Bousso K., age 44, is married and the mother of 5 children. She sells seasonal fruits such as mangoes, oranges, and clementines. This loan will enable her to better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell seasonal fruits (mangoes, oranges, clementines)

loans.name: Kissa Y.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 42 year-old Kissa K. from Mbeya. She is single with 2 children, between the ages of 10 and 15. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant because he is an orphan. 

In 1998 she established a store that sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people. 

Her store also sells second-hand clothes which come across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Tanzania to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets and in the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost, and the general appeal of anything modern. 

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Kissa currently earns about $120 US from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more used clothes and vitenge in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quality of her business. Kissa thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes and vitenge in bulk.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” ubicado en  la comunidad de Ancara, del distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 02 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Ancara Sector Apacheta, ella estudio educación superior (enfermería técnica).

Este es su primer crédito, ella requiere de S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, dinero que le permitirá incrementar el capital de su negocio de carnicería, la señora también cría ganado y los comercializa.

Su mayor deseo es agrandar su negocio y generar mayores ganancias-

A ella le  gustan  las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Señora Sabina is a member of the Community Bank “San Pedro” which is located in the community of Ancara, Ilave district, in the province of El Collao, in Puno Department. She is 39 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in the Apacheta section of Ancara. Sabina trained to be a technical nurse. This is her first loan, and she would like to borrow S/.500 soles. The money will give her more capital for her butcher’s business. Sabina also raises and sells cattle. Her greatest wish is to expand her business and earn more money. She likes the simplicity of the loan process.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a maize curing machine

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es: Maria Victoria tiene 45 años, su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de comida. Hace más de 8 años que inicio este negocio, por lo que  presenta sus estudios finalizados hasta 6 grado, a pesar de no tener mucho conocimiento es una persona que ha sabido salir adelante. Tiene 2 hijos que viven de manera independiente, la mayoría de los vecinos de Doña Maria saben muy bien que ella cocina muy bien y que sus platillos son muy deliciosos, pues ella sabe que lo que más vende son las enchiladas y sus platanitos que pueden ser acompañados con cualquier comida. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y mejorar su producción. Su deseo es seguir obteniendo más fama con sus famosos platillos.
texts.en:
45-year old Maria Victoria earns her living by making and selling food. She started her business more than eight years ago. She studied up to sixth grade, and in spite of not having much education she is a person who knows how to get on in life. She has two children who are now independent. The majority of her neighbours in Doña Maria know that she is a good cook and that the dishes she makes are delicious. Maria Victoria says that the best-selling items are enchiladas and the bananas which can be served with any dish. The money she is asking for will be used for working capital and to increase production. Her wish is to become even more renowned for her cooking.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” ubicado en  la comunidad de Ancara, del distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 36 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 03 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Ancara Sector Central, estudió educación Secundaria (incompleta).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años y su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado ovino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino para engorde y algunos chanchos, los mismo que venderá en las ferias de la zona.  Paralelamente se dedica a las labores de la chacra.

Su mayor deseo es tener un negocio exclusivo a la venta de ganado mayor.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Señora Lidia is a member of the Community Bank “San Pedro” which is located in the community of Ancara, Ilave district, in the province of El Collao, in Puno Department. She is 36 years old, married, has three children, and lives in the ‘Sector Central’ of Ancara. She has some high school education. Señora Lidia has been working with Kiva partner, the Manuela Ramos organisation, for two years. Her first loan was for S/.300 soles and was used as capital for her business buying and selling sheep. Now she needs a new loan for S/.2,500 soles to buy sheep which she will fatten up, and also some pigs which she will sell in the local markets. Lidia also works in her fields. Her greatest wish is to have a business selling cattle only. She likes being able to save money and to take training courses [through the organisation].

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sheep and pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her shop's inventory

loans.name: Fanny Rosmery

texts.es:
Fanny tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus cuatro hijos de 13, 10, 8 y 6 años de edad en casa de su madre, ubicada en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 15 años se dedica a vender agua a diversos pobladores de las zonas alejadas del distrito que no cuentan con este servicio básico. El agua la extrae de un pozo hecho por sus abuelos en la casa donde reside. Ella la vende a un precio cómodo y las personas siempre recurren a ella, e incluso cuando se corta el suministro de agua en el distrito sus  vecinos acuden a su domicilio a solicitar el agua que necesitan.

Por otro lado también se gana la vida haciendo limpieza en algunas Instituciones de la zona, durante el dia divide su tiempo y visita a los locales e incluso casas que previamente han solicitado sus servicios. Estos dos ingresos son la única fuente de ingreso con la que su familia se sostiene.

Ella está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 300 nuevos soles para brindarle mantenimiento al motor que extrae agua del pozo. Ella ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente y ha demostrado ser una cliente responsable.

Su más grande anhelo es terminar de construir su casa y brindarle a sus hijos una educacion de calidad.
texts.en:
Fanny, 35, is a single mother. She lives with her four children; 13, 10, 8, and 6. They live in her mother’s house, which is in the Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region. It is three hours from the city of Chiclay. For 15 years she has been selling water to the diverse inhabitants of the outlying areas of the district that do no have this basic service. She extracts the water from a well that her grandparents made at the house where she lives. She sells at a comfortable price, and people always turn to her. Even when they cut the water supply in her district, her neighbors come to her house to ask for the water that they need. She also earns a living cleaning in some institutions in the area. During the day she divides her time. She goes to the locations, including houses, who have previously asked for her services. These two incomes are the only source of income that supports her family. She is asking the Edpyme Alternative for a loan for 300 PEN to provide maintenance to the motor that extracts the water from the well.
