She has worked with us previously, and she has demonstrated herself to be a responsible client. Her biggest aspirations are to finish building her house and to give her children a quality education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance on the motor that extracts the water from the well

loans.name: Selia

texts.es:
La señora Selia es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” ubicado en  la comunidad de Ancara, del distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Ancara Sector Cahuaya, estudio educación secundaria incompleta.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 1 año y su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado  ovino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino,  luego del engorde  los venderá en las feria de la zona.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando, para poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros, las reuniones y las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Selia, 37, is a member of the "San Pedro" communal bank which is located in the Ancara community, Llave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is married and has 4 children. She lives in the Ancara Sector Cahuaya and completed secondary school. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost a year and her initial loan of 500 new soles was used as working capital to buy sheep to resell. She now needs a new, 800 new sol loan, which will allow her to buy more sheep which, once fattened up, will be sold in the local fairs. Her greatest wish is to continue working in order to provide her children with an education. She likes savings, meetings, and the terms of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more used clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La señora Mery, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Luz y Esperanza II”,  Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 40 años y 03 hijos,  todos ya independientes. 

Mery anteriormente, trabajaba realizando limpieza en una casa, posteriormente dejo D. hacerlo, ya que por motivos D. salud, debió reposar. Actualmente después D. su mejorarse, decidió implementar su propio negocio, D. venta D. chupetes y chichas (Bebida Regional D. la Selva, preparado a base D. maíz molido), ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes, que a día a día la frecuentan, por el sabor rico que le pone a sus chupetes.  

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,300.00, comprará ingredientes para la preparación D. su producto como azúcar en kilos,  cajas D. leche y frutas que a diario necesita para la preparación D. los chupetes, a diario cuenta con sus productos surtidos, para así poder captar una mayor clientela. 

Mary, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades D. desarrollarse en el medio donD. se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Mery, 40, is married and the mother of 3 children, all of whom are independent. She is a member of the “Luz y Esperanza II" (Light and Hope II) communal bank and lives in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She used to work as a housekeeper but had to leave this employment for health reasons. Now, having recovered, she decided to set up her own business: sale of popsicles and chichas (a regional drink from the jungle maD. from a ground corn base) from her own home, in a well-apportioned ambience, to care for her customers who daily consume from her thanks to the delicious flavor of her popsicles. With this 1,300 sol loan she will buy ingradients like kilos of sugar, boxes of milk and fruit which she needs daily for popsicle preparation which she produces daily in a variety of flavors to attract a wider clientele. Mary feels strong to continue working and persevering daily and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for the help it gives women like her to have opportunities to develop in their areas of interest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and ingredients for her popsicle preparation.

loans.name: Brenda Mireille

texts.es:
La señora S. B. BRENDA MIREILLE , tiene  23 años, vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal ESFUERZO DE MUJERES II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 3º de segundaria. Se dedica a la venta de caldos (sopas), desayunos y jugos. 
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compro mesas, sillas, para poder vender sus comidas a los transeúntes cercanos a la avenida donde vende sus productos. Ahora con el prestamos de 500.00 nuevos soles, lo invertirá para comprar una fotocopiadora, ya que paralelamente se deica al servicio de fotocopias.
BRENDA, sueña con incrementar su negocio y poner un restaurante, y tambien una bodega en su casa.
texts.en:
BRENDA MIREILLE S. B., 23, lives in the el Porvenir district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the ESFUERZO DE MUJERES II (WOMEN'S EFFORT II) communal bank. She has finished 9th grade and works selling soups, prepared breakfasts and juices. With her first 300 sol loan she bought tables and chairs so that she could sell her meals to nearby passersby on the avenue where she sells her products. With this loan of 500 new soles she will buy a copying machine since her parallel business activity is photocopying. BRENDA dreams with enlarging her business and setting up a restaurant as well as a grocery store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a copying machine.

loans.name: Gloria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Gloria de los Ángeles tiene 43 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que Gloria tenía que buscar la forma de las deudas del hogar, empezó a vender nacatamales en su humilde vivienda, y con las ganancias logro comprar un poco de ropa los fines de semana vendía sus nacatamales y por los días de semana salía a ofrecer sus productos, pero el cansancio era demasiado por lo que decidió quedarse con la venta de mercadería en general. Ahora acude a Fundación León 2000 para la compra de productos necesarios. El sueños de Gloria es tener su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Gloria de los Ángeles, 43, sells general merchandise. She has been in this business for over seven years. Gloria had to look for a way to pay the household debts. She started to sell “nacatamales” (a traditional Central American dish similar to a tamale) in her humble home. With her earnings, she was able to buy a few clothes. On the week ends she sold her nacatamales, and on the weekdays she left to sell her products. But, it was too tiring. She decided to stay with selling general merchandise. She now comes to the Fundación León 2000 in order to buy the necessary products. Gloria’s dream is to have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fruits in bulk

loans.name: Mary S.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 31 year-old Mary K. from Mbeya. She is married with 2 children, between the ages of 6 and 7. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependants. 

Mary has been running a crop selling business since 2008. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Mary currently earns about $75 US from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to pay school fees for my children. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Mary thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es: La señora María Rosario es una socia trabajadora y activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 64 años, es madre de cuatro hijos mayores de edad, su esposo es un obrero jubilado, María se dedica a la venta de bebidas y golosinas, actividad que realiza en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Carmen Cabrejos” desde hace nueve años. El primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que lo utilizó en la compra de gaseosas para vender en su casa, ahora María requiere de un préstamo de 3000 soles, que será utilizado para comprar mercadería como gaseosas, golosinas y también comprará  zapatos para vender en su casa. La meta de María es  tener una tienda de todo tipo de artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Rosario is hard-working and active member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the region of Ucayali. She is 64 years old, the mother of 4 adult children and her husband is a retired worker. María sells drinks and candy, an activity she does in her home. She has been a part of the communal bank “Carmen Cabrejos” for nine years. The first loan she obtained was for 300 soles which she used to buy soft drinks to sell in her house, now she is requesting a loan of 3000 soles. She will use this loan to buy merchandise like soft drinks, candy and also she will buy shoes to sell in her house. María’s goal is to have a store that sells all types of products for the home.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise like soft drinks, candy, and also to buy shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sugar, rice, soap and cooking oil in bulk

loans.name: Ramiro Artimidoro

texts.es:
Ramiro es un padre de familia de 58 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y el último de sus siete hijos en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 40 años se dedica a la carpinteria, aprendió el oficio de un amigo de sus padres. Con este negocio el ha sustentado a su familia durante todo este tiempo y los ha sacado adelante.  El se siente muy orgulloso ahora que la mayoria de sus hijos ya son mayores y están realizados.

Durante todo este tiempo ha fabricado puertas y camas en base a diversos pedidos hechos por sus clientes. El recibe diversos pedidos no sólo de pobladores de la zona sino que también de ciudades cercanas.

El continuo uso dado a sus máquinas ha hecho que algunas empiecen a fallar por lo que se ha visto en a necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para brindarles el mantenimiento y reparación que necesitan.

Es es un padre responsable y muy trabajador. Su más grande ahelo es empezar a fabricar muebles de manera independiente para empezar a venderlos en las ciudades cercanas.
texts.en:
Ramiro, 58, lives with his wife and youngest of his 7 children in the Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, which is located 3 hours away from the city of Chiclayo. He has been a carpenter for the past 40 years having learned his skill from a friend of his parents. He has supported his family all this time through this work. He is very proud that most of his children are now adult and fulfilled. During this time he has manufactured doors and beds based on orders placed by his customers. He receives orders not only from nearby residents but also from other nearby cities. The constant use of his machinery has caused some of it to start to fail and this has brought him to seek financing for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa in the form of a 1000 new sol loan to repair and service those that need it. He is a very responsible and hard-working father. His greatest wish is to begin to make furniture independently so that he can sell it in nearby cities.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair and service carpentry machinery.

loans.name: Ylda Gabina

texts.es:
La señora Gabina es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 7 hijos, vive en Ccotos, estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace varios años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de pescado.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, comprará una máquina tejedora para facilitar su trabajo, puesto que ahora se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías tales como prendas de vestir, también elabora bordados en bayeta.

Su mayor deseo es poder poner una casa para hospedaje en Ccotos.

A ella le  gustan  las facilidades, los préstamos y las charlas.
texts.en:
Gabina, 45, is a member of the “Juchuy Niño” communal bank located in the Capachica district, Puno province, Puno district. She is married, has 7 children, and lives in Ccotos. She finished secondary school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past several years; her initial 300 sol loan was used to increase her working capital in her fish sales business. Currently, she needs a new loan of 3000 new soles to buy a knitting machine to facilitate her work since now she is involved in making handicrafts such as articles of clothing. She also does embroidery on flannel. Her greatest wish is to set up a boarding house in Ccotos. She likes the terms, the loans, and the talks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items in bulk for her shop

loans.name: Rosa Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora  ROSA GUADALUPE D. B. tiene 40 años, vive en el distrito de LA ESPERANZA , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal VIRGEN DEL SOCORRO. Ella presenta estudios hasta 6to. de primaria refiere que por falta de recursos económicos ella empezó a trabajar desde pequeña cuidando animales y niños. 
Tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra como : papeles , cartón , plástico, latas ,etc.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró chatarra para vender.
Coneste crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles también lo utilizará para comprar chatarra al por mayor para luego venderla a las fábricas recicladoras.
ROSA sueña con reunir mas capital para así poder comprar lotes de chatarras y aumentar así sus ganancias.
texts.en:
ROSA GUADALUPE D. B., 40, lives in the LA ESPERANZA district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the VIRGEN DEL SOCORRO communal bank. She finished 6th grade and tells us that from a very early age, due to lack of economic resources, she began working caring for children and animals. She has three children who are dependent upon her. She buys scrap (paper, cardboard, plastic, aluminum cans, etc.) and resells it. With her first 300 sol loan she bought scrap items to resell. With this 300 new sol loan she will also buy scrap at wholesale to resell to recycling factories. ROSA dreams with collecting more capital in order to buy large batches of scrap therby increasing her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy scrap (junk) at wholesale.

loans.name: Christ Capable Group

texts.en:
The “Christ Capable” or “Christ is Able” Group consists of fifteen male and female entrepreneurs. After successfully repaying their 1st and 2nd loans, they are looking forward to continued success and growth in their businesses with their 3rd loan. Wideline M. is one of three representatives of the group. She is married with five young children ranging in age from 3 months to 9 yrs old.

This hardworking mom sells a variety of fresh foods including rice, beans, vegetables, dried fish and oils for cooking. She sells both in the local market and at a small stand in front of her home. Wideline is thankful for the loan because it has allowed her to provide a better life for her children.

Wideline dreams of doing great things with her business to be able to give her family a brighter future. On behalf of Wideline, Christ Capable and Esperanza we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more fresh foods including rice, beans, vegetables, dried fish and oils for cooking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more shoes in bulk

loans.name: José Jaime

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace seis años se gana la vida trabajando en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros), empezó alquilando una y luego con mucho esfuerzo puedo comprar la suya. Con el paso del tiempo ahorró nuevamente y adquirió otra unidad que es trabajada por un familiar. Usualmente se dedica a transpotar a sus clientes dentro de la misma zona e incluso llevarlos a ciudades y pueblos cercanos. Las ganancias de este negocio constituyen su única fuente estable de ingreso familiar.

El nos comenta que durante las temporadas navideñas compra panetones y los distribuye en su mototaxi por los pueblos situados alrededor del distrito. La temporada navideña ya empezó y el ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez  Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para empezar a trabajar nuevamente en este negocio.

Su más grande anhelo es poder instalar un puesto de abarrotes en el mercado de la ciudad y también adquirir un lote donde pueda construir su casa propia. El es un padre trabajador y responsable que siempre se esfuerza al máximo para sacar adelante a los suyos.
texts.en:
José is a 27-year-old, married, father of a 4-year-old son who lives with his family in the Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, which is 3 hours away from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 6 years he has earned his livelihood driving a mototaxi (motorized vehicle used in the transport of passengers and cargo). He began with a leased one and, after much effort, was able to buy his own. As time went by, he saved up again and bought a second unit, which is operated by a relative. Usually, he transports his customers within the same area and even takes them to nearby cities and towns. The profits from this work is his only stable source of income to support his family. He tells us that during the Christmas season he buys panetones (an Italian sweet bread which is a Christmastime staple) which he distributes among the towns around his district. The Christmas season has already begun and he thought it convenient to request help, for the first time, from Edpyme Alternativa, in the form of a 1000 new sol loan to start this activity again. His greatest desire is to set up a grocery stall in the city market and to acquire a lot where he can build his own house. He is a hard-working, responsible father who always tries his best to ensure that his loved ones get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy panetones to distribute from his mototaxi during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora  MARIA LUISA G. D. O. tiene 56 años, vive en el distrito D. MOCHE, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN BORJA. Ella presenta estudios hasta 6to D. primaria, refiere que es D. la sierra y que cuando ella era niña sus padre no le dieron más estudios D. secundaria, no continuo estudiando por falta D. recursos económicos por lo cual empezó desD. joven a trabajar.  Es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos, ya todos mayores y ninguno depenD. económicamente D. ella . La socia se dedica a la venta D. vegetales como: zanahoria, tomate, zapallo, papas, etc. en el mercado la Hermelinda y también se dedica a criar patos, ovejas y vacas en la chacra que tiene cerca D. su casa.
Con su primer crédito D. S/ 300 nuevos soles compró verduras y patos para criar para luego venderlos. 
Con este crédito D. S/ 1,300.00 nuevos soles comprará vegetales como: tomate, repollo, zanahoria, betarraga, papas, etc. para vender en el mercado; también comprará patos y ovejas para su crianza y posterior venta.
MARIA LUISA  sueña con aumentar sus ventas y asi obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
MARIA LUISA G. D. O., 56, lives in the MOCHE district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the SAN BORJA communal bank. She finished 6th graD. and tells us that she is from the mountain region and, as a little girl, her parents did not proviD. further schooling for her and, for lack of economic resources, did not continue with her studies and started to work while still very young. She is in a relationship and has 5 children, all of whom are adult and no longer dependent on her. She sells vegetables such as: carrots, tomatoes, pumpkin, potatoes, etc. in the La Hermelinda market. She also raises ducks, sheep and cows on the farm she has near her home. With her first 300 new sol loan she bought vegetables and ducks to raise for subsequent sale. With this 1,300 new sol loan she will buy vegetables like tomatoes, cabbage, carrots, beets, potatoes, etc. to sell in the market. She will also buy ducks and sheep to raise for later sale. MARIA LUISA dreams with increasing her sales to obtain higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables like: tomato, cabbage, carrot, beet, potato, etc. as well as ducks and sheep to raise.

loans.name: Katherin Yesenia

texts.es:
La señora  KATHERIN YESENIA U. L. tiene 18 años, vive en el distrito De FLORENCIA DE MORA, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Katherin estudio hasta 3º de secundaria, no pudo concluir sus estudios de secundaria porque salió embarazada a los 15 años, hoy en día tiene un bebe de dos añitos y medio, quien depende de ella.
Katherin se dedica a la venta de salchipollo (comida al paso) en la esquina de su casa por las tardes, de lunes a sábado, solo descansa los domingos. Este es su primer crédito, ella requiere  300.00 nuevos soles para comprar aceite por galones, papas por sacos, pollo y otros insumos para la preparación de cremas. 
Katherin sueña con administrar su propio restaurante y culminar sus estudios, para que logre dar un buen ejemplo a su bebe y lograr que este tenga estudios superiores.
texts.en:
KATHERIN YESENIA U. L., 18, lives in the FLORENCIA DE MORA district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. Katherin finished 9th grade but couldn't finish secondary education because she became pregnant at the age of 15. Today, she is the mother of a 2-and-a-half-year-old baby, who is dependent on her. Katherin sells salchipollo (fast food consisting of fried potatoes covered with shredded chicken and fried hot dog), every day except Sunday, her only day of rest, from the corner where she lives. This is her fist loan. She needs 300 new soles to buy oil by the gallon, potatoes by the sack, chicken and other ingredients to prepare her sauces. She dreams with operating her own restaurant and with finishing her studies so that she can set a good example for her baby so that he will finish advanced education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gallons of oil, sacks of potatoes, chicken and other ingredients.

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es: Maria de los Santos tiene la edad de 51 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Maria tiene 7 hijos ninguno depende de ella. La actividad económica es la  venta y elaboración de comida. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Maria inicio este negocio con muchos esfuerzos y sacrificios, ya que tenía que dedicarse a sus hijos y al mismo tiempo tenía que comprar los granos básicos para la elaboración de sus platillos. Los propósitos de Maria para su negocio son de mejorar la calidad de su comida para obtener más clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo comprar granos básicos para la elaboración de gallo pinto, tortas rellenas, enchiladas, maduro, queso y huevo cocido. El sueño de Maria es convertir su pequeño negocio en un restaurante para que sus hijos tengan un porvenir para el día de mañana.
texts.en:
Maria de los Santos is 51 years old and single. Maria has seven children but none of them depend on her. She prepares and sells meals for a living. She has been in this business for more than 5 years. Maria started this business with much effort and sacrifice since she had to raise her children and simultaneously buy the basic grains to make her meals.Maria’s business goals are to improve her food’s quality and thus have more clients. The loan will be used to purchase basic grains for the production of gallo pinto (rice and beans), tortas rellenas (stuffed sandwiches), enchiladas, maduro (plantains), cheese and cooked eggs. Maria’s dream is to turn her small business into a restaurant so her children can have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bulk grains

loans.name: Haydee Soledad

texts.es:
La señora  HAYDEE SOLEDAD J. M. tiene 44 años, vive en el distrito De FLORENCIA DE MORA, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia tiene estudios hasta 5º de secundaria. Tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales solo 2 depende económicamente de ella.
HAYDEE se dedica a la confección de calzado, solo para damas y niñas, empezó con la confección de zapatillas, las cuales opina ser mas fáciles de aprender y vender, luego ha ido confeccionando sandalias, zapatos de ocasión y ahora zapatos para niñas. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró material para la fabricación de sus zapatillas, como: lona, pasadores, plantas de jebe y de caucho, entre otros.  Con este crédito de 900.00 nuevos soles comprará material como:cuero, hilos, plantillas, suelas, hormas ,etc para fabricar mas zapatos y zapatillas.  La socia opina que este mes va a aprovechar las fiestas y sus ventas irán incrementándose mucho mas en el mes de diciembre, es por ello que en este mes ha comprado material a un costo mas económico. 
HAYDEE sueña con tener una microempresa dedicada a la fabricación y venta al por mayor de zapatillas deportivas para el colegio y ser proveedora de los centros comerciales en el Distrito de Trujillo.
texts.en:
Haydee M. is 44 years old and lives in the district of Florencia de Mora in Trujillo, Peru. Haydee was able to attend school until the fifth level of secondary school. She has 3 children, but only two are still dependent on her for financial support. Haydee makes and sells shoes for women and children. She started with slippers, which in her opinion are the easiest to make and to sell. Later, she began making sandals, dress shoes, and now children's shoes. With her first loan, she purchased materials needed to make her shoes, such as canvas, fasteners and rubber amongst other things. With the new loan, she will purchase new materials such as leather, heels, soles, etc, to make more shoes and slippers. Haydee says that this month she can take advantage of all the holidays and her business will grow even more in the month of December. That's why she wants to purchase materials this month at good prices. Haydee dreams of having a wholesale business making and selling sports shoes for colleges, and providing shoes to the commercial centers in Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for making shoes, such as heels, leather, moulds, etc

loans.name: Cristhian Manuel

texts.es:
Cristhian tiene 18 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su madre y sus hermanos en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años trabaja en la moto que uno de sus hermanos le ha dejado a su cargo. Usualmente trabaja en el mismo distrito. Con estos ingresos cubre sus gastos personales y ayuda al sostenimiento de su familia.

Debido al constante uso dado a su unidad móvil durante los últimos meses, esta ha empezado a sufrir serias fallas que requieren de la compra de nuevas piezas. Por este motivo está solicitando por primera vez  a Edpyme Aternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la reparacion y mantenimiento de la unidad con la que trabaja.

Su más grande anhelo es poder comprar su propia mototaxi y empezar a estudiar Ingenería de Sistemas en la universidad de la región. El es un joven dinámico y muy responsable.
texts.en:
Cristhian is 18 years old and single. He lives with his mother and his brothers in the district of Paijan in the La Libertad region, located 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo. For two years now Cristhian has worked driving a motor taxi that one of his brothers loaned to him. He usually works in the same district where he lives. The money he earns helps cover his personal expenses, and also helps to sustain his family. Due to the constant use of his motor taxi these last few months, he has begun to suffer from various mechanical problems that require the purchase of new parts. He is requesting his first loan so that he can invest in the repair and maintenance of his scooter, his only source of income. Cristhian's dream is to be able to purchase his own motor taxi and begin to study Systems Engineering at the university in his region. He is a dynamic and very responsible young man.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for repair and maintenance on his motor taxi

loans.name: Camino A La Santidad 2&4 Group

texts.en:
Eransly, 33, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro D. Macorís, Dominican Republic. He is the coordinator for his group, “Camino a L. Santidad” (Road to Sainthood), and his story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Eransly and the other borrowers in Camino a L. Santidad live in Batey Santa Fe. Bateyes are small communities built up around the housing constructed by sugar companies for their workers. Bateyes are remote and difficult to access, lack potable water and any kind of reliable electricity, and have limited medical facilities, if any at all. Eransly lives in a crowded, wood-panel home with his wife and six children.

Despite the difficulties of living in a batey, Eransly has a successful business selling shoes. Since Santa Fe is so far from other places, its residents must walk everywhere, and worn-out shoes mean more business for Eransly. Since taking out his first loan (he is now on his third), Eransly said he no longer has to worry about sending his children to school. He said his family’s progress has significantly improved, and he is very thankful for having this opportunity.

Thank you for lending to Eransly and to the Camino a L. Santidad group!

loans.use: To buy new shoes to sell in his community

loans.name: Silvia Yaneth

texts.es: Silvia Yaneth A. L. de 30 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad. Silvia vive con su esposo quien trabaja como comerciante y su hijo de 7 años de edad que estudia la primaria. Silvia recibe el apoyo económico de su esposo quien obtiene ganancias netas de $200 US mensuales, ella se dedica a su negocio que se encuentra ubicado en el centro de Ciudad Arce donde hay mucha afluencia por el comercio que hay en la zona,  el puesto de Silvia ofrece la mejor calidad en frutas y verduras frescas, ya que  sus compras las realiza a diario, es por ello que siempre termina el día vendiendo todos su inventario, ya que sus clientes prefieren su calidad en verduras, ahora ella solicita de un crédito que le permita aumentar su inventario en frutas y verduras, para logar así aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Silvia is 30 years old and lives in a city called Arce in La Libertad. She lives with her husband who works as a shopkeeper, and their 7 year old son who attends school. Silvia receives economic support from her husband, who earns around $200 a month, and she runs a small stand located in the center of the city where there is a lot of affluence from the business conducted in that zone. Silvia offers her customers high quality fresh fruits and vegetables which she buys and sells each day, always finishing the day having sold all of her inventory. She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory and her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her business and increase her sales

loans.name: Roberto Elías

texts.es: Roberto Elías S. R. reside en Santa Tecla municipio del departamento de La Libertad. Roberto tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, Roberto de 15 años de edad y Rebeca de 11 años de edad, ambos niños estudiantes. Roberto posee una gran experiencia en los negocios, ya que desde muy joven empezó trabajando en ello, como comerciante de ropa, pero ahora él ha tenido la oportunidad de instalar su propio negocio gracias a la ayuda de créditos otorgados donde él ha sido muy puntual, en esta ocación el solo desea surtir su negocio que en los últimos meses se ha visto que ha aumentado la demanda y por ello que con la ayuda de préstamo el podrá surtir su inventario y seguir creciendo,  que te lo agradecerá el  y toda su familia.
texts.en:
Roberto Elías S. R., 42, lives in the Santa Tecla municipality of the La Libertad department. He lives with his wife and two sons: Robert, 15, and Rebeca, 11. Both children are in school. Roberto has a lot of experience as a merchant, since he started working in clothing sales from a very early age. Now, he has been able to set up his own store thanks to the credits granted. He has always been very punctual with repayments. Now, he just wants to restock his store because in the last few months demand has increased and, with the help of the loan, he will be able to stock inventory and continue to grow. For this he, and his entire family, will be very grateful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock his store.

loans.name: Blanca Elizabeth

texts.es: Blanca Elizabeth L. D. B. resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad. Blanca ha llegado a sus 54 años D. edad, siendo la misma mujer encantadora y luchadora en su negocio, actualmente vive con su esposo don Manuel quien ha sido un gran pilar en la vida D. Blanca y sus dos hijas María D. 28 años D. edad quien trabaja y Ruth D. 11 años D. edad estudiante D. básica. Blanca empezó su comercio hace trece años, haciendo diariamente diversidad D. antojitos para vender desD. su casa, su negocio se ha mantenido estable y ha crecido notablemente, ahora Blanca solicita un crédito que le dé la oportunidad D. seguir ampliando su producción D. antojitos.
texts.en:
Blanca Elizabeth L. D. B., 54, lives in the La Libertad department. She has reached her 54th birthday being the same enchanting and hard-working woman tending her business. She lives with her husband, Manuel, who has been a great pillar in Blanca's life, and her two daughters, Maria, 28, who is employed, and Ruth, 11, who is an elementary-school student. Blanca started her business three years ago making a variety of snacks to sell from her home. Her business has stayed stable and grown noticeably. Now, Blanca requests funding which will allow her to expand her production of snacks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her snacks.

loans.name: Blanca Yde

texts.es: Blanca Yde V. V. reside en Colon municipio del departamento de La Libertad. Blanca de 45 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Blanca es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, actualmente ella maneja sola sus dos negocios una tienda con productos de consumo y una sala de belleza, en la cual posee gran experiencia, por empleos anteriores que Blanca ha tenido, eso le permite dar excelente servicios a sus clientes y seguridad de buen trabajo. Aunque para ella es muy cansado estar a  cargo de sus negocios, pero aun no le es posible contratar a alguien para que le ayude, por el momento su único deseo es seguir creciendo en su negocio surtiendo su tienda y sala de belleza ,  y así poder ampliar sus ganancias que son de gran necesidad en la familia.
texts.en:
Blanca Yde V. V. is a resident of the town of Colon in the department of La Libertad. She if 45 years old and lives with her husband and two children. Blanca is a hardworking and responsible woman who manages two businesses, a beauty salon and a store that sells consumer products. She has a wealth of experience from her previous jobs, which has enabled her to provide excellent customer service and job security for herself. Although managing both businesses tires her out, Blanca says she is not able to hire an assistant. For now, her only wish is to keep both of her businesses growing so that she can increase her earnings to provide for her family’s greatest necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provide operating capital for her two businesses (general store & beauty salon)

loans.name: Gloria Marina

texts.es: Gloria Marina R. reside en Santa Tecla municipio del departamento de La Libertad. Gloria tiene 56 años de edad vive con su esposo quien es empleado y su hija Ana de 20 años de edad estudiante de bachillerato. Hace siete años Gloria tuvo la idea de elaborar tortillas por las tardes desde su casa, ya que en todo su pasaje no había negocio como ese y es así como la Sra. Gloria cada medio día se colca a las a afuera de su casa e instala una bolsa platica suficientemente gruesa para cubrirse de la lluvia y el sol, ahora ya es muy conocida en la zona y su estabilidad de clientes es excelente. El destino del crédito que solicita es para invertir en materia prima para  su negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria Marina R. is a resident of the town of Santa Tecla in the department of La Libertad. She is 56 years old and lives with her husband who is employed and her 20 year old daughter Ana who is studying for her bachelor’s degree. Seven years ago, Gloria came up with the idea to make and sell tortillas since there were no similar businesses. She prepares the tortillas from her home in the afternoons. Every day around noon, she covers a space outside of her house with a plastic tarp in order to shield herself from the rain and the sun. She is now well-known in the area and has a stable clientele. Gloria will use her loan to purchase ingredients for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies for her tortilla business

loans.name: Activos De Santa Fe 1-3 Group

texts.en:
Alfred, 42, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. He is the coordinator for his group, “Activos de Santa Fe” (Assets of Santa Fe), and his story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Alfred and his fellow borrowers from Activos de Santa Fe live in Batey Santa Fe (Holy Faith). Bateyes are small communities built up around the housing constructed by sugar companies for their workers. Bateyes are remote and difficult to access, lack potable water and any kind of reliable electricity, and have limited medical facilities, if any at all. Alfred is a single father of one son, 13, who lives with him in their home.

Despite the difficulties associated with living in a batey, Alfred remains optimistic for his future. With this loan, his third with Esperanza, Alfred plans to purchase more clothing and shoes to sell in his shop. He is also optimistic about his son’s future, saying that the loans have helped his son by giving him more time to study rather than having to work around the house.

Thank you for lending to Alfred and to the Activos de Santa Fe group!

loans.use: To purchase more clothing and shoes to sell

loans.name: Juana De Jesús

texts.es: Juana De Jesús R. de 45 Años de edad, reside en  Concepción en el departamento de La Unión. Hace 20 años el esposo de Juana murió quedándose desabrigada y con sus dos hijos que en aquellos años eran unos bebes, ahora soy el orgullo de Juana por ser unas personas honradas y responsables su hijo mayor es Carlos de 24 años de edad está a unos meses de graduarse de la universidad y su hija Clara de 22 años de estudiante universitaria también. Juana ha luchado mucho para salir adelante siempre dedicándose al comercio, actualmente posee una venta de hamburguesas y hotdog a las afueras de su casa,  ella esta solicitando de este crédito para poder ampliar sus ventas con mayor  variedad de antojitos para comercializar.
texts.en:
Juana De Jesús R. is 45 years ago and lives in Concepción in the department of La Unión. Twenty years ago, Juana was left without any support when her husband passed away while her two children were still babies. Today she is proud that her children are honorable and responsible people. Her son Carlos is 24 years old and months away from graduating from university. Her daughter Clara is 22 years old and also a university student.

Juana has fought hard to get ahead and has always been dedicated to her business. She currently sells hamburgers and hot dogs in front of her house. She is requesting a loan so that she can increase her sales and offer a wider variety of snacks to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her business

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es: Ana Vilma D. A. reside en Berlín en el departamento de Usulután. Ana tiene 31 años de edad es soltera y madre tres niños aun menores de edad. El negocio de Ana surgió tras la necesidad de esta joven mujer por sacar a sus hijos adelante ya que no cuenta con el respaldo del padre de los niños, ella ha instalado un negocio en el mercado municipal de Usulután y lleva como nombre “Venta de Ropa Dorita”, el negocio de Ana como su nombre lo dice, es la venta de ropa, que en su mayoría es para niños y niñas, el motivo del crédito que solicita es para surtir su negocio con más variedad de ropa no solo para niños, sino también para adolecentes y adultos, así podrá ampliar mas su panorama de comercialización.
texts.en:
Ana Vilma D. A. is a resident of Berlin in the department of Usulután. She is 31 years old and a single mother of three dependent children. Ana started her business so that she could provide for her children since she lacks the support of their father. Her business is called “Venta de Ropa Dorita” and is located in the Usulután municipal market. As the name implies, she sells clothing, mostly for boys and girls.

The loan she requested will be used to restock her business with a wider variety of clothing, not only for children, but also for teenagers and adults. This will allow her to expand her customer base.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for her store

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es: Ana Francisca B. reside en Santiago de María del departamento de Usulután. Ana tiene 31 años de edad reside en casa de sus suegros con su esposo y sus dos hijas, Ana de 6 años y Karen de 3 años de edad. Hace cinco años Ana inicio su negocio que lo ha llamado “Tienda Koqui”, donde vende productos para el hogar, para ella es muy difícil lograr buenas ganancias ya que como se puede observar en la fotografía su negocio se encuentra sin mucho productos, es por ello que Ana solicita de tu ayuda, con la cual ella lograra surtir su negocio y mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Ana Francisca B. is a resident of Santiago de María in the department of Usulután. She is 31 years old and lives in the house of her in-laws with her husband and two daughters, Ana (age 6) and Karen (age 3). Five years ago, Ana started her business called “Tienda Koqui” where she sells household products. She has a difficult time generating good revenues because, as you can see in the photograph, her store is stocked with very few items. For this reason, Ana is requesting your assistance so that she can increase the inventory for her business and improve her financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay for the installation of a security gate in front of her house

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando P. reside en el departamento de Usulután. Rolando tiene 49 años de edad, es soltero y actualmente vive con su madre doña Esperanza. Rolando es muy conocido por su experiencia en las ventas, desde hace muchos años él se dedica a comercializar cualquier tipo de mercadería, ahora tiene un puesto ubicado en el centro de Usulután donde vende y repara relojes, también ofrece bolsones y otro tipo de joyas, el crédito que el solicita es para suministrar su negocio de variedad de artículos y así seguir ampliando sus ventas al igual que sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Rolando P. is a resident of the department of Usulután. He is 49 years old, single, and currently lives with his mother Doña Esperanza. Rolando is well-known for his sales experience and has been dedicated to marketing any type of product. He now has a vending location in central Usulután where he sells and repairs watches. Rolando also offers handbags and other types of jewelry.

He is requesting a loan to restock his business with a variety of products so that he can continue increasing his sales as well as his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his business

loans.name: Alex

texts.es:
Alex es su joven soltero muy empeñoso de 19 años, vive en la casa de sus padres. A temprana edad buscó independizarse económicamente, con la fiel convicción de pagar su educación, ya que su anhelo es estudiar, por lo menos una carrera técnica y de ese modo proyectarse a nuevas cosas para el futuro. Con ese fin sembró sus propios cultivos de plátanos y café en las chacras de sus padres, él está consiente que no le va ser nada fácil, pero lo que tiene de sobra son esperanzas de forjarse una carrera. Y cuando veces tiene complicaciones, ahí  están sus padres para apoyarlo y animarlo.
Para Alex trabajar en sus cultivos no le es nada pesado, puesto que lo realizó desde su infancia, más bien su preocupación es lograr un cupo en el instituto donde quiere estudiar.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser un cliente muy puntual en sus cuotas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita lo invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para el abonado de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Alex is 19 years old, single, and a hardworking young man. He lives at home with his parents. Alex sought to become financially independent at an early age. With a desire to study, he felt convicted to pay for his education and earn at least a technical degree so that he can plan new things for the future. In order to do this, he planted his own banana and coffee crops in his parents’ fields. He is aware that the work will not be easy, but he is hopeful that he will be able to forge a career. When he runs into complications, he will have his parents to support and encourage him.

Working with crops is nothing new for Alex since he has lived on a farm since childhood. His main concern is getting admitted into the institution where he wants to study.

Alex is seeking his second loan with MFP. Since joining his Communal Bank, he has demonstrated that he is very punctual with his payments. The money he requested will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Alma Rosibel

texts.es: Alma Rosibel D. A. reside en el departamento de Usulután al  oriente del país. Alma tiene 21 años de edad es madre soltera de dos niños de 8 y 3 tres años de edad. Alma recibe solo $60 US, por parte del padre de sus hijos, dinero que no le es suficiente para los gastos que representa todo el hogar, es por esta razón que hace un año y medio, a través de sus ahorros ella ha montado una tienda en su hogar, Alma esta consiente que sola no podrá, ya que no cuanta con los recursos económicos suficientes para surtir bien su tienda, ahora ella solicita de este crédito para poder comprar variedad de productos para su negocio y así obtener mayores ganancias que son de gran ayuda para los gastos que asume día a día.
texts.en:
Alma Rosibel D. A. lives in the department of Usulután, which is in the eastern part of the country. She is 21 years old and a single mother of two children, ages 8 and 3. Alma receives only $60 USD from the father of her children, but this is not enough to cover the expenses for her entire household. For this reason, she used her savings to open a store out of her home and has now been in business for 1½ years.

Alma is aware that she does not have the financial resources to keep her store well-stocked. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy a variety of products for her business. This will help her generate better earnings and provide needed assistance in meeting her daily expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for her store

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 39 years old and has a photography business, providing photos and videos for individuals and weddings. He has been in business for eleven years and has successfully completed a previous Faulu loan of Kes 40,000. He is now requesting a loan of Kes 65,000 to purchase a camera.

Patrick describes himself as an ambitious risk-taker who is geared to achieve his goals and dreams. He says that since joining Faulu, he takes record-keeping more seriously. His hope is to become an employer and a leading player in his field.

loans.use: To buy a camera

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva es un mujer muy alegre de 44 años, está casada y es madre de 6 hijos, de los cuales, 2 de ellos viven en su casa. 

Su actividad cotidiana y la de su esposo, es el podado y el macheteo de los arbustos que interfieren el buen desarrollo de sus plantas de café, piña y plátanos. Por ello, después de preparar sus alimentos, desde las 9 de la mañana se instala en su chacra hasta las 6 de la tarde.
Pese al trabajo sacrificado se siente contenta de dedicarse a esta labor, siendo la pina el producto que mayor tiempo le absorbe, pero también es el que le permite captar buen dinero en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Lima.
En el caso del café, espera cada año la temporada de cosecha que es cuando tiene bonanza económica y con esas ganancias puede adquirir algunas cosas para su hogar e invierte en nuevos cultivos. 

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, ella está muy agradecida por ser parte de su banco comunal, al que estima mucho y por ello no quiere caer en morosidad. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de café y piña.
texts.en:
Elva is a very cheerful woman. She is 44 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children of whom 2 still live at home.

The daily routine for Elva and her husband includes using machetes to clear shrubs that can interfere with the growth of their coffee, pineapple, and banana crops. After preparing their meals, Elva heads out at 9am to work in the fields until 6pm in the evening. Despite the hard work and sacrifice required, she is happy to engage in this type of activity.

Growing pineapples takes the most time and effort, but it also attracts the best prices at the wholesale markets in Lima. In the case of coffee, she has to wait until after every harvest season to determine whether or not prices will be good. With the profits she earns, Elva is able to buy items for her home and invest in new crops.

This is Elva’s second loan with MFP. She is grateful to be part of her Communal Bank. She has great respect for the other members, so she does not want to fall behind in her payments. The money she requested will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers for her coffee and pineapple crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Evelin Ruth

texts.es: Evelin Ruth J. D. R. resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután con su esposo y sus dos hijos Isaías D. 11 años y Alexandra D. 9 años D. edad. Evelin se dedica a su negocio con dieciséis D. experiencia, ella posee un local ubicado en unas D. las calles del centro D. Usulután, donD. venD. variedad D. ropa y prendas interiores, el deseo D. Evelin es poder ampliar su negocio, motivo por el cual esta solicitando un crédito con el cual ella obtendrá beneficios para su negocio y su familia.
texts.en:
Evelin Ruth J. D. R. lives in the Department of Usulután with her husband and their two children, Isaías (11 years old) and Alexandra (9 years old). Evelin has works away at her business with 16 years of experience. She has a location in one of the streets in central Usulután, where she sells a variety of clothing and underwear. Evelan’s dream is to be able to grow her business. Motivated by this, she is asking for a loan with which she would obtain benefits for her business and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow Evelin's business

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora tiene 38 años, viven en la casa de su madre, junto a su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos. Le gusta dedicarse a agricultura, ya que esta actividad la realizo desde su infancia, por ello cada día trabaja en el macheteo de los arbustos de sus chacras de plátanos y café, con el liderazgo de su esposo. Dos veces a la semana cosechan los plátanos, para ello se levantan a las 4 de la madrugada, ya que a las dos de la tarde, del mismo día, ya los están comercializando.
Pero su cultivo preferido es el café, porque le permite acumular mayores cantidades de dinero en una sola cosecha y con esas ganancias puede comprar la vestimenta y demás requerimientos de sus hijos que están estudiando.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y está muy agradecida por ser parte su banco comunal, por ello se compromete a no fallar en el pago de ninguna de sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Flora is 38 years old. She lives in a house with her mother, along with her partner and father of her 3 children. She likes to work in agriculture, since this is the work she has done since she was an infant, for which she works each day with a machete on the bushy growth on her banana and coffee farm, with the leadership of her husband. Two times a week they harvest the bananas, and for this they rise at 4 in the morning until at 2 in the afternoon of the same day, they are all sold. But her favorite thing to grow is coffee, because it allows her to save larger amounts of money in a single harvest, and with these earnings she can buy the clothing and other needs of her children who are studying. This is her second loan with MFP and she is very grateful to be part of the community bank. Because of this, she promises to not miss any of her payments. The money that she is now asking for she would invest in the purchase of chemical fertilizers for her coffee farm.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel Antonio M. L. reside en Tecoluca en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Manuel de 45 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, de 23, 20, 16 y 10 años de edad. Manuel se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, negocio que hace desde su casa con quince años de experiencia, el no solo vende los granos básicos sino también los cosecha, es por eso que sus clientes son fieles, ya que reconocen de la buena calidad de arroz y frijoles que don Manuel saca de sus cultivos, el solicita de un crédito para poder comprar mayor cantidad de semillas, abono y fertilizantes;  y así poder logar una cosecha mas grande la siguiente temporada.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio M. L. lives in Lecoluca in the Department of Ahuachapán. Manual is 45 years old and he lives with his wife and their four children, who are 23, 20, 16, and 10 years old. Manual works selling basic grains, a business that he does from his home with 15 years of experience. He doesn’t only sell grains, but he also harvests them, and this is why his clients are loyal, since they recognize the good quality of the rice and beans that Don Manuel gets from his farm. He is asking for a loan in order to be able to buy a larger quantity of seeds and fertilizers; and in this way he will be able to get a bigger harvest next season.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for Manuel's farm

loans.name: José Esteban

texts.es: José Esteban H. reside en el departamento de La Libertad. José tiene 52 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos Alejandro de 18 años y Tania de 17 años de edad. La esposa de José es empleada generando $75 US mensuales y José se dedica a su negocio una carpintería con veinte años de experiencia en la misma, “Carpintería La Venta”, como la ha llamado José, ofrece madera cortada y ya pulida; el motivo por el que José solicita de este crédito, es para poder comprar mayor cantidad de madera y así lograr expandir su distribución a mas clientes.
texts.en:
José Esteban H. lives in the Department of La Libertad. José is 52 years old. He lives with his wife and their two children, Alejandro, who is 18 years old, and Tania, who is 17 years old. José’s wife is a working woman who makes $75 USD monthly. José works at his business as a carpenter. He has 20 years of experience in this business, “Carpentry Sales”, as José calls it. He offers cut wood and already polished; the reason why José asks for this loan is to be able to buy a larger quantity of wood and so suceed in expanding his distribution to more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy larger amounts of wood

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy tiene 31 años, está casado y es padre de dos hijos, con los que vive en su casa. Casi siempre, se le encuentra con el machete en la mano, ya que tiene que estar constantemente quitando los arbustos, en aras de mantener limpias sus chacras de café y plátanos.
Ser agricultor le llena de mucha satisfacción, por eso prefiere dedicarse todo el día a ello, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta 5 de la tarde. La mayoría de las veces trabaja solo, pero para las cosechas su esposa lo apoya en la recolección de los granos. Una vez terminada la cosecha vende su café a las diversas acopiadoras de su zona.
Con las ganancias obtenidas compran los comestibles para el hogar por sacos, ya que el resto de los meses las cosechas de plátanos es para cubrir los gastos diarios.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por ello se encuentra muy motivado y hace el compromiso de pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. El dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Fredy is 31 years old. He is married and is the father of two children, with whom he lives in his house. Almost always, he is found with a machete in his hand, as he constantly has to cut back the trees from his ploughed land, in order to keep his coffee and banana farm clear. To be a farmer gives him much satisfaction, and because of this he prefers to spend all day on this work, from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon. The majority of the time he works alone, but during the harvests his wife helps him to collect the beans. When the harvest is over, he sells his coffee to various collectors in his neighborhood. With the income that he obtains, they buy the food for the home by the sackful, so that in the rest of the months the harvest of bananas is to cover the daily expeneses. This is his first loan with MFP, because of this he is very motivated and has committed to pay his installments punctually. The money that he is asking for he thinks to invest in the purchase of chemical fertilizers for his coffee farm.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Calidez Group

texts.es:
El grupo Calidez está integrado por Olga María S., Alicia L. S. y Magali Nohemí G. L..  La señora S. inicio vendiendo dulces como caramelos y chiverías ahora tiene una modesta venta.

Alicia L. S. vende sopas y nacatamales los fines de semana y Magali G. vende leña. Este grupo lleva cinco ciclos con Adim en los cuales han ido prosperando y esperan seguir adelante
texts.en:
The group Calidez is make up of Olga María S., Alicia L. S. and Magali Nohemí G. L.. Señora S. began selling sweets like caramels and sweets, and now she has a small shop. Alicia L. S. sells soup and nacatamales (steamed corncakes) on the weekends, and Magali Gonzalas sells firewood. This group has done five loans with ADIM, in which they have prospered, and they hope to continue on.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy business supplies

loans.name: Isela

texts.es:
Isela tiene 21 años, vive en casa de sus padres, junto a su pareja y padre de sus dos hijos. Hace tres años realizaron su primera siembra de café en las chacras de sus padres, ella y su pareja le dedicaron todo su tiempo y trabajo. Su labor se iniciaba a las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde porque sus sueños y anhelos se centraban en este producto. Hoy sus cultivos de café han gratificado su esfuerzo, brotando granos muy parejos, como nos muestra en la foto.
Isela está llena de esperanzas por cosechar buena cantidad de café, para ello le hace falta de abono para que se ruborice el café.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y ratifica su compromiso de pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita, comprará los fertilizantes necesarios para sus plantas de café.
texts.en:
Isela is 21 years old, and lives with her parents along with her partner and father of her two children. Three years ago, they had their first coffee harvest in her parents’ small farm. Isela and her partner dedicated all their time and efforts to the crop. Their work begins at 8 in the morning and ends at 6 in the evening because all of their dreams and wishes are at the core of this product. Today their coffee harvest has rewarded their efforts since they have very even beans, as seen in the picture.

Isela is full of hope to keep harvesting a good quantity of coffee, and for that she needs fertilizer so that the coffee will redden.

This is her second loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and once more is committed to pay all her quotas punctually. With the money, she will buy the necessary fertilizers for her coffee plants.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertlilizer.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 34 years old and married with a four-year-old daughter. She has been a dressmaker for the past four years, having previously worked as a casual laborer.

Lydia is requesting a loan of Kes 20,000 to purchase a sewing machine. She describes herself as patient, focused, and determined and says that Faulu has taught her to strategize for the future.

Lydia’s dream is to live a happy life with her family and to operate a well-established company.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier tiene 41 años, es soltero y vive en su casa acompañado de sus mascotas. Con mucho esmero y dedicación trabaja en sus cultivos de plátanos y café. Cada 5 años  renueva sus plantas de plátanos, porque las hojas amarillas no son signos de una buena producción. Adicionalmente, trabaja como operario en las chacras de sus vecinos y cuando lo buscan para algún trabajo, no lo llaman por su nombre, sino que graciosamente gritan su apodo, “Capulina”. Javier es muy buscado para las faenas del macheteo porque realiza un buen trabajo, además es muy cumplidor y responsable. Por su trabajo cobra entre 15 a 18 soles diarios, con ello y las ganancias de sus propios cultivos puede vivir holgadamente.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, siendo muy puntual en sus pagos, además le complace las reuniones de su banco comunal porque todos son muy alegres y bromistas. El dinero que ahora solicita es para que la compra de plantitas de plátanos, ya piensa renovar dichos cultivos.
texts.en:
Javier is 41 years old, is single and lives in his home with the company of his pets. With a lot of work and dedication, he cares for his crops of bananas and coffee. Every 5 years he replants his baN. plants because the yellow leaves are not a good sign of good production. Additionally, he is a workman in his neighbor’s small farms and when they need him for a job they don’t call him by his given name, but call him by his nickname “Capulina.” Javier is very sought after to work with the machete because he does a good job since he is very reliable and responsible. For his job, he charges between 15 and 18 soles daily, and with that and his profits from his own crops, he lives a comfortable life.

This is his second loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner), he is very punctual with his payments. What's more, he enjoys the meetings with his communal bank because everyone is very joyful and good-humored. The money will be used to buy small baN. plants, and thinks of renovating the aforementioned crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy banana plants.

loans.name: Las Invensibles Group

texts.es: El Grupo “Los Invencibles” están representados por la señora Flora  y conformado por 12 miembros que cursan su primer ciclo. Las socias tienen diferentes actividades como la venta de productos como venta de pan, cosméticos, zapatos, ropa, abarrotes, verduras, y al transporte público en moto taxis y vehículos. El comercio en este grupo es muy variado, su nivel de ventas es muy bueno, teniendo buena rentabilidad y capacidad de pago a pesar de existir bastante competencia.  El crédito esta destinado al incremento de su capital, esperan mejorar sus ventas  y el crédito será invertido en la compra de más mercadería que será utilizado para generar mayores ganancia para poder otorgarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida y un futuro mas prometedor a sus hijos que son su razón para seguir adelante. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia los socios ya trabajaron atentes en instituciones financieras similares a la Fundación Agrocapital a la que están muy agradecidos por la confianza y el apoyo económico brindado.
texts.en:
The “Los Invencibles” (The Invincible Ones) group is made up of 12 members who are in their first loan cycle; they are led by Flora. The members have a variety of activities such as bread, cosmetics, shoes, clothing, groceries, and vegetable sales and public transportation in vehicles and mototaxis. The group's commerce is varied, their sales levels are good and produce good income and good ability to repay even though there is a lot of competition. The financing will be used to increase their working capital hoping to increase sales. They will buy additional merchandise to generate higher profits to provide better quality of life for their families and a more promissing future for their children, who are their reason to continue forward. In regard to credit history, these members have prior experience working with financial institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital to which they are grateful for the confidence and economic help received.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ingri

texts.es: El Sra.  Ingri la cliente es oriunda de Santa Cruz, vive en la localidad de el Torno poblacion que esta aproximadamente a 120 Kms de la ciudad  de Santa Cruz. La  experiencia en la venta de muebles es de 20 años, en el lapso de ese tiempo establecio su propio negocio . La señora cuenta con  domicilio propio, en el cual se encuentra su negocio. Actividad economica que tiene la Sra. Ingri, venta de muebles, lo realiza en compañia de su esposo. El credito destinara a la compra de una motocicleta a la cual le anexara un carrito para el traslado de sus productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ingri is a native of Santa Cruz, and lives in Tomo, about 120 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. She has about 20 years of experience selling furniture and during that period she established her own business. Mrs. Ingri has her own home, where she has her business. She does her economic activity, selling furniture, with her husband. The loan will be used to buy a motorcycle, to which a cart will be attached to move her products.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Blanca Vilma

texts.es: Blanca Vilma M. D. H. resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad con su esposo y sus tres hijos. En el negocio D. Blanca se involucra toda su familia, sus hijos después D. estudiar le ayudan en los procesos D. producción, el negocio D. Blanca es una panadería con ocho años D. existir, la distribución del pan es al por mayor a diversas tiendas D. la colonia y otros lugares cercanos. El crédito que solicita Blanca y su familia, es para poder seguir ampliando su negocio con la compra D. una mayor cantidad D. insumos necesarios para la producción D. pan.
texts.en:
Blanca Vilma M. D. H. lives in the La Libertad department with her husband and three children. In her business she involves all of her family; her kids after studying help her prepare her products. Blanca has a bakery which she has had for eight years, and distributes bread wholesale to different stores in the neighborhood and other nearby places. The loan that Blanca and her family needs will be used to keep enlarging her business by buying a greater quantity of ingredients to produce the bread.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Ketty

texts.es:
Ketty es una mujer muy amigable, tiene 34 años y vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja y padre de sus 5 hijos. 
Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de comestibles de primera necesidad, en un lugar que acondicionó en su misma casa para su bodega. Su esposo adecuó algunas tablas de madera para que le sirvan como andamio, y es donde hoy exhibe sus productos. 
Durante todo este tiempo su bodega se ha hecho muy conocida en su zona; por ello, Ketty se esmera en dar una buena atención a sus clientes, que son principalmente sus vecinos. A veces le piden productos que ella no tiene, y eso le entristece, pero está segura de que con perseverancia y buen trato, su negocio crecerá; pues su mayor anhelo es que su tienda esté llena de toda clase de productos y de ese modo apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. 

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, ella es la presidenta de su banco comunal, y a todos sus compañeros les inculca el cumplimiento de sus cuotas para seguir contando con los créditos. Para hacer realidad sus sueños, Ketty solicita este dinero, el cual invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su bodega.
texts.en:
Ketty is a very friendly woman; she is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her partner and father of her 5 children.

Since two years ago, she sells basic foodstuffs in her home in a place especially made for her small store. Her husband adapted some wood planks to serve as a stand, where she now displays her products.

During this time, her small store has become very well known in her area. Because of this, Ketty works very hard to give her customers, who are mostly her neighbors, the best attention. Sometimes they ask for products that she doesn’t have, and that saddens her but she is sure that with perseverance and courtesy for her customers, her business will grow. Her biggest wish is to have her store full of all types of products and in this way she can help her husband with the household expenses.

This is her second loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) she is the president of her communal bank, and to all of her colleagues she instills in them the need for them to pay all of their quotas on time so they can keep getting loans. To make her dreams come true, Ketty needs this money, which she will invest in buying merchandize for her small store.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandize.

loans.name: Marino

texts.es:
Marino tiene 37 años, es padre de dos hijos, con los que vive en su casa. Él es agricultor, y cada día da un recorrido a sus cultivos de plátanos y café, con la finalidad de estar al pendiente de las enfermedades que pudieran acechar a sus plantas. Él estima muchísimo sus cultivos y está muy contento con el trabajo que realiza
Con mucha frecuencia, Marino machetea los arbustos de sus chacras de plátanos, trabajando desde las 7 de la mañana hasta 5 de la tarde, y en compañía de su esposa siente que el trabajo se hace menos pesado. 
Para esta familia sus dos cultivos le son muy rentables; el café en su temporada, le brinda muy buenas ganancias; pero el plátano cosecha y comercializa todos los fines de semana, y es con lo que compra el alimento para su familia, es por ello que Marino cuida y lo protege sus plantas de las plagas e insectos.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar cada una de sus cuotas para seguir contando con el apoyo de su banco comunal. Marino piensa invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de fertilizantes químicos, para fertilizar sus plantas de plátanos.
texts.en:
Marino is 37 years old and lives at home with his two children. He is a farmer and each day he walks around his banana and coffee crops with the purpose of being attentive of the diseases that could overtake his plants. He is very fond of his crops and is very happy with the work that he does.

Frequently, Marino uses the machete to cut off the shrubs of his small banana farm, and works from 7 in morning to 5 in the evening; with the help of his wife, he feels that the work is less tedious.

For this family, the two crops are very profitable. The coffee in its season gives them very good earnings but the banana crop is sold every weekend and it is with this that he buys food for his family. Because of this, Marino takes such good care of his plants to protect them against infestations and insects.

This is his second loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and he is committed to pay every one of his quotas so that he can keep the support of his communal bank. Marino will use the money to buy chemical fertilizers to fertilize his banana plants.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Las Golondrinas Group

texts.es: El grupo "Las Golondrinas" esta represen por la señora Fatima  y conformada por 12 miembros que cursan su primer ciclo a pesar D. ello ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que trabajaron antes en un grupo anterior por lo que decidieron conformar un grupo nuevo y renovado. Sus integrantes tienen su negocio como la venta comida, ropa, servicio mecánico, D. transporte público y a la producción y elaboración D. pan. El comercio en este grupo es muy variado, su nivel D. ventas es muy bueno, teniendo buena rentabilidad y capacidad D. pago a pesar D. existir bastante competencia.  El crédito esta destinado al incremento D. su capital, esperan mejorar sus ventas  y el crédito será invertido en la compra D. más mercadería que será utilizado para generar mayores ganancia para poder otorgarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida y un futuro mas prometedor a sus hijos que son su razón para seguir adelante. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia los socios ya trabajaron atentes en instituciones financieras similares a la Fundación Agrocapital a la que están muy agradecidos por la confianza y el apoyo económico brindado.
texts.en:
The "Las Golondrinas" (The Swallows) group is maD. up of 12 members who are in their first loan cycle although they have worked with communal groups before and decided to form a new, renewed group; they are led by Fatima. The members are involved in various commercial activities like: food and clothing sales, bread baking, public transportation, vehicle repairs. Their commerce is varied, has good sales, good profits, and good ability to repay despite heavy competition. The financing will be used to increase working capital; they hope to improve sales and the funds will be used to buy more merchandise which will be used to generate higher profits to be able to proviD. their families with a better quality of life and a more promissing future for their children, who are their main reason to continue forward. With regard to credit history, they have worked previously with financial institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital and they are grateful to it for the confidence and economic help granted.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Karina Marilyn

texts.es:
La señora  KARINA MARILYN C. A. tiene 28 años, vive en el distrito de MOCHE, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN BORJA. Ella presenta estudios hasta 3ero. de secundaria,  refiere que no pudo continuar estudiando porque sufrió un accidente y luego empezó con rehabilitación, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 8 años de edad quien depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la venta de menús y gaseosas en su casa y con el primer crédito de s/ 300 nuevos soles compro cajas de gaseosas  al por mayor para vender.
Con este crédito de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles comprará cajas de gaseosas y productos alimenticios como: arroz, azúcar, papas, menestras, fideos, aceite, etc. para la preparación de sus menús.
Karina sueña con tener una bodega en su casa para lo cual esta trabajando arduamente y ahorrando lo máximo posible.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karina Marilyn C. A. is 28 years old and lives in the Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, in Peru. The member belongs to the San Borja Communal Bank. She completed her studies up to her third year of secondary school because she had an accident and later began her rehabilitation. She lives with her partner and has one son who is 8 years old and depends on her financially. The member sells food and sodas from her home and with the first loan of s/ 300 nuevos soles she bought boxes of soft drinks wholesale to sell.

With this loan of s/ 700.00 nuevos soles she will buy boxes of soft drinks and foodstuffs like rice, sugar, potatoes, pottages, spaghetti, oil, etc. to prepare the food. Karina dreams of having a small store in her home which is why is working so had and saving as much as possible.
