Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of soft drinks and foodstuffs like rice, sugar, potatoes, pottages, spaghetti, oil, etc.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario tiene 62 años, está separada de su esposo, tiene 10 hijos, de los cuales sólo uno vive en su casa. Pese a su avanzada edad, trabaja con mucha agilidad macheteando y quitando los arbustos de sus chacras de café y plátanos; posteriormente, laboriosamente con mucho cuidado, abona  solita mata tras mata de café, por ser éste su cultivo preferido porque le permite captar buena cantidad de dinero en los tiempos de  cosecha.
Para la recolección del fruto pide apoyo a sus hijos para la recolección de este grano, puesto que sola no se abastece. A Rosario le gusta trabajar en sus chacras, ya que gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo sus cultivos le dan buenos resultados y con esas ganancias brindó bienestar a todos sus hijos, que hoy son hombres de trabajo.

Este en su segundo crédito con MFP y hace compromisos de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, ya que le gustaría seguir contando con tal apoyo. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Rosario is 62 years old and is separated from her husband; she has 10 children of which only one lives in her home. Despite her advanced age, she works with great skill a machete and cuts the shrubs of her small farms of coffee and banana crops. Subsequently, she works very carefully, as she fertilizes each coffee plant by herself; this is her favorite crop because it allows her to get a good amount of money in harvest time.

To pick the fruit she calls on her children to help her collect the seeds, because she can’t do it all alone. Rosario likes to work in her small farms, since thanks to all of her effort and work her crops give her good results. With the profit she was able to look after her children’s wellbeing and are now men who work.

This is her second loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and pledges to pay her quotas punctually since she would like to keep counting on this assistance. The money she needs will be used to buy chemical fertilizers for her coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Yiyo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Yiyo está conformado por Olga María L. S., Iweth Marveli L. S. y Maritza Marbeli O. L..  Este grupo tiene tres ciclos de estar con Adim con los cuales han levantado su negocio. 

La señora Olga L. S. de 42 años inicio vendiendo helados y hoy en día ha diversificado su negocio comercializando ropa, zapatos, helados y leña. Ella dese a aprovecha esta fiestas navideñas e invertir más en  ropa y zapatos.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Iweth Marveli L. S. tiene una pequeña venta donde comercializa granos básicos, café, jabones, tomates, cebolla, chiltoma, huevo y sopas instantáneas. Mientras Maritza Marbeli O. L. de 20 años, esta joven madre de un niño de 2 años y en espera de su segundo hijo desde muy tempranas horas se prepara para salir a vender pan.
texts.en:
The Yiyo group is comprised of Olga María L. S., Iweth Marveli L. S. y Maritza Marbeli O. L.. This group has gotten loans from Adim (Kiva’s field partner) three times and it has helped them to pick up their respective businesses.

Mrs. Olga L. S. is 42 years old and began selling ice cream, today she has diversified her business by selling clothing, shoes, ice cream and firewood. She wishes to take advantage of the Christmas festivities and sell more clothing and shoes.

The other members of the group: Iweth Marveli L. S. has a small store where she sells basic household goods like coffee, soap, tomatoes, onions, chiltoma (sweet pepper), eggs and instantaneous soup. While Maritza Marbeli O. L., who is 20 years old is a young mother of a 2 year old boy and is awaiting her second son and she goes out to sell bread very early in the morning.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder tiene 25 años, vive con su pareja y madre de único hijo.	Edad, estado civil, miembros de su familia. Él se dedica a la siembra de plátanos, café y frejol, en chacras alquiladas, por las que paga al año entre 400 a 800 soles, dependiendo del área que utilice. Wilder cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa para sus cultivos, de ese modo su trabajo se hace más llevadero. Es así que por muy complicado que sea su labor, disfruta de su actividad, puesto que sabe que gracias a su dedicación obtendrá buenas cosechas. 
Su cultivo preferido y el más rentable es el frejol, el cual una vez cosechado lo comercializa en los puestos de uno del mercado de su localidad, donde la pagan el precio real con el que mantiene a su familia.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y en todo este tiempo demostró ser puntual en sus pagos, asimismo, para este ciclo, se somete a la misma responsabilidad. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Wilder is 25 years old and lives with his partner and mother of his only son. He sows banana, coffee, and beans in small rented farms, which he pays per year 400 to 800 soles, depending on which area he uses. Wilder has the support of his wife when tending to the crops, which makes work more bearable. It is because of this that despite how complicated his work is, he enjoys it and knows that thanks to his dedication he will have a good harvest.

His preferred crop is beans because he is able to sell it once it has been harvested and sells it in a store near his home where they pay him the actual price of the crop and he is able to provide for his family.

This is his second loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) in all this time, he has shown to be punctual in his payments and commits to do it this time as well. The money he needs will be used to buy chemical fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Maripositas Group

texts.es: El banco comuna "Maripositas" esta representado por la señora Abdolia y conformada por 13 miembros residentes del barrio la Esperanza que va cursando su primer ciclo con muchas expectativas para el futuro y ganas D. trabajar. Cada una D. las socias posee un pequeño negocio como la venta D. cosméticos por catálogos, servicio eléctrico, servicio D. limpieza y lavandería, confección D. prendas D. vestir y al servicio D. transporte los cuales desean hacer crecer para poder brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. La competencia en su ámbito D. trabajo no es muy competitivo pero desean obtener un mayor beneficio en sus negocios es por esta razón que requieren del préstamo para la adquisición D. insumos, materiales y herramientas para realizar un trabajo mas eficiente y D. mejor calidad. En cuanto a al experiencia en grupos solidarios una gran mayoría D. los socios ya cuenta con experiencia en instituciones similares pero ninguna le brindo el apoyo y la confianza que le otorga la fundación para progresar y salir adelante en sus proyectos D. crecimiento y así darles una mejor calidad D. vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Maripositas" (Little Butterflies) communal bank consists of 13 members, led by Abdolia, who live in the La Esperanza neighborhood. They are in their first loan cycle and have great expectations for the future and willingness to work. Each of the members has a small business such as, catalogue cosmetics sales, electric service, cleaning and laundry service, clothing making, and transportation services. They hope to make them all grow in order to proviD. their families with a better quality of life. Competition in their areas of interest isn't very strong but they want to gain a larger benefit from their business so they need financing to purchase raw material, merchandise, and tools to make their work more efficient and of better quality. Most of the members have prior experience with credit management since they have worked with similar institutions but none have offered the trust and support which the foundation has to progress and get ahead with their growth projects to give their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: María Del Transito

texts.es: María Del Transito M. D. E. resiD. en San Martin municipio  del departamento D. San Salvador. María tiene 59 años D. edad vive con su esposo y su hijo Ricardo D. 16 años D. edad, estudiante. Hace once años que María se dedica a su negocio donD. comercializa ropa, perfumes, cremas corporales, entre otros; las ventas D. María son D. manera ambulante a colonias y pueblos, donD. va ofreciendo D. sus productos casa por casa, ahora ella esta solicitando D. un crédito para poder incrementar su inventario.
texts.en:
María Del Transito M. D. E. is a resident of the town of San Martin in the department of San Salvador. She is 59 years old and lives with her husband and 16 year old son Ricardo, who is a student. For 11 years, María has been operating a business selling clothing, perfumes, body crèmes, and other products. She sells her products as a traveling merchant to different neighborhoods and villages where she presents her merchandise door-to-door. María is requesting a loan so that she can increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 32 years old and married with three school-aged children. He hawks (goes door-to-door) various items, like radios, calculators, rechargeable flashlights, and padlocks. He has been making his living this way for five years and previously worked for a large company. He is now requesting a loan of Kes 20,000 to add stock that is targeted for the festive season in December.

Joseph describes himself as a humble, understanding, social businessman and family-man. Since joining Faulu, he says that he has become empowered, especially in terms of saving money. In the future, he hopes to be established, experienced and able to import his own goods.

loans.use: To add stock for the festive season

loans.name: 4 De Septiembre Group

texts.es: El grupo “4 D. Septiembre” esta representado por la señora Nona y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales tienen cuentan con sus propios negocios D. venta D. productos como comida como hamburguesas en la plaza, refrescos, empanadas cosméticos por catálogos, servicio D. soldadura y transporte publico La competencia en su ámbito D. trabajo no es muy competitivo pero desean obtener un mayor beneficio en sus negocios es por esta razón que requieren del préstamo para la adquisición D. insumos, materiales y herramientas para realizar un trabajo mas eficiente y D. mejor calidad. En cuanto a al experiencia en grupos solidarios una gran mayoría D. los socios ya cuenta con experiencia en instituciones similares pero ninguna le brindo el apoyo y la confianza que le otorga la fundación para progresar y salir adelante en sus proyectos D. crecimiento y así darles una mejor calidad D. vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
The "4 D. Septiembre" group is maD. up of 12 members, led by Nona, who have their own businesses consisting of such things as: sales of hamburgers in the square, sales of turnovers, catalogue cosmetic sales, welding services, and public transportation. They don't have much competition but still want to reap higher benefits from their work so they need financing to purchase ingredients, materials and tools to make their work more efficient and of higher quality. Most of the members have prior experience with credit management since they have worked with similar financial institutions but none of them offered the support and trust that the foundation has for their progress and to get ahead with their growth projects aiming at providing their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es: El banco comuna "Las Rosas" esta representado por la señora Carla Daniela y conformada por 12 miembros entusiastas y con ganas D. trabajar los cuales cuentan con sus puestos D. venta D. productos como comida al paso, cosméticos por catalogo y abarrotes en general y a la venta D. ropa. La competencia en la venta D. abarrotes es alta y como son productos perecederos deben disponer D. capital para adquirir insumos y mercadería para ofrecerlos a un precio mas bajo y si se pasa la fecha tope D. sus productos tener capital para poder cambiar D. mercadería a tiempo; esta es la razón D. la obtención del préstamo para una gran mayoría D. las socias el obtener un capital D. apoyo para situaciones imprevista y para incrementar sus ventas abaratando costos al por mayo. En cuanto a al experiencia en grupos solidarios una gran mayoría D. los socios ya cuenta con experiencia en instituciones similares pero ninguna le brindo el apoyo y la confianza que le otorga la fundación para progresar y salir adelante en sus proyectos D. crecimiento y así darles una mejor calidad D. vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
The Las Rosas Communal Bank, represented by Ms. Carla Daniela, is comprised of 12 enthusiastic group members who have the desire to work and who have their own sales stands, selling street food, cosmetics by catalog, provisions, and apparel. There is fierce competition in selling provisions, and because of all their perishable items, sellers must have capital readily available so that they can obtain more goods at a lower price to replace the expired goods in a timely manner. For this reason, most of the members really need this loan so that they can have capital for any exigencies that may arise and so that they can increase their sales by offering wholesale prices. In terms of experience with solidarity groups, most of the members have previously worked with institutes similar to this one, but none has ever given them the support and trust that Fundación gives them so that they can make progress with their plans to grow, thus giving their family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mónica Luz

texts.es:
Mónica es una madre de familia de 20 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de año y medio de edad en casa de sus padres, ubicada en Puerto Malabrigo, distrito de Rázuri, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 10 meses de dedica a la venta de ceviche en una esquina cercana a la playa. Anteriormente sólo vendía este plato los días domingo durante la temporada de verano. Pero ahora que tiene un hijo y que junto a su esposo desean terminar de establecerse como familia se está dedicando a vender su producto de lunes a viernes.

El pescado es comprado por su madre en el terminal pesquero de la ciudad de Trujillo. Mónica prepara los platos y los ofrece hasta el mediodía, por la tarde vende diversos dulces en el mismo lugar (mazamorra, arroz con leche, dulces típicos del país). Su buena sazón y su trato amable han hecho que su negocio sea muy visitado por sus habituales clientes.

Su esposo trabaja eventualmente como obrero de construcción y con estos ingresos están sacando adelante a su joven familia. Debido a la constante demanda de sus clientes Mónica desea ampliar su negocio por lo que está solicitando por primera vez  Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para utlizarlos en la compra de una carreta donde pueda ofrecer sus productos con mayor comodidad.

Su más grande anhelo es poder instalar una cebichería y construir su casa propia, ella es una mujer trabajadora y muy resposnable.
texts.en:
Mónica is a 20 year old mother who lives with her husband and one and a half year old son in her parent’s home, located in Puerto Malabrigo, Rázuri district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, located 3.5 hours from Chiclayo city. For 10 months she has been selling ceviche on a corner near the beach. Previously she only sold this dish on Sundays during the summer. But now she has a son and along with her husband they wish to establish themselves as a family so she is selling this product Monday through Friday. The fish is purchased by her mother in the fish market in Trujillo city. Mónica prepares the dishes and sells them until midday, in the afternoon she sells a variety of sweets in the same place (pudding, rice pudding and typical sweets of her country). Her good seasoning and customer services have made her business frequently visited by her steady customers. Her husband works as a construction worker and with these incomes they are making ends meet for their young family. Due to the constant demand of her customers Mónica wishes to expand her business so she is seeking her first loan for 1000 nuevos soles with Edpyme Alternativa to be used to buy a cart where she can offer her products with greater comfort. Her greatest wish is to be able to open a ceviche café and build her own home. She is a very hard working and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a mobile cart to sell ceviche

location.town: Puerto Malabrigo - Rázuri - Ascope - La Libertad

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 26 years old and has a business selling new clothes and towels. She has been in business for three years and previously worked at Nakumatt (a supermarket). She says her sales are seasonal but manageable. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to increase her inventory.

Since becoming a member of Faulu, Beth says that she has become economically empowered and learned skills on how best to run her business. She describes herself as a humble hardworking young lady with an ambition to make ends meet in life. In the future, she hopes to be married, become a mother, own an exhibition shop, and expand into wholesale supply.

loans.use: To add clothes stock
